story:
Dungelot has simple, deep gameplay without difficult controls. Its a game about exploring dungeons, fighting monsters and grabbing loot;-)
 
Endless gameplay thanks to the automatic generation of a dungeon.

A simple game mechanics does not require a long period of analysis, the gameplay is designed for short play session (3-10 minutes).

A huge number of monsters generated by the pit itself.(Mosquito-мозгосос just gives us shock and awe)

The showdown with the guardians of the dungeons. (Bosses)

The abundance of random elements: if you are over the whole game on his head fall brick and you will not run into an ambush of the trolls, then it is a supernatural luck;-)

5 playable characters with their own advantages and disadvantages.
Achievement system.

Influence of the character and mood of the character on his condition.

Simple and intuitive combat system, where victory is achieved not only by brute force, but also understanding the enemy ( paladin more effective fight against the evil spirits, and the magic of water potent against the fiery creatures )

Caches and closed the door which can hide as countless treasures and dangerous enemies.

The list could go on...but it will be better to see once;-)
 


Will be available for iOS and android platforms, but you can download 
PC and mac demos:

http://dungelot.com/download/dungelotPC.zip

http://dungelot.com/download/dungelotMAC.zip

story:
Bravado Gaming is more than just an e-sports team or organization. Bravado Gaming falls under the Bravado Universe. This brand has a clear call to action for gamers and enthusiasts all around the world and that is the zero-to-hero story that we try portray in every sense of the phrase. We’re more than just a team, but a way of life. A story that evolves from an e-sports organization to produce and create powerful individuals on their way to the successes of life. This is the Bravado way.

The zero-to-hero story that we’d been working on during the course of 2017, was Project Destiny. Project Destiny would see a team (our CS:GO division) of 6 South African individuals embark on a journey to tell a story to the world by relocating to the United States of America to compete on one of the highest professional e-sports levels in the world.

In February 2018, the dream became a reality and our boys set off for Phoenix, Arizona of which they would live and play in a variety of e-sports qualifiers and leagues from the house. One of the main reasons and security was the invite from ESEA to compete in a season within the Main Division. Now we know that the Main Division isn’t the greatest of them all (being the 3rd best division at the time, and now the 4th) but we knew we’d have to work our way up the ladder while simultaneously competing in a variety of other qualifiers for events and leagues. The staff, management and players of Bravado Gaming were ready to take on a challenge that very few would sacrifice in order to turn a dream into a reality.
 

 

FEBRUARY - MARCH 2018

To cut the long story short, the Bravado CS:GO squad moved to Phoenix, Arizona and started competing in the ESEA Main Division while playing a variety of other qualifiers. Eventually, the team went on to win the ESEA Main Division which saw a promotion for the squad into the ESEA MDL League. We found lots of success within ESEA, but nothing yet in the form of other qualifiers and leagues... at least not yet. We knew that our presence in the region was in the early stages of reaching our goal, but this was a start, which would hopefully see fruition come in the form of success.

 

APRIL 2018

As time went by, our players slowly but surely proved their worth and potential of which then, all players were invited to play in the FaceIt Pro League while the team slowly but surely started being recognized by a variety of e-sports athletes, personalities and media. One of our highlights here is when we qualified for the ESL Belo Horizonte Closed Qualifier after beating (at the time) the worlds #15 – Team Renegades.

During this time we were also just a top 150 team in the world. You can read about the success of our Belo Horizonte progress on HLTV here.

 

JUNE - JULY 2018

During this period, the squad went on to come out victorious in the ESEA MDL (Mountain Dew League), being one of the only few teams (never-mind being a team outside of the USA) winning back-to-back ESEA Seasons. By this time, the players and team were being recognized even more, making a variety of closed qualifiers and being invited to a couple at the same time. Things really started looking up from every perspective at this point in time.

Within the month of July, the squad had headed back to South Africa for a short player break before heading back to the United States of America to continue competing in the Mountain Dew League. The reason for competing in the MDL again was due to the fact that the previous season was not a promotional one. If it was, the team would be returning back to the USA to compete in the ESL Pro League – the highest possible league in the ESL/ESEA series you can achieve, boasting only the best of the best teams in the world.

While the team headed back to South Africa, our manager and coach, Tiaan T.C Coertzen stayed behind as we initiated a move from Phoenix, Arizona to Austin, Texas. At the time, making this move was a tough one as we were in some financial trouble, and because of this reason we exceeded our budgets and made use of our personal finances in order to make the move a reality. Some may ask why we made the move and I can tell you that there was a variety of reasons (some of which I cannot mention) but all-in-all, we thought the move to Texas would be a much better hub to compete from, as we all know, Texas is booming with investment and opportunity in the e-sports scene.

 

AUGUST - SEPTEMBER 2018

Our player break was cut short when we received an invite to the Chicago Intel Extreme Masters Closed Qualifier (this is very rare in our situation at the time) and we had no choice in a matter of 2 days to book flights (of which were super expensive and once again, put us into financial troubles for the quarter) to get the guys back to the USA to compete in the event. And off the team went to one of their first major invited closed qualifiers... So much had happened during these months and things were getting stronger and better as we gained more and more popularity, making more and more friends and being recognized and given respect to after making a variety of Closed Qualifiers.

More importantly, the teams that we had beaten in these open and closed qualifiers were some of the highest rated in the region, for example: beating teams such as E-UNITED, Renegades, Dignitas, Mythic and various other teams in a variety of these qualifiers. By now, the respect for what we set out to achieve started booming with popularity, especially the support coming from back home!

Every time, we made a closed qualifier, we were just so short of making it to the offline finals, but we kept our heads up, persevered and pushed harder than ever. We knew we couldn’t give up now, regardless of our financial situation or our status in the USA. We couldn’t disappoint.

 

THE PRESENT

We continued playing the next MDL League but unfortunately we were knocked out in the playoffs, however, this doesn’t mean that we couldn’t re-enter next season (January 2019) but it just meant that we had to try and win it again to make our way into the ESL Pro League. We also acknowledged that if we were to place in the top 2 of the playoffs, we wouldn’t be able to attend the South Africa WESG (China) qualifiers, as we would be at the MDL LAN during the same dates as the finals.

In the months of November and December, we experienced something and felt something of which the world woke up to. Things happened so fast, to the extent that we just couldn’t keep up with what was going on. The team went on to take part in the prestigious Dreamhack Winter 2018 North American qualifiers, besting their teams in their way and making it to yet, another, closed qualifier. However, things this time were different as we saw a Bravado unleash and explode after months and months of preparation, perseverance and improvement.

The team qualified for the Dreamhack Winter 2018 Closed Qualifier and saw 1 spot being given to the victor after an intense run in the open qualifiers. BOOM, finally, we made it past the closed qualifier besting Pro League Teams (and some of the best teams in the world) such as Luminosity, Rogue and INTZ to finally (AND FINALLY) find a spot at an offline event. We were going to Dreamhack Winter 2018 and the world was astonished at our achievement of making such a prestigious event. The support and perseverance finally paid off, but we weren’t satisfied just yet. While you're at it, read some of the interviews and stories HLTV conducted on us here and here.

Right after the our qualification into the Dreamhack Winter 2018 main event in Sweden, the boys first came back to South Africa (we had flights booked for them to come back during this time) – simultaneously the WESG South African qualifiers were taking place (stage 1) at this time.

The team went on to play the first stage of the WESG qualifiers, making it into the second stage later on in December and while we were obtaining our VISA’s, things just fell perfectly into place where we could attend Dreamhack Winter 2018 and return to South Africa to complete the WESG qualifiers of which we worked our way into the semi-finals in phase 1. The team took off for Sweden a few days earlier prior to the competition, to make sure that they adjust to jet-lag, the environment and most importantly to boot-camp in Jonkoping. Again, this was an additional and personal expense to get the guys to get as much preparation before entering the Arena at this prestigious event.

Finally the day came and the guys wouldn’t know what to expect as they were placed in the group of death alongside some very, very strong names. The competition began, the amount of negative comments from both professionals and trolls of how we would be dominated started. We didn’t care and knew that we were there to do the very best that we could, but most importantly to add value to the story we’ve been trying to build for so long. We went into the group stage with nothing to lose, but what I can tell you is that we entered with confidence and hunger to prove the negatives, wrong.

As I write this, I notice my body fills up with goosebumps as every part of every game had a story within itself.  The Bravado Gaming CS:GO squad went on to top their group at the prestigious event by beating the likes of Optic Gaming and then G2 Esports – names, players and organizations who live within the millions of followers, within the best teams in the world – but we were there to show that the giants could be taken down. What a moment for e-sports. What a moment for Bravado Gaming. What a moment for the story to be told. Read more about this here.

After besting Optic Gaming and G2 Esports and topping our group we progressed to the semi-finals of the event, up against the home team of X6tence. Although our support was limited in the crowd, fans were cheering us on, online, in the chats, on websites, through media, messages and posts and we knew  that this was do-or-die time. If there was ever a time to make a point, it was now. Bravado went on to beat the home squad and earning ourselves in the GRAND FINALS of the Dreamhack Winter 2018 event, going up against the strong ENCE. Read more about this victory here.

Although we didn’t manage to best ENCE, falling to them in the Grand Finals and placing 2nd at the main event, we knew that this was a start to something massive. We knew that this would open eyes and turn heads to the point where a certain belief from the powers of above would recognize the potential and of course, the story. We ended up 2nd at Dreamhack Winter 2018 – an event that no-one would have expected us to do well in – never mind actually making it to the event.

 

After the completion of Dreamhack, the team returned back to South Africa to complete the 2nd stage of the WESG finals of which the victor would gain entrance into the main event in 2019 of which was taking place in China with a massive and staggering prize pool. The team went on to win the qualifier, securing their spot after an intense few days of rest, just returning back from Sweden but it doesn’t stop there... While the team was in-flight back to South Africa to play the final stage of the WESG qualifiers, we received an e-mail from Dreamhack India, personally inviting the squad to play at their main event invitational and without any doubt, we’re in no position right now to deny such massive invites. We accepted. Read more about this here.

Dreamhack Winter, Dreamhack India, WESG – it all got so overwhelming (but that good type of overwhelming)– all this craziness in matter of weeks didn’t end there. Immediately after the team won the WESG qualifiers in South Africa, off they went back to their house in Austin, Texas on Monday the  10th of December. Why? Because they had qualified for the ESL Intel Extreme Masters (IEM) Katowice Minor Closed Qualifiers. They had to play the day after they arrived in the USA, completely jet-lagged once again and suffering with flu from all the change of weather. The team got their days rest and got ready to urgently compete in the closed qualifier they made previously. This was so important because how it works is that if they qualified for the Minor in Poland (Katowice) then they would stand a chance to compete for the Major and let me tell you this: This will be the biggest Major (according to various sources) for CS:GO to date.

Tired with flu and jet-lagged the team played their first match-up on December the 12th and unfortunately losing their first match-up, dropping down into the losers bracket. We can’t imagine that this would be easy based on the circumstances we went through in the past couple of weeks. They got up, they fought hard and the boys pushed through the loser bracket beating Luminosity (once again, with a much stronger line-up), Singularity and finally Test Takers to secure themselves a spot at the ESL Intel Extreme Masters Minor Main Event to take place in early January 2019 in Katowice, Poland. Read more about this here.

Coming back to the Dreamhack India story: Again, to cut the long story short, the team made way to Mumbai, India where they competed in the Dreamhack India 2018 Invitational securing 1st spot, winning the tournament and making waves throughout a region we've never competed in. You can read more about our success at Dreamhack India by heading over to HLTV.ORG here.

In a matter of weeks we came 2nd at Dreamhack Winter Sweden, won the South African WESG Qualifiers for China, won the Dreamhack India Invitational and made it into the IEM Katowice Minor. Finally, we started seeing some light and our new and old fans started to cheer for the success of the team, making hype through micro and mass media. Telling that story that we started. Throughout the months we’ve achieved a-lot, through the highs and the low’s and through times of tears and times of happiness, but what matters is this: The future is bright and this team of individuals have proven and more importantly, worked SO HARD to show what you can create from nothing.

 

PROJECT DESTINY MAY COME TO AN END

Throughout our highs and lows and our recent achievements, we've been working so hard (behind closed doors) the entire year to ensure that the success of the team goes unnoticed to potential corporates, investors and brands. During this time we've been in chats and negotiations with multiple companies (endemic and non-endemic) in order to secure additional funding to ensure that there is no risk of ending this story anytime soon as having to pay for Travel, Rent, Utilities, Allowances, Food, Vehicle, VISA's (and more) has been super costly.

In addition, we've been working on acquiring O1/P1 Sporting VISA's for the players, however, we haven't been able to achieve this goal (as we cannot establish a sponsorship in the USA) which gives threat to our players each and every-time they enter the USA.

As an organization, we've entered into much debt, pushing hard and strong day-by-day, month-by-month to make sure that we can keep our dream alive of becoming one of the best e-sports call-to-actions the world has seen.

Sacrifices have been made by Bravado Gaming as well as the players and directors of the organization, and due to the lack of additional funding and increased debt to support the players in the USA (which also affects the acquiring of P1/O1 VISA's) we've had no choice but to make the call and bring the Bravado Gaming CS:GO squad back to South Africa at the end of January 2019 after the Katowice Minor.

During now and then we will keep pushing as hard as we can to ensure that somehow, someway, we may find more finance which will keep this dream alive, allowing the zero-to-hero story continue and keep inspiring gamers throughout the world.

 

WE NEED YOUR HELP

By surviving another quarter (February, March & April) this gives us an additional 3 months to try and conclude any future and potential partnerships that will allow us to continue competing on the International map in the United States of America. 

Because of this reason we've had no choice but to ask for your help in allowing us the opportunity to try and survive in the upcoming quarter and hence we've created a fund-raising campaign to seek any potential help that may exist out there, one way or another.

We've included the costs of keeping our team in the USA for an additional 3 months below, for your information. This doesn't include any content/production costs, general operational costs, VISA costs, additional house costs and a few other costs.

By allowing our team to stay another 3 months in the USA, this will allow us to:

  • Continue competing in qualifiers and events.
  • Gain practice for the upcoming qualified events such as the IEM Major (if we qualify at the Minor) & the WESG.
  • Continue playing in the next season of the ESEA Mountain Dew League.
  • Allow us the opportunity to find additional funding from partners/sponsors in the duration of those 3 months.
  • Give us the opportunity to try and obtain our P1 Sporting VISA's.
  • Continue telling our story and struggle of trying to become one of the best teams in the world.

If the image shown above is not clear, you can check a zoomed in image by heading over here.

 

MOVING FORWARD

As mentioned previously, any help and support of any interested parties wanting to partner up with Bravado Gaming, please, please do not hesitate to contact us via e-mail here. Alternatively, please do not hesitate to add Vasili Girasis (CBDO of Bravado Gaming) or myself on Linked IN here and here as we can make a variety of Decks, POE's, ROI's and offerings available through our interactive documents and reports. Spread the word and help us find our feet to ensuring the continued success of what has taken us so many years to build!

We cannot express how grateful we are for all the support that we've received from our fellow South Africans, our new friends in the USA and people across the globe. The future is bright and they say, where there is a will, there is a way and this is why we won't give up in becoming one of the best e-sports teams and brands in the world, of which one was established on the continent of Africa.

Again, on behalf of Bravado Gaming, its players, staff and management we thank you for all your support and your continued support.

Coming back to the Dreamhack India story: Again, to cut the long story short, the team made way to Mumbai, India where they competed in the Dreamhack India 2018 Invitational securing 1st spot, winning the tournament and making waves throughout a region we've never competed in. You can read more about our success at Dreamhack India by heading over to HLTV.ORG here.
In a matter of weeks we came 2nd at Dreamhack Winter Sweden, won the South African WESG Qualifiers for China, won the Dreamhack India Invitational and made it into the IEM Katowice Minor. Finally, we started seeing some light and our new and old fans started to cheer for the success of the team, making hype through micro and mass media. Telling that story that we started. Throughout the months we’ve achieved a-lot, through the highs and the low’s and through times of tears and times of happiness, but what matters is this: The future is bright and this team of individuals have proven and more importantly, worked SO HARD to show what you can create from nothing.

 
PROJECT DESTINY MAY COME TO AN END
Throughout our highs and lows and our recent achievements, we've been working so hard (behind closed doors) the entire year to ensure that the success of the team goes unnoticed to potential corporates, investors and brands. During this time we've been in chats and negotiations with multiple companies (endemic and non-endemic) in order to secure additional funding to ensure that there is no risk of ending this story anytime soon as having to pay for Travel, Rent, Utilities, Allowances, Food, Vehicle, VISA's (and more) has been super costly.
In addition, we've been working on acquiring O1/P1 Sporting VISA's for the players, however, we haven't been able to achieve this goal (as we cannot establish a sponsorship in the USA) which gives threat to our players each and every-time they enter the USA.

As an organization, we've entered into much debt, pushing hard and strong day-by-day, month-by-month to make sure that we can keep our dream alive of becoming one of the best e-sports call-to-actions the world has seen.
Sacrifices have been made by Bravado Gaming as well as the players and directors of the organization, and due to the lack of additional funding and increased debt to support the players in the USA (which also affects the acquiring of P1/O1 VISA's) we've had no choice but to make the call and bring the Bravado Gaming CS:GO squad back to South Africa at the end of January 2019 after the Katowice Minor.
During now and then we will keep pushing as hard as we can to ensure that somehow, someway, we may find more finance which will keep this dream alive, allowing the zero-to-hero story continue and keep inspiring gamers throughout the world.
 
WE NEED YOUR HELP
By surviving another quarter (February, March & April) this gives us an additional 3 months to try and conclude any future and potential partnerships that will allow us to continue competing on the International map in the United States of America. 
Because of this reason we've had no choice but to ask for your help in allowing us the opportunity to try and survive in the upcoming quarter and hence we've created a fund-raising campaign to seek any potential help that may exist out there, one way or another.
We've included the costs of keeping our team in the USA for an additional 3 months below, for your information. This doesn't include any content/production costs, general operational costs, VISA costs, additional house costs and a few other costs.
By allowing our team to stay another 3 months in the USA, this will allow us to:

Continue competing in qualifiers and events.
Gain practice for the upcoming qualified events such as the IEM Major (if we qualify at the Minor) & the WESG.
Continue playing in the next season of the ESEA Mountain Dew League.
Allow us the opportunity to find additional funding from partners/sponsors in the duration of those 3 months.
Give us the opportunity to try and obtain our P1 Sporting VISA's.
Continue telling our story and struggle of trying to become one of the best teams in the world.


If the image shown above is not clear, you can check a zoomed in image by heading over here.
 
MOVING FORWARD
As mentioned previously, any help and support of any interested parties wanting to partner up with Bravado Gaming, please, please do not hesitate to contact us via e-mail here. Alternatively, please do not hesitate to add Vasili Girasis (CBDO of Bravado Gaming) or myself on Linked IN here and here as we can make a variety of Decks, POE's, ROI's and offerings available through our interactive documents and reports. Spread the word and help us find our feet to ensuring the continued success of what has taken us so many years to build!

We cannot express how grateful we are for all the support that we've received from our fellow South Africans, our new friends in the USA and people across the globe. The future is bright and they say, where there is a will, there is a way and this is why we won't give up in becoming one of the best e-sports teams and brands in the world, of which one was established on the continent of Africa.
Again, on behalf of Bravado Gaming, its players, staff and management we thank you for all your support and your continued support.

story:
The Lan Houses are part of our recent history. But does the history of this kind of enterprise bring lessons for our own business?

They started in South Korea in 1996, the same time when gyms began to turn a trend as well.

In Brazil the thing started in 1998, up to speed by our standards. And few types of enterprises grew so fast and spread throughout the country.

In 2008, according to the Internet Steering Committee in Brazil, 52% of Brazilians used this type of establishment.

story:
My Goal

  • I am a college art student and beginner game designer hoping to get my start creating video games for people to enjoy
  • My living situation does not afford the further luxury of the license for the software I need to complete my project, and I'd rather not take the route of piracy to get the job done. The opportunity to create interactive experiences that other people may enjoy is my reason for pursuing this.
  • This campaign will help me further pursue my goals in life and hopefully achieve what has been my dream for a long time.
  • The license itself costs $100, so immediately that's where 1/5 of the initial goal is going to. The remainder will go towards living costs for me and my pet during the time, as well as furthering my education especially by taking care of any other college expenses like textbooks and fees.
  • Donators will all receive a copy of the completed game prior to release. In addition I can release a compilation of concept art exclusive to people who donate. Some donators will also have their name credited if they'd like. The campaign is small, and so I can't really do much.
  • If I don't reach the $500 goal but still manage $100, then I will purchase the license and continue my work. All who help achieve that will still be rewarded as mentioned.

My Goal

I am a college art student and beginner game designer hoping to get my start creating video games for people to enjoy
My living situation does not afford the further luxury of the license for the software I need to complete my project, and I'd rather not take the route of piracy to get the job done. The opportunity to create interactive experiences that other people may enjoy is my reason for pursuing this.
This campaign will help me further pursue my goals in life and hopefully achieve what has been my dream for a long time.


The license itself costs $100, so immediately that's where 1/5 of the initial goal is going to. The remainder will go towards living costs for me and my pet during the time, as well as furthering my education especially by taking care of any other college expenses like textbooks and fees.
Donators will all receive a copy of the completed game prior to release. In addition I can release a compilation of concept art exclusive to people who donate. Some donators will also have their name credited if they'd like. The campaign is small, and so I can't really do much.
If I don't reach the $500 goal but still manage $100, then I will purchase the license and continue my work. All who help achieve that will still be rewarded as mentioned.

story:
What is ZµC Proto Board?

ZµC Proto Board is a perfboard/protoboard that combined through-hole and SMD pads, so you can freely put through-hole and/or SMD components on this board. ZµC Proto Board also has micro USB and Male USB type-A populated, that will make powering prototype easier.

2 in 1 - Fit almost SMD and through hole components

So from now on you can forget about buying SOIC breakout boards, because you can put almost any SOIC components and also most SMD components on this board.

Ultra low cost prototyping

With this protoboard you can also reduce your electronic waste by reusing the components for your prototype or project.

Non-through hole

This board utilizes non-plated through hole pads. This mean pad on different layer is independent, so you can do double-side wiring, enabling you to build more complex circuits with the smallest dimension you can get.

Powering prototype never been easier than this

        

Now days micro-USB can be found on almost any smartphone, so you can easily power up your project with your phone charger.

  • With micro USB : just plug your phone charger to your prototype.
  • With A Male type USB : cut and plug directly to your USB port.*
* with a little hack/modification.
Double ISP port for your microcontroller

Because it's somewhat pain to trace the ISP pin to your project, This board is equipped with two ISP ports to easily program your microcontroller project.  With two ISP port you can split up the board to your demands size.

Two variant of thickness

This proto board comes with two variant, the thin one (0.8mm) and the thick one (ordinary PCB size).

The thin one is easily cut, designedfor small project and lightweight projects/prototypes.

The thick one is more robust and more rigid, designed for heavy task involving hard friction and collision potential.

Booster version
This booster convert  from 0.7V to 5.3V-5.4V but we recommended to drain at least from 0.9V (3.3V is highly recommended). Because some devices need 5V to operate, such as micro or standard servo, or charge your single LiPo battery. For double layer version you also get SMD LED Tester, but for the single layer you have to stack the board to get a working booster.*

* we'll show how to stack the single layer booster version 
* SMD LED tester doesn't include resistor, you have to manually add the resistor to make it works.

Arduino shield version

As we know Arduino headers use non-standard pin spacing. Learn to deal with it, as there’s too many Arduino shields in production to have any hope for a change in the future. This protoboard should make it a lot of easier to design your own boards.

So don't waste your Arduino shield to be used in your prototype, or even more, you can make your own Arduino board !!

What is in ZµC Proto Board?

  • All variant of ZµC Proto Board has at least micro USB, schottky diode and capacitor distributed.
  • For booster version has DC booster populated.
  • For Arduino version has reset button populated.


What the difference with another proto board?

No more sawing with thin version


How many type ZµC Proto Board has?

The variant of ZµC Proto Board are combination of single or two layers, non-booster or booster version, and basic or Arduino version :

  • Single layer basic
  • Single layer with booster
  • Single layer Arduino version
  • Single layer Arduino version with booster
  • Double layer basic (thick and thin version)
  • Double layer with booster (thick and thin version)
  • Double layer Arduino version (thick and thin version)
  • Double layer Arduino version with booster (thick and thin version)
* Single layer has no masking, material is FR2
* Double layer is non-through hole, with masking, material is FR4 
* Double layer has two different thicknesses


ZµC Proto Board Specification

- Footprint 

   

  • 1.27 mm pitch.
  • Two line holes breadboard-friendly.
- Power Line

   

   Three power line sources.

- Size

   

   57mm x 89mm (approx)

- Thickness

   Two fariant 0.8mm and 1.6mm.

- Masking

   For double layer only, black solder masking and white silkscreen.

- Non Through Hole

   For double layer only.

- Booster Technical Specification

   

  • Up to 96% typical efficiency.
  • Break-out board able.
  • Enable pin/pad.
  • Short circuit protection.
  • Over temperature protection.
  • Shutdown current (all states) : < 1 μA.
  • Low noise, anti-ringing control.
  • Operates and consumes only 19 μA while operating at no load, and provides a true disconnect from input to output while shut down (EN = GND).
  • A “true” load disconnect mode provides input to output isolation while disabled by removing the normal boost regulator diode path from input to output. A Bypass mode option connects the input to the output using the integrated low resistance P-Channel MOSFET, which provides a low bias keep-alive voltage for circuits operating in Deep Sleep mode. Both options consumeless than 1 μA of input current.

About Booster                                                                                                                                             

ATtiny43U
Yes, almost your microcontroller can powered directly from a 3.7V LiPo. But not for other devices, like servo, or maybe you want to charge your LiPo using 5V LiPo charger from unstable solar cell.  

note : don't used this booster from an unprotected LiPo battery, now days most LiPo batteries has built-in low voltage protection.Use only a single cell LiPo battery to this booster, or other power that below 5.3V.  That's why we put enable-pad so that you can decide when to activate the booster. 

The booster is based on the popular MCP1640. This booster convert 0.7V to 5.3V-5.4V, but we recommended to drain at least from 0.9V (3.3V is highly recommended).  We choose 5.3V-5.4V for many considerations. First, it's still save for most of your 5-volt electronic devices.

Second, you can swap your low power source to USB to this booster, because USB port usually use 5V-5.2V and this booster can only handle input voltage lower than the output voltage (5.3V-5.4V).  

Third, the voltage may drop when you put the diode for your protection circuit or long cable from your source.  This booster doesn't magically squeezing your power supply, so keep in mind to calculate your amperage source to your demand.

After all, you can change the resistor to get your voltage demands, as long the input voltage is lower than the output voltage.


What local community says about this board :

"SMD has never been easier to handle, without the use of additional breakout boards."
"Work with almost any size of SMD components you would work with."
"I'm busy collecting my electronic waste now..."


We said that most SMD can fit into this board. So we try to tear down what SMD package that you can use on this board :




Design revision

- ftdi or plx foot print on Arduino version


Free Perk

* Single layer has no masking, material is FR2 


What We Need & What You Get

The PCB manufacturer have their minimal order quantity, and with mass production plus our PCB manufacturer in Asia, we can press this protoboard price to the ground, so you don't have to worry about thinking in making your project any more.

 as a maker moto "BUILD SOMETHING" 
so we answered "GO AHEAD!"
Because of that,  we choose on fixed funding campaign to meet our goal. 

Our Dream

If we reach our goal, we can provide low cost proto board to the makerspaces around the world. And we can see the impact from this board is that, open-source rapid-prototyping comes true.

And this is also our first campaign, if we reach the goal we promise to come back with another open-source project. So keep your eyes on our Facebook fans page, Twitter, and Youtube.


Risks & Challenges

  • We have low cost local PCB manufacturer that can handle up to 100 PCB everyday, and we are about to ready for mass production.
  • There is some components that must be brought from across the sea like the booster IC, but the rest of the parts is locally available.
  • The quality of this board is really crap and dirty, we cut the board manually by board cutter instead of using CNC, in order to get fast and cheap production. 
  • Our local PCB manufacturer drill the hole manually on single layer board (using CNC for double-layer board), but is still good enough for prototyping.
  • We have some working prototypes, and services from local manufacturer, so we basically don't have any risk. The only problem is that we use reflow oven for soldering, and we check one by one to ensure the board is in good condition before we ship it to you.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help by spread out this campaign to your social media to help this campaign comes true. Because more maker more fun.

story:
Demo Available Now!

For those who prefer PayPal as the payment method, we're now accepting it. Just visit our official page at https://digitalez.cc/olc and choose the available rewards there.

Click to download on Itch.io

One Last Crane demo contains the prologue of the story. Enjoy the beginning of your journey as Yuuki Murakami, trying to find his childhood friend, Saki Nishimura. You’ll also meet the other girls for the first time there!

"One Last Crane" is a visual novel centered on Yuuki Murakami, a boy who has a brain tumor. After a long year of treatment without any positive results, Yuuki asks for his final wish: to return to his hometown and fulfill his promise to meet again with his childhood friend, Saki Nishimura. However, as always, things are hard for him.  

Saki no longer lives where she used to, and no one knows her whereabouts. The last hint Yuuki got was from the high school Saki had said she wanted to attend—Shimizu High School. Together with his adopted little sister, Mary, and his new tomboyish neighbor, Chihiro, Yuuki keeps searching for the girl, only to meet Asuka Fujimoto, the most popular girl at school, who happens to look like Saki.  

Not once has Yuuki doubted that Asuka really is Saki, but Asuka gives him the cold shoulder without admitting that she’s Saki. Could she really be a different person? Faced with the prospect that his life could end soon, Yuuki is determined to find Saki, even within another person.

Shiro Takahashi from Ayato Sound Create is an experienced Japanese composer who has worked for years in the visual novel industry. He will be responsible for composing the original soundtrack in various themes for One Last Crane.

click to listen to music

click to listen to music

click to listen to music

DigitalEZ is an independent game localization, development, and publishing team. We work together with the most talented developers to produce heart-touching games to bring joy to you. Ever since our founding, we've collaborated with several indie developers and helped get their games published, all of which have received very positive reviews. Check all titles from DigitalEZ here:

http://store.steampowered.com/search/?publisher=DigitalEZ

Blissful Work's is a new start-up indie development team that focuses on creating sweet and warm visual novels that can be enjoyed by our international audiences. Our studio is based in Indonesia, but we have people working together from all around the world. Our debut novel, One Last Crane, is a story that is heartwarming and heartbreaking at the same time. Enjoy the roller-coaster ride of one man’s journey as he struggles through his disease, still wanting happiness for his true love. We're very eager to develop this game as soon as possible. Our main goal is to bring bliss to the world through visual novels!

Risks and challenges

Nothing comes without risk. There is even risk involved in making a simple game, like a visual novel. It takes huge amounts of time and effort. There are some things that can be unpredictable. However, with our enthusiasm and the efforts of the professionals whom we work with, we're confident that we can present One Last Crane on time at the high quality our readers expect.

However, with our enthusiasm and the efforts of the professionals whom we work with, we're confident that we can present One Last Crane on time at the high quality our readers expect.

story:
Short Summary:

Help me achieve my mermaid dreams! Help me become a mermaid so I can protect the world’s environment under the sea (and above!).  I want to save the animals and send children the message that it’s okay to be different and that anything is possible! With your help, I hope to own a realistic, professionally-crafted tail so I can use it for good causes while getting my message across!


My Story – Long Term Goals:

Hi! My name is Lexi (a.k.a Mermaid Nixie) and I’ve been a mermaid for just over two years! I’m an animal lover and a crazy recycling nut! I’m environmentally conscious and very concerned about the natural state of the world!


A Path to a Cleaner Environment 

Recycling and conservation is extremely important! I recycle anything and everything I can!  Promoting recycling, reusing and repurposing items, and helping rid the world of harmful plastic bags is my end goal! California has already implemented a statewide plastic bag ban, so why not the rest of the country? Also, I hope to one day organize clean ups of beaches, rivers, lakes, parks and other natural recreational areas!  90% of trash in the ocean consists of plastic bags, and the worst part is that they may break down, but never break down completely!   A large portion of this plastic is eaten by marine life!(http://www.takepart.com/oceans/plastic-pollution) 


Did You Know?

Humans kill more sharks each year than sharks kill humans. Within the past ten years, an average of about six people died from shark attacks each year worldwide (www.flmnh.ufl.edu/fish/sharks/statistics/statsw...). The sharks: an estimated 100 million are killed each year (Journal of Marine Policy, Volume 40, p. 194). Ocean life is under so much threat from humans, even if it isn't intentional! Plastic bags, plastic bottles, are I love the ocean and every single thing about it. The water, the sand, the sun, and of course the animals that live in it! 


Help the Homeless Animals!

Here in the United States, we have a huge problem with our animal shelters. Even though the number of dogs and cats euthanized each year in shelters has decreased (from 12-20 million to an estimated 3-4 million euthanizations), there is still work to be done. An estimated 2.7 million healthy shelter pets are left unadopted each year, and hardly 30 percent of pets are adopted from shelters or animal rescues (humanesociety.org). I hope to reduce this number even more by raising money for no-kill shelters and to encourage fostering and adoption! ( You're probably thinking; "How does this relate to mermaids? Honestly, it doesn't, it's just a cause I'm extremely passionate about!)



Inspiring Our Youth

Growing up, I was "the weird kid" I still am, but I embrace it! I've always had strange hobbies and interests! (Especially dressing up ;) ) but now that I'm older I want to dress up to make a statement! To attract attention to different causes! I want to help show kids that it's okay to be different and embrace being weird! And to also distract from electronic devices once and a while! Kids need to stretch their imagination a little more these days! Whatever happened to going outside and pretending to be dragons and unicorns?! 


Overall there are entirely way too many causes to describe and write about what I hope to do! Obviously I can't do this all at once or in a short period of time!  Here are my short term goals!



With a professional tail my goals are:


  • Have a professional photoshoot, sell the photos and donate the profits to no-kill shelters, environmental conservation efforts, and endangered species charities. Hopefully, a somewhat frequent thing! 


  • Spread the message of recycling and and conservation and educate the public about what waste does to our oceans and rivers. Do my part in trying to ban plastic bags in cities and states! 


  • Volunteer charities and fundraisers as a mermaid and my human self!


  • Show kids and the public that it's okay to be different and to follow your dreams! 


  • Donate a percentage of proceeds I make from being hired out to causes listed above and more! 

  •  Raise awareness for shelters, adoption, and foster programs! 

  • To inspire and encourage creativity and imagination! 


But to do all of that, I want to own a professional mermaid tail! 

You will be helping (Keyword: HELPING)  cover the cost of a:


Silicone mermaid tail + shipping +MAYBE a top (octopus and or scale top) 


The Bottom Line:

I don't want a tail just to have a tail to swim in, I want to do something with it and use it for good causes! Help me achieve my dream! I AM putting my own money into this, so it's somewhat of a digital piggy bank with a time limit!

story:
...aims to bring the magic of  childhood back to your life by allowing you to play all your favorite video games from back in the days and watching media in an retro styled environment on your Oculus Quest.
Wake up in your very own bedroom and:

  • Grab a Game
  • Connect the proper Console to TV 
  • Insert the Cardridge
  • Turn on the (CRT) TV
  • Turn on Console and have fun! :)

and more.

A big part of the work is already done and tested on the Oculus GO!
Following stuff already works like a charm:

 

Not much done yet, just an test Environment in form of an generic home theater currently.  Thats the main reason the funding is needed.

 

I switched to using libretro, which allows me to bring new features more streamlined. 

Following systems are working currently:

  • Gameboy
  • Gameboy Color
  • Gameboy Advance
  • Virtual Boy (in 3D)
  • Nintendo Entertainment System
  • Super Nintendo
  • N64 (Experimental, the code behind that will allow me to bring other opengl cores to RetroVR while still having the benefit of using Unity as an rendering engine)
  • Playstation One
  • Sega Master System
  • Sega Mega Drive
  • Atari 2600
  • Commodore64
  • NeoGeo Pocket

more to come!

 

Following video sources are currently supported:

  • Local Video Playback
  • SMB 1/2/3 network share
  • Twitch + Chat
  • Youtube

 

Screenshot: Note, as said, gonna need the device to create the proper envirionment/interaction. But it does show Video (on this one its Twitch) and Emulation in Action:

 

The environment will be highly inspired by this one:

Hardware! Oculus GO is 3DOF only, gonna need an Quest (and a few other small items) to properly design the environment and interaction like cartridge grabbing etc.

 

All Backers going to get regulary development Updates & Builds, which you can sideload via Sidequest.

While Backers getting regulary development builds to be part of the journey, public release is planned for late spring.


RetroVR will always be free to use as soon its ready for public use. 


Any questions? Let me know! :)

story:
A. What is Red Scourge?

Red Scourge is a point and click adventure game, settled during the Polish – Soviet War at the beginning of the XX century. Instead of Bolsheviks army, Poland is attacked by a horde of zombies, led by trained officers. Who is behind all of this? We will learn this during the whole story.

B. What's the plot?

We follow story of two people: Tomasz Zarzecki, young and vicious polish army officer, and Joanna Lubieniecka, young daughter of the noble, polish family. They just got engaged, but Tomasz is called to polish army HQ, for a special mission. The separation will change both of them, they will learn about each other's past, character and revise their beliefs. The grand finale of the whole game will take place during the Battle of Warsaw of 1920, and as you can imagine, nothing will be the same. Only war never changes :).



C. Are you gonna to make the whole game at once?

No. This campaign is about funding the first episode (out of 3), in which we learn how it all started, and who our heroes are. We want to make 3 parts to gather funds more easily, and improve our skill and workshop basing on the experience we gain and the community feedback.  Each episode will take about 2-3 hours of game for an experienced player.

D. Are you crazy?

A little bit, yes  We do love to tell stories, and we do love zombies. 

What else do we need? Maybe more braaaains...

E. What do you need money for?

The Indiegogo budget will be split for:

  • Indiegogo fee
  • Perks for supporters and shipping
  • Graphic designer and Illustrator
  • Game and story designer
  • Programmer
  • Voice actors and music composer
  • Visionairy studio software license
  • Promotion
  • Coffee, coffee, coffee :)

F. How long will it take to finish the game?

About 6 – 8 months. During the campaign time we will finish the final touch on the game storyboards and mechanics, so when the campaign is finished, we will be ready to start developing process.

G. I don't have any money, how can I help?

You can share the info with your friends. We will appreciate support of any kind 

H. What is this Visionairy Studio that you are going to use?

Visionairy Studio is a software, that allows to easily make an adventure game. We want to use it, to improve the process, and don't be dependent on the programming team. We all can take part in the developing process, which we really looking forward too. You can read more about the software here: http://www.visionaire-studio.net/.

I. What language will be the Red Scourge in?

English of course. Both on the voice and subtitles level. But as you may suspect, that there will be a lot of polish accent 

J. How much will the first episode cost?

We don't know yet, but no more than 15 EUR, probably even less.

K. How I can learn more about the game?

We will publish more information about the story and the characters here and on our FanPage which you can find here: https://www.facebook.com/RedScourgethegame.

L. Is this game political? You know, Russian zombies...

No, it's not. We do not want to make any political points or so. We just find it very good setting to tell the story, that's all. We do not intend to offend anyone.

story:
Bridge is a small box that is connected to your LAN or your WiFi network. It lives under your television, in your living room. When you turn it on, it starts an application on the networked computer of your choice. Your computer is running your favorite video game and streams it to Bridge, which displays it on your television. Bridge then sends back your controller's input to your computer.

It is as if your computer was right beside your television, as if it was a gaming console. We want to bridge those two worlds; bring your games into the living room or anywhere in the world, without moving your computer.

 

No, and that's why it can be cheap! It does not run games by itself, your computer does that. What it does is bridge your computer to your television, giving you an experience similar to a big budget console at very little cost.

Your computer runs the games, so your television can show it as pretty as what your computer can render it; no silly console limitation. It can be any games your computer runs. You are not limited to find the right game for the right console!

The hardware in the box is there to take your controller's input and streams it to your computer and take your computer's visual and audio signal and send them to your television; no need for long costly cables! Network cables are cheap, but WiFi has no cable at all!

 


 

Here they come: Sony, Nintendo and Microsoft are all launching their new consoles: the Xbox One, the Playstation 4 and the Wii-U. It's great for gaming competition. Or is it? We spent so much on our current consoles and library of games, we don't really want to buy a new set of consoles; and none of those are retro-compatible with our current games!

It's obvious their first goal is to put their hands in our pockets. We don't really mind paying for gaming, but are we getting the most for our money? They are designing a new set of consoles because they want us to buy them, not because they can't do better or offer me more!

Some say consoles are better for gaming while others swear by the PC. Why such a separation? We truly believe this is not the best we can do. We think it is time to end the differences between PC and console gaming.

So here's what we want;

  • Play on our television, in our living room or anywhere else.
  • Play with a controller, or the input of our choice!
  • Have great visual quality.
  • Cheap!

The solution is simple; bridge your computer to your living room!

We were sure a company would create such a device ever since the last generation of consoles came out. They did not; time to do it ourselves.

 

 

Developing new hardware is not cheap; the electronic, the code, the design and the plastic molding are only part of the cost. The FCC Certification alone is very expensive.

We don't want to create a one-shot product that people would never hear about it again. We want to make a quality product that will change our perception of computers and displays.

But when compared to the price of game consoles, media centers or digital recorders which are designed for a specific and sometimes unique purpose, Bridge appear to be quite cheap.

We are using the expertise gained in the manufacturing of micro-computer such as the Beagle Bone or the Raspberry Pi. Without them, there would be no way to bring the processing power needed in such a small package at a reasonable price.

See BeagleBone: http://beagleboard.org/

See Raspberry Pi: http://www.raspberrypi.org/


Since it's not a console, the spec of Bridge will be fairly low, but it's also why it will be cheap and why it's such an interesting machine. It is not there to replace your computer; it's there to extend it, expand your computer's range; to bridge it to any television or screen in range of your network or the internet.

 

 

As if they were plugged directly in your computer, any USB or Bluetooth device that can be used to control a video game will work; keyboard, mouse, gamepad, joystick or driving wheel. You name it.

Bridge simply "bridges" your controller to your computer over your network or the internet, it does not require new drivers for your USB devices. That's what makes it so simple and easy to use. It uses a USB over IP protocol, in essence, any USB device connected to Bridge is seen as if it was directly connected to your computer.

See USB/IP Open Source software: http://sourceforge.net/projects/usbip/

Right now we are targeting the Windows platform. Most of today's computers or laptops are able to stream their output properly without any noticeable reduction in performance.

If there is a real interest, it is always possible in the future to port the software to Mac or Linux platform. It will only be possible if we go above our current funding goal.

 

The reality is we have all the tools needed to create this product right now. The latency over a local network is almost impossible to notice. Current wireless network are more than powerful enough to support it.

Apple announced a new feature for AppleTV which they call "Mirroring". Their device let you see your Mac's desktop on your television over WiFi. We want to make it work for Windows and take it one step further; let you connect USB or Bluetooth accessories to control your computer.

This is not fantasy, this technology works and big corporations are getting interested in it.

See AppleTV Mirroring: http://www.apple.com/appletv/airplay/

 

Image from Apple.com website

 

It's good for gaming, but there is more. Since it's also a "USB over IP" box, it allows you to connect devices such as a printer or a scanner. And since it's over IP, it also means over the internet. You could setup one Bridge in a conference room and run an interactive presentation that is streamed from your computer at home. The only things you need are a television and an internet connection.

It could be used for:

  • Video game
  • Movies or Netflix streaming
  • Music
  • Photo
  • Remote Desktop
  • MAME Arcade Cabinet
  • Printing or Scanning station
  • Recharge USB device station

The original concept of this hardware comes from a need in video games, but there's no way to tell where this technology could lead us. It could do a lot more and change forever the vision of "one computer, one screen". Where there's a screen, there will be an infinite number of computers available.

Your computer could follow you wherever you are.

 

All the pieces of the puzzle are available now, it is not future technology. However, we need your help to assemble them to a full quality product that will forever change how we see a television or a screen. The computer will never have to be nearby anymore.

We hope you will also see the potential this new technology can offer.

 

 

We are a team with decades of experience in software and hardware creation. Our technical designer worked on video games such as Prince of Persia and Assassin's Creed. Our lead engineer worked on numerous electronic hardware projects, including intelligent prosthesis.

We have the experience and the knowledge to make this project a reality.

 

 

Website

Forum

Facebook

Reddit

Twitter

Google+

Steam Group

Contact Us

You could setup one Bridge in a conference room and run an interactive presentation that is streamed from your computer at home. The only things you need are a television and an internet connection.
It could be used for:

Video game
Movies or Netflix streaming
Music
Photo
Remote Desktop
MAME Arcade Cabinet
Printing or Scanning station
Recharge USB device station
The original concept of this hardware comes from a need in video games, but there's no way to tell where this technology could lead us. It could do a lot more and change forever the vision of "one computer, one screen". Where there's a screen, there will be an infinite number of computers available.
Your computer could follow you wherever you are.
 

All the pieces of the puzzle are available now, it is not future technology. However, we need your help to assemble them to a full quality product that will forever change how we see a television or a screen. The computer will never have to be nearby anymore.
We hope you will also see the potential this new technology can offer.
 
 
We are a team with decades of experience in software and hardware creation. Our technical designer worked on video games such as Prince of Persia and Assassin's Creed. Our lead engineer worked on numerous electronic hardware projects, including intelligent prosthesis.
We have the experience and the knowledge to make this project a reality.
 
 

Website
Forum
Facebook
Reddit
Twitter
Google+
Steam Group
Contact Us

story:
Short Summary

If you know our friend Doug and you miss him, you should put some money towards this.  If we meet our funding goal, the money will go to cover Doug's hotel bill along with food and anything else he needs while he is up here.

This is a serious effort, Lisa and I have found a good, cheap hotel and the 500 dollar minimum should cover all costs.

It's up to you all, the legions of Doug Fans (TM) to make it happen.

What We Need & What You Get

We need money, you need Doug.

You pay money, you get Doug.

If we get to 500 dollars, then the money will cover Doug's hotel bill and food.  Any additional funds (after Indiegogo gets its cut) will go directly to Doug.

The Impact

Doug gets to come back to New Hampshire and we get to hang out with him after OGC. 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who can't afford to give money, if the project is funded, you can take Doug out for dinner, run a game for him, or even bake him a cake.  I'm sure his birthday was sometime last year and you probably didn't buy him a cake.  So take this opportunity to fix that.

Since the game is already completed and "Another Version" will be released on DLsite in next month(October 2015), this campaign is not for the game-making. However, although it's been completed, there are lots of contents that has been canceled. I've ran out of my money and that forced me to stop here just like my previous game in 2013, and I tried to asked myself "Do I want to stop here?".

No, I don't want to stop here. So... Here's my plan.

I'm planning to make lots of new costumes for Cinderella, including School Uniform, Office Lady, Princess Knight, Gothic Lolita, China Dress, Nurse, Marine Officer, Maid, School Swimsuit, Sports Swimwear, Original designed Bikini.

Some costumes have separate accessories such as Glasses, Nurse Hat, Maid HairBand...etc.

I also plan to release this game on Android / IOS devices.

That's all and that's the reason why I need all your help.

As for the Perks, I've no idea about it.
Maybe some new costumes, new accessories, or new Trap devices...
Any suggestions are appreciated.

Thanks again :D

story:
What is Peri-Sight

Peri-Sight is a patented electronic sighting system that attaches to the barrel of paintball markers and most airsoft guns that actually allows you to look around corners. Peri-Sight is a two-part system: a high definition (HD) camera that is mounted directly below the barrel and an LCD display that is mounted off center. The LCD display quickly rotates up to 180 degrees allowing the player and the display to remain hidden behind a bunker, only exposing the barrel and camera. It also quickly folds in when not in use. Not only can you use Peri-Sight from behind a bunker or obstacle to survey the field and look for your opponents, but you can actually mark them as you remain virtually invisible! This means you no longer need to expose yourself in order to eliminate your opponents. Think of how this will advance the action and the strategy of your game. It brings stealth to a whole new level!

Why we're doing this

We've been in the mechanical engineering trade for more than 25 years, designing and building custom automated production equipment and providing in-house contract manufacturing services mainly for the medical industry.  The Peri-Sight is a departure from the projects we typically do.  

We initially developed and built the prototypes for ourselves because we really thought it was a cool idea, and there was nothing else like it on the market.  We have had a lot of fun developing and testing it.  We finally got to the point where we realized we had a product that people are really interested in, and would have as much fun using it as we do! However, we didn’t pursue it further because of the cost involved with taking the prototype to the next level.  

Project History

Over the last several years, we have built a number of prototypes and then field tested them.  During this testing, we also talked to many paintball players, league organizers and field owners who were very excited about Peri-Sight, and couldn’t wait for it to be on the market so they could try it themselves.  However, most of them that we spoke with wanted to know if can also record?  We took their feedback very seriously, and decided to go back to the drawing board and re-design the Peri-sight again.  We are very proud of this final design because it incorporates everything we’ve learned, and all of the features we thought the Peri-sight really needed to have.

Why we need your help!

With your contribution we can pay for the CAD design of the housing, ready for mold fabrication. The creation of the prototype housing using SLA, to test fit and function.  The mold fabrication itself. Then the cost of molding, the purchase of the electronic components and assembly.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can help us get the word out about our project by liking us on Facebook or using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for your support!

story:
The World Cup Project

The World Cup Project team consists of two people. One artist and one programmer we are from and live in New Zealand.

We are passionate about sports and video games, particlarly Rugby and it is our goal to make a rugby game that flows like real rugby, with AI that plays rugby well and really challenges gamers. 

The World Cup Project aims to make a playable World Cup style tournament game for PC.

With your contribution the World Cup Project becomes a reality.

We need $5000 US Dollars to cover the development teams costs during the approximately 2 month deveolpment period.

We have a free playable demo available. Head over to our blog, download it and see exaclty what your contribution will be going toward.

http://www.worldcupproject.blogspot.co.nz/

If you are unable to contribute you can still help us out by checking out the demo, and if you like it, tell you friends!

We would also appreciate any feeback you might have.

Here are a few short gamplay videos.

The Sidestep http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uHWAfunUjSM

The Shoulder Charge http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n0oGYYvLcvQ

The Goose step http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5JSx32p9NiI

The Fend http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hr4v5DD1xwo

story:
Our funding goal has been hit on Kickstarter! We're overwhelmed by the amazing response from all of you! It really means a lot to us that so many of you have felt a connection to our game. We are now doing some extra crowdfunding to try to hit some of our stretch goals, so if you missed out on collecting our awesome Midli rewards, you can now get them here!

Midli is a laid-back Breakout inspired adventure, with a relaxing, yet dark atmosphere, where you collect the soul fragments of lingering spirits to uncover their stories and help them move on.  

Play as Heli, a mysterious girl who guides the fates of those stuck in Midli, as she discovers a story of her own.  

Midli: (/pronounced like the drink 'mead' + the name 'Lee':/) from the Old Norse word 'miðli' meaning in-between

At DinoByte Labs we’ve been gamers for over 20 years, and we love looking at how we can take the classic games we loved, and add a modern twist. Our favorite games today have depth and great stories, so when we started working on Midli we wanted to combine unique and dynamic mechanics, with captivating art and sound design, and a compelling choice driven narrative.

Midli is developed for initial release iOS and Android mobile devices, with the potential for a PC release if we hit our stretch goals.

Features:  

  • Enjoy a deeper mobile gaming experience
  • Change the story depending on how you play  
  • Discover multiple endings!
  • Get to know a diverse cast of characters, each with their own story
  • Explore a dark, yet relaxing atmosphere 
  • Experience the story of Midli through animated cutscenes
  • Encounter several unique and interesting enemies
  • Play with environmental obstacles like rain and darkness, time manipulation and much more!
  • 45 levels, spanning 5 aesthetically and mechanically different worlds - with more worlds depending on stretch goal funding!

Pre-Alpha Gameplay

Remember, we have a £5 perk which gives you the Midli original soundtrack at a huge discount, but this is outside of all perks under £100!

Our physical rewards make a great gift, and you will receive them well in time for the holidays!

Midli follows the journey of Heli, a girl tasked with helping those who struggle to move on from her world.

Heli's Concept Design

We were inspired by “Guardian: The Lonely and Great God”, a Korean TV drama written by Kim Eun-sook. It tells a series of short character based stories parallel to the main plot, each one only a few minutes long, yet they quickly get you caring for the characters and what they’re going through. This became the basis for how we designed our narrative, and how we present the characters Heli meets through the game.   

What you learn about those characters will change based on whether you collect their light or dark fragments. You can even influence the outcomes of their stories, as it will be up to you to determine their fates, either by ‘forgiving’ or ‘forgetting’ them. Ultimately this will even change how Heli's story ends.

Pre-Alpha Footage

You will get to know our cast of lost spirits through their own unique short stories spanning aesthetically and mechanically different worlds, each as diverse as the characters themselves.

  • Yuri Park, a youthful girl in her 20s, struggles with the uncertainty of her future 
  • Erik Haraldsson, a husband and father, is unable to express his emotions and affection 
  • Josephine Lewis, a family matriarch, regrets missing out on the life she dreamed of 
  • Nicolas Santiago, a remorseful troublemaker, fears others see him as darkly as he sees himself 

Yuri Park, one of the spirits stuck in Midli

A core part of our design for Midli was always centered around the mood and atmosphere. The story deals with some darker themes, and we wanted our art to reflect this. However, it was important to us that our game felt otherworldly and calm, not scary or creepy.  

Louise, our producer, has a lot of experience with anxiety and panic attacks, and one of the main things that help her feel at ease are soothing sounds, such as wind chimes, which coincidentally and appropriately have a lot of associations with spirits.

To create the mood we wanted for Midli, we added a lot more of these atmospheric sounds such as rain, whispers, bells and wind instruments. Coupled with our art style and ambient lighting, this really helped Midli have that otherworldly feeling we were going for.

We're also super excited to announce that we'll be working with award winning, and College Emmy-nominated composer Robert Mai to create a full original soundtrack for the game! Not only that, we're also offering a limited chance to get the full digital soundtrack for a discounted £5! You will need to get the OST perk separately from perks under £100. Have a listen to a preview:

Our game will feature 8+ unique songs, all with variations to give a different feel to the various levels within each world. We can't wait to show you more soon!

Part of why we aspired to perfect this mood and aesthetic, is because we feel visual storytelling can be as important as the narrative itself, so our art and atmosphere is all formed with specific themes and symbolism in mind relating to the story of Midli and it’s cast.

Concept Storyboards for Heli's Story

When we were designing our mechanics, we thought a lot about how we could translate parts of our atmosphere into gameplay. If it was raining, shouldn’t that affect how fast the Heli flies, and could we use light to guide or darkness to obscure? 

Pre-Alpha: Rain and Darkness Levels

We used these elements to inspire our design, and we’ve worked really hard to make Midli interactive and dynamic, allowing you to play with time manipulation, spiderweb slingshots and much, much more!  

Forgotten Shadows Concept Sketches

Spirits are not meant to linger in Midli for too long, but during our world building, we liked the idea of having these dark creatures who were permanently stuck there. We designed the Forgotten Shadows based on this, ghostly beings who come in various shapes and sizes, each one adding something different to the gameplay.

Evolution of a Forgotten Shadow from concept to game (Not final art)

  

  • Shadow World (£4,500) GOAL REACHED! - An additional “secret” unlockable short world dedicated to the Forgotten Shadows and their story 
  • Additional Soundtrack and Art (£6,000) - Upgraded soundtrack with more original music and even more unique art throughout the game 
  • Heli’s Story (£8,000) - Additional levels, cutscenes and story focusing on Heli and her backstory
  • PC Version (£10,000) - A PC release of the game with widescreen cutscenes 

We are a pretty small team of 3 based in London. While we all have experience making games for others, Midli is really our first chance at creating and publishing something entirely on our own, based solely on our vision.

So far we have self-funded (yes, from our own pockets!), both the making of our prototype and our first demo, but we really need YOUR help in order to bring Midli to the players. 

From left: Louise, Christian and James

  • Louise Leolin - Games Producer (Game design, user research and experience design, aesthetic design, marketing and game assets)
  • Christian Lovdal - Games Director (Game design, story writing and programming)   
  • James Pendry - Lead Artist (Concept and promotional art, animations and CG cutscenes)
 

Funds are a super important way to help support our project, but there is even more you can do and it’s free! We’re a pretty small studio, and not many have heard of us yet, so every time you share our story you are helping spread the word to even more potential backers! Even if you don’t have a huge following, every share helps ❤  

Here are some posts we’ve made that you can like and share on various networks, and while you're at it why not give us a follow?:  

❤ Facebook ❤ Twitter ❤ Instagram ❤ Tumblr ❤ LinkedIn ❤ YouTube ❤

If you are a member of the press you can view our press-kit or contact us directly for more info and interviews!

Making games cost a lot of money, so here is how we anticipate to divide our Kickstarter and Indie GoGo funds

Risks and challenges:

Assuming we get funded, this game WILL get made, 100% certain, no matter what. Yes, we’re that confident in it. However, making games costs a lot of money and takes a lot of time. We really want to release the full game in November, and we’ll be working hard to hit that deadline, but it may take shorter or longer than expected.

If we hit some of our stretch goals, this may mean additional development time is needed, but this should not go beyond the end of 2017.

Our rewards will also obviously be shipped as soon as we’re able, but if there ends up being a lot of you, this too might take a bit of time. We have chosen the delivery date to be in November and we are confident that we will manage this.

We also would like to point out that most of the footage shown in this campaign is from our alpha build, and there is a chance that some of the art may change. If so it will only be because we feel we can improve it, so the change will be for the better, while remaining in the same general style.
