Making games cost a lot of money, so here is how we anticipate to divide our Kickstarter and Indie GoGo funds

Risks and challenges:
Assuming we get funded, this game WILL get made, 100% certain, no matter what. Yes, we’re that confident in it. However, making games costs a lot of money and takes a lot of time. We really want to release the full game in November, and we’ll be working hard to hit that deadline, but it may take shorter or longer than expected.
If we hit some of our stretch goals, this may mean additional development time is needed, but this should not go beyond the end of 2017.
Our rewards will also obviously be shipped as soon as we’re able, but if there ends up being a lot of you, this too might take a bit of time. We have chosen the delivery date to be in November and we are confident that we will manage this.
We also would like to point out that most of the footage shown in this campaign is from our alpha build, and there is a chance that some of the art may change. If so it will only be because we feel we can improve it, so the change will be for the better, while remaining in the same general style.

story:
Greetings everyone! Our team consists of few people trying to create something special. It is our first attempt at crowdfunding to which we prepared for a long time morally and physically. To the present day we have released game called “Bit Bullet” to gain some experience and understand how some services work. While facing unusual problems we’ve got a lot of practice on this small project.

   Of course, we are not fully satisfied with the work we made but without practice, knowledge and good team cooperation it’s hard to create something new and stay realists.

   We will tell more about that below.

   Right now, we have team and enough knowledge to create a good game that will be supported not only with our dreams but with you, people that love good games and want them to advance.

 

    (1*) - Game already will be in english and russian, so additional languages will be:​ Spanish, Italian, German, French.

   (2*) - Horror mode will be in a form of DLC after game release if funding goal reaches that stage. It will consist of same locations but with different environment, alternative plot, additional puzzles, horror elements, additional events and etc. Psychologic pressure will make solving riddles harder.

 

   Let me tell you how it all began. I was working as a journalist in small publisher office for 5 years. People in our city started to disappear 3 weeks ago.  In search for information about missing people I became direct participant in this story.

   I was locked in some strange place. It appears to be some installation for a medieval fair that looks very unusual. I’ve never heard about such place in our city. Main question stays open. Does my abduction have anything with kidnapping of other people or not?

   ​I still don’t understand what is happening. I’m constantly facing a lot of puzzles and strange mechanisms that I can’t figure out. If they are connected with the way out of this place it looks like I’m trapped for a long time.

(Prepare your savvy, logic and a bit of madness to overcome all obstacles on your way to escape imprisonment and possibly unveil the truth behind the abductions.)

 

  •    There will be classic puzzles everyone knows from their childhood.
  •    Inspired by games like “The Room” we are adding many interactive mechanisms which will help to imbue the atmosphere of the game.
  •    In game atmosphere will consist not only of environment and sound effects but with commentaries of the main character as well that will help you understand about his thoughts of current situation.
  •    How can we manage without classical notes that will help you to understand the plot? You are playing as a journalist, so you will need to make an investigation by connecting information hidden in hints and notes to build a chain of events that lead to current situation.
  •    To keep you in tension environment will change depending on your actions or sometimes because it was needed to change. 
  •    And of course, good story doesn’t have an open ending. Different details, scenes and events in the ending will depend on your findings.

 

    Continuing to tell about our team I would like to tell you about every one of us separately, but the story can differ from teller to teller. So, it will be wiser if I tell only about myself but beware that I can embellish.

​   My name is Sergey Levin. Even from school desk I was dreaming of creating my own games. I can’t say that I was thinking about some high goals. Let’s say, I wanted to create my own worlds and tell amazing stories. 

   Back at school I had attempts at creating a flash game but failed every time. I can infinitely justify myself but I think in summation I needed a team. Creating anything is hard, especially in sphere that includes programming, design, modelling, texturing, animation and so on. Like a fragile penknife that always break I’ve tried to deepen my knowledge but failed never bringing conceived to the end. Years passed and telling about everything will make big enough book with a lot of useless writings and discussions about lost opportunities – whining to say the least. But today I'm not here for this.

   What do we have today? Several people in whom I’m sure more than in myself and with whom I’m sure we can make things done. Friends and relatives that are interested in our work are ready to help. I can’t claim that we are professionals. World is enormous and is growing bigger every day, including us.  So the more we learn the more is left to learn but it is the best time in our lives! And I’m glad that I finally know what to devote my life to. If I didn’t tell already - to game development. I hope you will join and support us to make my dream come true.  

 

   I think it’s worth mentioning that I grew up on puzzle games. I like many genres and play then to this day. The main reason we want to create this game – because there are less puzzle games year by year.

   ​Big studios with rare exceptions refuse such projects because they are not very profitable. While investigating deeper you can find out that sells of recent big projects are not that big as from games from other genres. It is the main reason for studios to avoid such projects and it is understandable. Soon I think such project would be possible only because people like you that can support an idea they like. By the way – idea of monetization in puzzle games disgusts me.

 

   Right now, game is 30% complete in my opinion. We’ve worked out mechanics of some puzzles and work is underway on locations, models and textures. Plot and distribution of it on locations is done but while working out on locations it may change. Also, we are recording game sounds to imbue the atmosphere of the game. There is a lot to be made and a lot of obstacles to overcome but with your help we can make it! Down the road we are planning to enlist the support of a publisher to make releases on other platforms. We don’t have a lot of experience in working on other platforms so we can’t guarantee immediate releases on other platforms. At this stage we have made our “Steam” and “HumbleBundle” pages. Later we will send request to “GoG”. Game is planned for PC and we will do your best to make it for MAC too but we can't guarantee.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/818090/Inner...

​https://www.humblebundle.com/store/inner-riddle

 

 

   With your help we are planning to release in December 2018. And only with your help release on other platforms is possible in such terms. But we can’t guarantee that releases on other platforms doesn’t take longer.

(Budget percentages will slightly change depending on donations.)

 

   We’ve began working on this project in the end of 2017 investing all your free time into it and all earned money into salaries and equipment. Right now, project is in critical stage. Collected funds will go to ensure different stages of development and generally to its acceleration. We have indicated minimal expenses on marketing because we plan to find a publisher that will take main load related with marketing on itself with leaving a reserve to hire marketing specialist if things won’t go that well. We hope it will help a lot of people to discover our game.  

 

   Here I’d like to be honest. I’m realist and everybody in our team are aware that we can’t afford few year development without funding. And even more so with such high risks in the genre like this. Right now, we are investing all our time and energy into development. I fully understand that team, even full of enthusiasm, without funding can’t risks a lot of time and energy to the pursuit of ambitions. All have their reasons – family, kids and so on. But with our team, experience, will to make it done and most importantly with your support we can create beautiful game.     

 We will keep you informed on news and stages of development in social media and your web site. Also, we will add new information to the project page.

story:
Hello! This is Brandon Morgan, Co-Founder of Innovision Gaming, and I'm delighted that you're reading this!

 This is our crowd funding “pitch” as it were. I don't really care for that terminology however, as it makes it sound like we're simply a company looking to sell you something. That's the first thing that makes us very very different from your typical computer retailer. This company is really just a group of gamers that are cooperatively trying to lower the prices of high end gaming equipment. If any of you have had the pleasure of building your own gaming rig, you have first hand experience that there's quite a bit of mark up between retail price and the hardware price. 

 After extensive research and reaching out to hardware manufacturers across the world, we found the way to take the savings to the next level. The catch? Manufacturers expect orders to be coming in bulk, that's how they make their money. We have the contacts to make the best gaming computer the consumer world has ever seen, but we have to place orders in the numbers of thousands.

 Which is where all of you come in! If we band together as a community, we can have the buying power to seize these low prices. I'll let the graph below speak for itself.

ALIENWARE

BUILD IT YOURSELF

INNOVISION GAMING

2nd Gen. I7 Quad-Core 4.3GHz

i7-3960X Six-Core 3.9GHz

i7-3970X Six-Core 4.0GHz

 We've got the vision, and we're ready to innovate. However cheesy that might be, just look at our rewards. With all of you lovely people supporting us, Innovision Gaming WILL be the cheapest and best place to upgrade your gaming PC.

story:
Many people showed interest in our ANE, but most agreed that it was duty of Game-Technology (the creators of the Dice+) provide this component or at least share the development costs with us.

We contacted Game-Technology before and during the campaign was still alive, but unfortunately Game-Technology not answer our emails and his only action was add to your favorites a tweet where this campaign was mentioned, in our view the most interested in supporting and create conditions to increase the apps compatible with your product, should be them, because they would be the main beneficiaries, for that reason and this campaign result, we will not share this component.


What is an AIR native extension?

"Native Extensions for Adobe AIR are code libraries that contain native code wrapped with an ActionScript API. Native extensions provide easy access to device-specific libraries and features that are not available in the built-in ActionScript classes. Examples of native extensions include making a mobile device vibrate, integrating ad-networks and in-app purchasing systems into your games, and using the iOS Game Center in your iOS games."

You can find more information from Adobe Developer Connection.


What exactly is DICE+ and how does it work?

"DICE+ is an electronic dice you use to play “dice” games on your tablet. It works by communicating with your tablet via bluetooth. This means no more counting, moving game pieces or pressing boring random number generators."

You can find more information from Dice Plus Home Page.


Dice+ AIR Native Extension

Currently does not exist a component to integrate the DicePlus with apps developed in the Flash Platform.

We already developed a component used in the game Zaguts (iOS and Android), this ANE is a unfinished version working in Android and iOS with access to only some functions of the dice.

Our intention is raise funds  to complete this ANE and have access to all functions of the dice.


Our game Zaguts that uses the ANE:

Google Play
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=air.com.fluocode.zaguts
iOS

http://appstore.com/zaguts


The Scope

Currently our ANE have access to the ROLL, THERMOMETER, LED_STATE and BATTERY functions, the goal is complete it to get access to the functions:

  • BATTERY
  • THERMOMETER
  • ACCELEROMETER
  • ORIENTATION
  • TAP
  • FACE_TOUCH
  • PROXIMITY
  • MAGNETOMETER
  • POWER_MODE
  • LED_STATE
  • ROLL


Why this Campaign?

Fluocode's philosophy has always been to share, in fact whenever we can, we help improve code of projects on github and share our code. In this case because the main beneficiary is the creator of the Dice +, we feel the unfortunate position of having of seeking to recover part of the investment. The real cost of this component was more than $ 2,500 USD and the goal of our campaign is much lower. For this reason, if the goal is not reached, we do NOT share the componet in any way.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute with money, share this campaign, if we reach the goal and you helped this, we share a license with  you.

story:
Android gaming just got bigger.

Mobile apps have transformed the electronic gaming ecosystem. Each week thousands of new titles, with remarkable graphics and audio, are available for smartphones and tablets for low prices or even free. Why should we settle for playing them on a 4 inch, 7 inch or 10 inch screen device? Why can’t we enjoy our favorite games on our large screen TV at high quality without having to resort to home video game consoles and their high priced games?

 

Maximum power.

eSfere is an Android based video game TV console with impressive technical specs that will allow you to get the most out of thousands of titles available on the Google Play app store.

eSfere specifications:

- Tegra3 quad core processor or above 

- 2 GB RAM

- 16 GB internal flash storage

- 2 USB ports

- Bluetooth

- WiFi 802.11 b/g/n

- Ethernet

- HDMI connection for up to 1080p HD

- "Touch&Play" multitouch gamepad controller with integrated accelerometer and gyroscope

- Android OS 4.1

- Available in 7 different colors (black, white, pink, red, light blue, blue and yellow)

Ready to play!

We want you to be able to enjoy the full Android experience. With eSfere people will have access, from the first moment, to Google Play, the world’s largest Android app store, with over 500,000 titles.

eSfere will allow you to play the latest AAA games, watch movies, surf the web and run all sorts of productivity, education or leisure apps. It will therefore be more than just a video game console.

With eSfere game developers will discover a whole new way of conceiving their games. Since eSfere plays Android games downloaded directly from Google Play, developers don’t need to make special adaptations so they can run on the device. They can continue making their Android games as they normally do, but knowing that people will be able to enjoy them on a big screen with great graphics thanks eSfere’s Tegra 3 quad core processor. With this premise in mind they will be able to create more amazing Android games with engines such as Unity, Unreal, GameSalad or Multimedia Fusion 2.

"As a game designer, I see eSfere as the ultimate incentive for Android game developers to envision their projects in a whole new way." -- Ignacio Abad (2D & 3D lead artist for "Clive Barker's Jericho" and "Castlevania: Lords of Shadow")

Just a small sample of Android games available on Google Play that you will be able to play, from the very first minute, with eSfere:

 

 ...among thousands

And your favorite apps too...

 

 You're in control.

eSfere will have a sophisticated and elegant multitouch game controller (“Touch&Play”) that will allow people to keep the touch surface experience when playing their favorite Android games. Its accurate mapping system (a visual indicator showing on the TV where you are touching) will let you know at all times where you are located on the TV screen without having to look down at the controller, which will simply be a flat multitouch pad surface (with no images or video mirroring). Using more than one controller will make it possible to play shared surface multiplayer games, where each player, via his/her own controller, takes control of a specific area or part of the screen. We understand however that many gamers demand physical buttons when it comes to playing video games. That's why eSfere will also include a set of detachable silicone buttons and directional pads which can be easily attached to the “Touch&Play” controller and adapted to whatever game you are playing. 

"Android gaming has really exploded over the last year.  With the latest hardware it's practically like having a little game console right in your pocket -- the only thing missing is a TV and a controller.  That's where eSfere comes in:  it's got cutting edge internals that will run high-end 3D games like ours at HD resolutions, and a wireless touch controller so you can play on your couch.  But the best thing from a developer's perspective is that it supports all our games right out of the box.  That means we don't have to bend over backwards to support it, and for gamers there's going to be a huge selection of games available on day one." -- Matt Small (Co-Founder and Creative Director at Vector Unit, creator of Riptide GP, Beach Buggy Blitz and Shine Runner) 

 

"eSfere would be perfect to run our Faction Wars / World of Midgard 3D MMORPG with Super HD graphics (1024x1024+ textures is 16 times more pixels than 256×256 on a smartphone). Faction Wars already looks great and it will look 4 times better on eSfere" -- Veraxon Entertainment (Creators of Faction Wars / World of Midgard 3D MMORPG)

 

 

Need more space?

A 128GB external flash drive will also be available for your extra storage needs. Photographs, music, videos...you name it! It neatly fits under the base of your eSfere console and connects to the device via USB. Additionally, the external flash drive has two USB ports so you may add additional devices that can be recognized by the eSfere console (additional hard drives, mouse, keyboard). In other words, the external flash drive also works as a USB connection hub.

 

Make it happen.

Crowdfunding is the ideal way to seek funding for a project like eSfere. We're a team of young professionals with experience in designing, developing and promoting video games and mobile apps. We hope users will back this project because they believe in it and are convinced, as much as we are, that a complete Android gaming solution for the large screen TV is necessary. That's why we seek support directly from consumers, so they can tell us, through their pledges, that this is what they were waiting for. 

 

About us.

Developing a gaming product of this level is a challenging task, but we have the tools and the people to make it happen.

Our team has ample experience in the gaming industry, both on a technical and a design level, having developed in the past entertainment software for PC, Mac, Android and iOS. We also have a team of enginners working with us on this project. We are therefore fully familiar with the Android ecosystem and the hardware and software requirements in order to make a console that can do what it says it will: run hundreds of thousands of apps and games from the Google Play store smoothly and obtaining the highest possible performance from its hardware specs (RAM, processor, game controller, etc.) We have worked with a team of engineer in order to assure

As such we already have a working prototype which serves as the base for our console and which we will perfect, tweak and fine-tune constantly in order to produce the final version of the product. All our testing has been done with a Tegra 3 quad core processor, and the results have been fantastic. However, we are aware that technology keeps advancing and it is possible that an updated version of the Tegra processor might see the light over the coming months. Therefore, if the amount of funding makes it possible and we are still in time to do so when we begin production in Q1 2013, we will seriously consider incorporating the highly anticipated Tegra 4 processor into eSfere.

We have done all the “math” so that the money we are seeking is a realistic amount which will allow us to produce the product and have July of 2013 as an expected delivery date. Promising an earlier date would be unrealistic and misleading to backers. Our goal is to produce a high quality product that delivers what it promises and that is why we have given ourselves a significant amount of time to do so. We have already spoken to various providers in China and their feedback has been key in setting the deadlines.

Android gaming just got bigger.
Mobile apps have transformed the electronic gaming ecosystem. Each week thousands of new titles, with remarkable graphics and audio, are available for smartphones and tablets for low prices or even free. Why should we settle for playing them on a 4 inch, 7 inch or 10 inch screen device? Why can’t we enjoy our favorite games on our large screen TV at high quality without having to resort to home video game consoles and their high priced games?
 

Maximum power.
eSfere is an Android based video game TV console with impressive technical specs that will allow you to get the most out of thousands of titles available on the Google Play app store.
eSfere specifications:
- Tegra3 quad core processor or above 
- 2 GB RAM
- 16 GB internal flash storage
- 2 USB ports
- Bluetooth
- WiFi 802.11 b/g/n
- Ethernet
- HDMI connection for up to 1080p HD
- "Touch&Play" multitouch gamepad controller with integrated accelerometer and gyroscope
- Android OS 4.1
- Available in 7 different colors (black, white, pink, red, light blue, blue and yellow)







Ready to play!
We want you to be able to enjoy the full Android experience. With eSfere people will have access, from the first moment, to Google Play, the world’s largest Android app store, with over 500,000 titles.
eSfere will allow you to play the latest AAA games, watch movies, surf the web and run all sorts of productivity, education or leisure apps. It will therefore be more than just a video game console.
With eSfere game developers will discover a whole new way of conceiving their games. Since eSfere plays Android games downloaded directly from Google Play, developers don’t need to make special adaptations so they can run on the device. They can continue making their Android games as they normally do, but knowing that people will be able to enjoy them on a big screen with great graphics thanks eSfere’s Tegra 3 quad core processor. With this premise in mind they will be able to create more amazing Android games with engines such as Unity, Unreal, GameSalad or Multimedia Fusion 2.
"As a game designer, I see eSfere as the ultimate incentive for Android game developers to envision their projects in a whole new way." -- Ignacio Abad (2D & 3D lead artist for "Clive Barker's Jericho" and "Castlevania: Lords of Shadow")

story:
SHORT STORY

You know what happens when you don't read your work contract, right?
No?

Well, the good guy Conan McDuglas didn't know that either when joined 
one of the weirdest corporations in the world as a courier. He didn't know that when one day all the building doors and windows get locked, he became a really "full-time" employee.

Couldn't be worse? Yes, it could! The only way to leave the building is a roof and the only person who can access roof door is the top manager.

Nothing to worry about, work hard and you'll be a boss one day, right? Not really... The only way to get a promotion - is to fight for it.

 

DEMO

Press any key to download DEMO

 

STRETCH GOAL

Not happy with attack built-in combinations? Sure, make your's

I'm pretty sure that there's some extra floor that I haven't found yet.

Staplers, darts, tennis balls - everything can help you on the battlefield.​

More kicks, more punches, more fun!

it's dangerous to go alone...​

 

GAMEPLAY DESCRIPTION

One of my favorite games of 16-bit era is "Zombies Ate My Neighbors", and that's really shame that we've never got 2nd chapter. I was trying to bring some of its mechanics here, in "Office Terror".

 

GOAL

Your goal is to reach top floor, beat main boss and leave the office.

As mentioned in the description, this game is a beat'em up with RPG and puzzle elements. What does that mean?

 

RPG ELEMENT

You start at level 1, and can achieve up to level 20. Each level you're getting 2 skill points that you can spend to one of 2 main hero characteristics: strength or agility. Based on those characteristics, Conan acts differently. 

Strength:

  • Increases max HP.
  • Increases enemy attack resistance.
  • Increases attack damage.

Agility:

  • Increase agility pool.
  • Decreases delay between attacks.
  • Increases attack range.
  • Increases player speed.

Comparison of agility over balanced over strength attacks:


Agility modifed attack


Semi agility-strength modified attack


Strength modified attack

Gaining level you also discover new attack types with numerous of modifiers:

  • Damage multiplier.
  • Splash Damage (hits multiple targets)
  • Stunning Damage.
  • Kickback Damage.
  • Critical Damage.

Based on discovered attack types you are able to pick battle style, which is basically switches attacks combo. Hitting a stretch goal, creating own combo from discovered attacks will be available.

Beating boss of each level you're getting his position:

          Courier                                              Line Manager                                              Manager

 

WEAPONS

Weapons are very important part of attack system. Right now weapon arsenal is presented by only melee weapons, keyboards primarily. Weapons are differs by initial damage, modifiers, like, critical hit multiplier and chance, energy requirement per hit and more to come. I'm trying to use weight, size of real keyboards as a reference to set keyboard attack attributes. Few weapons examples:

Hitting a stretch goal ranged weapons will be introduced

 

BUFFS/DEBUFFS (in development)

Buffs/Debuffs is an another gameplay mechanic that grants some positive or negative effects on player for a certain period of time. Those effects could be granted by having drinks, food or using some devices (positive effects); or from being attacked by special enemy abilities (negative effects). Few buffs:

  • Increased speed.  
  • Decreased incoming damage.  
  • Increased out-coming damage.  
  • Increased Energy restoration speed.  
  • Increased HP restoration speed.
  • Time lock.
  • Invulnerability.

Almost all positive buffs have opposite, negative version represented by debuffs.

There are special, secret drinks that might grant you very decent positive effects or quite bad negative effects. It's up to you to choose to use them or not.

 

PUZZLE ELEMENTS

On some levels it's not enough to just beat everyone's asses up, but you need to complete some goals to reach the end of level. They are not too complex, it could be either maze, where you need to find right rooms, or finding hidden triggers that unlock boss door. Alongside with that game is full of Easter eggs which are not required to be discovered, but might make your life easier or bring some fun to the game.

 

SOUNDTRACK

Here are some tracks. More to come :)

 

LEVEL DESIGN

Game has 8 levels. Some level examples:
Important note: this is just level design drafts, levels in game are in 2D!

Couriers Level

Conveyor Floor​

Research Floor

 

WHERE WILL MONEY GO

Right now I'm the only developer of this game, and I'm not super happy with this fact.

Things like drawing, music composition taking tons of my time and I'd prefer to delegate this to professional artists who can do it much better and faster. Same time that will allow me to concentrate on gameplay, coding and polishing techy stuff.

Another important item of expenditure is marketing. 

 

DEVELOPMENT PROCESS

Right now I'm having internal development log where I'm posting day-to-day changes on the game. My goal is to make development as transparent as possible, especially if project is successfully baked.

Next step would be to spin-up a blog where I'll expose development progress. I'll also create a discord channel and youtube playlist for those who want to help me making this game real.

story:
Important update:

We have great news for all of you people. We received some help recently and now we are able to add the Steam port for PC and Mac to our original goal.

That means that all of our backers will receive a steam Key for Kung-Fu UFO on top of the other rewards once the game releases on this platform.

Now people can get a copy of our game for $10. We believe that this adds a lot of value to all of our perks and it will motivate more backers to support our project.

That also allows us to lower our stretch goals as well.

Thank you very much for your help and support.

 

 

 

 

Kung-Fu UFO is a 16bit story driven adventure game heavily inspired by sci-fi and martial arts games and movies from the 80s and 90s. While not trying to emulate any existing titles it’s very important for us that Kung-Fu UFO looks and feels like a game released more than 20 years ago. We’ve taken inspiration from retro console and arcade games and also old movies to craft the gameplay, graphics, and story. Games like the TMNT beat' em ups, Battletoads, Prince of Persia, and Mortal Kombat, and even some more retro and obscure games like The Way of the Exploding Fist and The Way of the Tiger on the C64 and ZX Spectrum are being used as reference.

 

 

 

We've always been huge fans of the Sega Mega Drive, we felt that it was the right thing to do to develop our first full game for this 16-bit system.

The game is currently at the aplha stage and we will release the finished game in December 2019, we want to have enough time to make everything according to our plan and test the game on as many different consoles as we can to ensure that it works properly. We're launching this Indiegogo campaign to fund the remainder of the development.

Kung Fu -UFO has been playable on a few local and international events including Gamescom 2018. Soon to be shown in events in Spain and China.

 

 

We've already been featured on gaming sites like Homebrew Legends, Retromaniac, Tec Toy, Indie Retro News, Retro Video Gamer and One Angry Gamer.

 

  

 

 

 


 

 

 

Yong’s father left when he was just a baby. He grew up helping his mother on their humble farm just outside the city. Growing up in a little country from south america was not easy for a curious boy with asian traits, but Yong was happy with the little he had, playing soccer and wandering the streets with his friends.

 

 

 

One night a beautiful alien reaches out to him with a mysterious message just moments before a strange chinese looking bandit breaks into the house kidnapping Yong’s mother and leaving behind nothing but a weird map with an X marking a place very far away.

Who is this mysterious bandit and what does he want with Yong and his mother? Why is an alien asking for his help? Our hero will need need to travel all around the world and beyond to solve a mystery, save his family, his planet, and maybe, just maybe, the whole galaxy.

 

 

 

Throughout the game the story will be told both by dialogues between the characters and with cutscenes which are being carefully planned and hand drawn before being turned into beautiful 16-bit art.

 

 


 

 

 

Kung-Fu UFO presents a very nostalgic mix between platformer and beat' em up genres that will feel both fresh and very familiar. The gameplay’s progression is very story driven and it includes exploration and some puzzle elements to solve on top of the jumping, climbing, and running.

 

 

 

No retro game is complete without ice levels… Right?

 

 

 

When it comes to dealing with those annoying bad guys we hand-crafted a fighting engine with kicks, punches blocks and combos that is very intuitive and can be simple or complex, depending on what the game needs and how you decide to play it. It will also include some very cool special attacks and powers to take care of the wide arrange of human and alien enemies.

 

 


This is a work in progress level on a dangerous alien planet.

 

Challenging boss fights and bonus stages with different vehicles and gameplay styles will keep the game's pace varied and exciting and enhance the experience.

 


This guy is definitely one of the game's bosses :P

 

The game will keep you hooked while you make your way across 5 different levels with various stages, each containing a number of collectible items for you to find with some rewards and surprises for getting them all.

 

Here's part of one of the levels

 

This will be just one of many bonus stages that will include vehicles… VROOM! VROOM!

 

 

Need to run some errands? Don’t worry, the game will have a password system so you can continue where you left off, grab some pen and paper and write it down just like the old days (yeah or take a photo it also works but it’s not that retro you know).

 

 


 

  • A 16-bit cartridge - Playable on SEGA Mega Drive and Genesis consoles and compatible clones (PAL, NTSC-US, NTSC-J)
  • 16-bit pixel art - Beautiful hand crafted and animated graphics and cutscenes.
  • 16-bit chiptune - A  rocking soundtrack with a variety of songs and tons of sound effects.
  • Story driven gameplay - That mixes different genres like platformer, beat’ em up, fighting and more.
  • A main character with lots of different moves - Kicks, punches, combos and special attacks and more to be unlocked as you make your way through the game.
  • Vehicles to drive and boss fights - Because running around all the time is not that fun, you'll also be able to drive a motorbike, a plane, and more... Stopping here and there to finish off some huge baddies in order to go on with the story.
  • Different stages - Not only graphically, but also in gameplay mechanics with bonus stages and huge levels for you to explore and clean out of enemies. Each level will have its own set of different enemies. Keeping the gameplay and the game's progression varied in every chapter from beggining to end. 
  • Difficulty levels - So anyone can enjoy and finish the game and everyone can set the bar to their preferred challenge.
  • Password system - Bringing back the almost forgotten yet thrilling experience of getting a pen and a piece of paper and writing down a code in order to be able to continue the game where you left off.  
  • An amazing cover art - made by Yayo our concept artist.

 

 

 

 

Of course there is! We worked really hard to be able to show you at least a small piece of our game. You can download it by clicking the image below. It can be played in any SEGA Mega Drive / Genesis emulator or consoles using Flashcarts. Just click on the image below.

Please have in mind that this demo is intended to give you an idea of what to expect of the final game but it does not represent the full experience since there are still missing features and lots of tweaking and fixing to do. It hasn't been extensively tested on all platforms so there might be some bugs... We can guarantee that they won't be there when we launch the final version.

You can even play the demo on a Sega Nomad! Thanks to our friend Kent Campbell for this photo. It looks amazing.

 

 

 

  • We love making and playing retro video games, it is an important part of our lives.
  • We love the Sega Mega Drive / Genesis, it is a great console with resources and limitations that will allow us to do exactly the game we want to do.
  • We have the knowledge and most of the resources needed to carry out the development (and with what we still lack you can help us ;P).
  • We find it much more attractive than developing a game to launch only on Steam or only on modern platforms. Definitely this development presents a series of challenges that we have been facing with pleasure and so we will continue until we see the finished product.
  • There is a large number of players and developers who enjoy this kind of videogames on retro consoles just like us, as well as on more current platforms and we want to be part of that great community.

 

This might not be the final version, but it will give you a good idea of how the cover looks.

 

 

 

With hard work, effort and lots of passion.

 

 

It’s a long process and we need to be very careful in each step of the road. We have invested a lot of time into crafting the story and characters. Several hours have been spent sketching the characters and stages that will be featured on the game.

The game’s development is being made with free and open source software and tools.

The engine is being programmed mostly in Basic with some Assembler 68000 routines and later compiled in SecondBASIC (by Second Dimension).

We also use custom software developed in PC and Amiga for managing graphics, stages, color palettes and much more.

The pixel art graphics are carefully handcrafted from scratch or using hand drawn concept art as reference and always having in mind the console’s restrictions of tiles and sprites sizes, and color palettes and numbers.

 

 

Here are some game over sketches and the final pixel art that you can see in the game.

 

The music is made in Deflemask Tracker and read by the console using the VGM2 driver.
Sound effects are created both using DAW or generated by code.

 

 

Every new version of the game is properly tested not only in emulators but also in a variety of original and compatible hardware using custom cartridges and Everdrives.

We have managed to gather many of the most commonly used Mega Drive and Genesis consoles (1,2, and 3) from different territories, and some of the most popular clones out there.

 

 

These will be used to test the different versions of the game through the whole development process  to ensure that it works and plays well regardless of the hardware. Same thing with the controllers, Kung-Fu UFO is being designed and tested with the 3 button pad and the 6 button pads and joysticks.

 

We have also a large number of modern and CRT TVs displays and PVMs to ensure that the experience of playing Kung-Fu UFO is as close to playing a game made in the 90s as possible.

 

 

The development of the engine is in a very advanced stage and the main character has already been implemented almost in its entirety (missing some special powers and a few animations). What remains ahead is to add the different levels and stages as well as their respective enemies and bosses. The game in its current state can be played in emulators as well as in original SEGA hardware and compatible consoles. We trust that the rest of the development of Kung Fu UFO will not present major issues.

 


Rain!!! Another work in progress feature made 100% with code.
We are planning on adding different climatic changes throughout the game.

 


 

 Sebastian Abreu “tacha”

According to him, tacha learned to compose music while in the womb of his mother who was a pianist. He started using LOGO in the 90s and soon after started programming in BASIC and Assembler in a TK90 computer. In the middle of that same decade he switched to the ZX Spectrum where he continued creating programs and music in BASIC for the AY 3-8912 chip of that system. Programs music in a variety of Trackers some of them of his own authorship.
He has worked as a music & sound designer for more than a decade, making cinema presentations in 5.1 Dolby Digital and TV commercials for more than 15 countries.

He has officially composed Music&Sound for more than 30 videogames so far (physical bingo & slot machines, Android, PC and Commodore AMIGA)

For 6 years he has been teaching at a video game development school.

 -Programmer

 - Musician

 - Retro console and retro computer collector

 - Exemplary father

 - Favorite Sega MegaDrive/Genesis game: Sonic The Hedgehog, Sonic 2, Sonic 3, Final Fight CD, Battletoads, Virtua Racing, Ristar, Mickey Mania, Mega Turrican.

 

 Javier Leal “Jav”

Jav has worked as an artist and graphic designer since he was a teenager. He studied design, illustration, and animation in college; and he has more than 10 years of experience as an artist and game designer on dozens of video games for several platforms, both in 2D and 3D. He is one of the founding members of a company called Estudio Egg, which is dedicated to the development of educational and advertising games. He started with pixel art in MS Paint at the end of the 90’s and hasn't stopped since then.

 - Pixel artist

 - Game designer

 - Full time retro gamer

 - His desk is full of action figures

 - Favorite Sega MegaDrive/Genesis games: Blades of vengeance, Aladdin, Golden Axe, Castlevania Bloodlines, Chakan, Judge Dredd, Splatterhouse (all 3), Megaman The Willy Wars, World of Illusion, and Gunstar Heroes.

Yayo has been drawing for as long as he can remember. A mostly self-taught artist, he has had some studies in drawing and comics along with graphic design and digital art for some years.  - Concept artist and illustrator

 - Paleontologist wannabe

 - Manga geek

 - Loves dinosaur bootleg toys

 - Favorite Sega MegaDrive/Genesis game: Battletoads, Rocket Knight Adventures, Earthworm Jim, Zombies ate my Neighbors.

 

 

 

We’re also working closely with Adam Welch, the owner of Second Dimension and creator of SecondBASIC, the compiler that we are using to make our game playable on the consoles.

Adam is also giving us a huge help with getting the game into actual cartridges providing us with the shells, memories, PCBs and more.

 

 

For more information, please visit: http://www.second-dimension.com 
Follow Second Dimension on Twitter and Facebook.

Note: the shown pixel art for the rewards are just for illustration purposes only, and does not represent the look of the final products.

 

 

 

 

Reaching this goal will allow us to port Kung-Fu UFO to mobile platforms like Android and iOS. Every perk will get a copy for the preferred platform if this goal is met.

 

 

With 50k we'll be able to improve the size of Kung-Fu UFO's cartridges up to 64 Megabits allowing the game to be the double of what we first intended meaning it wil have more content, art and cutscenes... We are really hoping for this.

 

 

If we hit this stretch goal we are goint to invest in Second Dimension to develop a SNES compiler that will be available for free just like the Mega Drive / Genesis one that we are using to make Kung-Fu UFO. Also we promise to port Kung-Fu UFO to SNES cartridges that will be available for purchase after all of the other versions are released... Wouldn't that be awesome? Let's make this happen!!!

 



 

If you want to keep up with our project and interact with us while we make the game please follow us on:

 http://twitter.com/retronerve

 

 https://www.facebook.com/retronerve

 

 https://www.instagram.com/retronervegames

 

 https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCo1pO54thENwEz...

 

 https://www.patreon.com/retronerve

 

And visit our website

http://retronerve.games 


 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Making videogames is not an easy task and making a retro game for a 30 year old console is a huge challenge and that’s why we are doing this… Challenges are fun, videogames are fun both to make and to play. For us the most difficult part is this one, the funding.

We have the experience and knowledge to complete the project, we managed to put together a demo that runs smoothly on cartridge in the original hardware and all that you see here with very little to no resources and once we reach our goal we are confident that the rest of the development process will be just more of what we have already done but a lot easier.

Besides… We are working with the help of some amazing friends and people that have been lending a hand through the development of the project and will continue to do so and that gives us a lot of confidence.

 

SPECIAL THANKS

A huge thank you to our Patrons. Without you guys we wouldn't have made it this far and we are really thankful for your help and support.

Very special thanks to Natalia and Paola our always supporting and loving wives.

Thanks to Adam Welch for being the coolest dude and helping us so much. 

To Gabriel and Silvestre from XUruguay for helping us promote our project to more people.

Thanks to all of our friends that have been there since the beginning of this journey. You know who you are and you are amazing.
story_txt:
Important update:We have great news for all of you people. We received some help recently and now we are able to add the Steam port for PC and Mac to our original goal.That means that all of our backers will receive a steam Key for Kung-Fu UFO on top of the other rewards once the game releases on this platform.Now people can get a copy of our game for $10. We believe that this adds a lot of value to all of our perks and it will motivate more backers to support our project.That also allows us to lower our stretch goals as well.Thank you very much for your help and support.    Kung-Fu UFO is a 16bit story driven adventure game heavily inspired by sci-fi and martial arts games and movies from the 80s and 90s. While not trying to emulate any existing titles it’s very important for us that Kung-Fu UFO looks and feels like a game released more than 20 years ago. We’ve taken inspiration from retro console and arcade games and also old movies to craft the gameplay, graphics, and story. Games like the TMNT beat' em ups, Battletoads, Prince of Persia, and Mortal Kombat, and even some more retro and obscure games like The Way of the Exploding Fist and The Way of the Tiger on the C64 and ZX Spectrum are being used as reference.   We've always been huge fans of the Sega Mega Drive, we felt that it was the right thing to do to develop our first full game for this 16-bit system.The game is currently at the aplha stage and we will release the finished game in December 2019, we want to have enough time to make everything according to our plan and test the game on as many different consoles as we can to ensure that it works properly. We're launching this Indiegogo campaign to fund the remainder of the development.Kung Fu -UFO has been playable on a few local and international events including Gamescom 2018. Soon to be shown in events in Spain and China.  We've already been featured on gaming sites like Homebrew Legends, Retromaniac, Tec Toy, Indie Retro News, Retro Video Gamer and One Angry Gamer.         Yong’s father left when he was just a baby. He grew up helping his mother on their humble farm just outside the city. Growing up in a little country from south america was not easy for a curious boy with asian traits, but Yong was happy with the little he had, playing soccer and wandering the streets with his friends.   One night a beautiful alien reaches out to him with a mysterious message just moments before a strange chinese looking bandit breaks into the house kidnapping Yong’s mother and leaving behind nothing but a weird map with an X marking a place very far away.Who is this mysterious bandit and what does he want with Yong and his mother? Why is an alien asking for his help? Our hero will need need to travel all around the world and beyond to solve a mystery, save his family, his planet, and maybe, just maybe, the whole galaxy.   Throughout the game the story will be told both by dialogues between the characters and with cutscenes which are being carefully planned and hand drawn before being turned into beautiful 16-bit art.     Kung-Fu UFO presents a very nostalgic mix between platformer and beat' em up genres that will feel both fresh and very familiar. The gameplay’s progression is very story driven and it includes exploration and some puzzle elements to solve on top of the jumping, climbing, and running.   No retro game is complete without ice levels… Right?    When it comes to dealing with those annoying bad guys we hand-crafted a fighting engine with kicks, punches blocks and combos that is very intuitive and can be simple or complex, depending on what the game needs and how you decide to play it. It will also include some very cool special attacks and powers to take care of the wide arrange of human and alien enemies.  This is a work in progress level on a dangerous alien planet. Challenging boss fights and bonus stages with different vehicles and gameplay styles will keep the game's pace varied and exciting and enhance the experience. This guy is definitely one of the game's bosses :P The game will keep you hooked while you make your way across 5 different levels with various stages, each containing a number of collectible items for you to find with some rewards and surprises for getting them all. Here's part of one of the levels This will be just one of many bonus stages that will include vehicles… VROOM! VROOM!  Need to run some errands? Don’t worry, the game will have a password system so you can continue where you left off, grab some pen and paper and write it down just like the old days (yeah or take a photo it also works but it’s not that retro you know).   

A 16-bit cartridge - Playable on SEGA Mega Drive and Genesis consoles and compatible clones (PAL, NTSC-US, NTSC-J)

16-bit pixel art - Beautiful hand crafted and animated graphics and cutscenes.

16-bit chiptune - A  rocking soundtrack with a variety of songs and tons of sound effects.

Story driven gameplay - That mixes different genres like platformer, beat’ em up, fighting and more.

A main character with lots of different moves - Kicks, punches, combos and special attacks and more to be unlocked as you make your way through the game.

Vehicles to drive and boss fights - Because running around all the time is not that fun, you'll also be able to drive a motorbike, a plane, and more... Stopping here and there to finish off some huge baddies in order to go on with the story.

Different stages - Not only graphically, but also in gameplay mechanics with bonus stages and huge levels for you to explore and clean out of enemies. Each level will have its own set of different enemies. Keeping the gameplay and the game's progression varied in every chapter from beggining to end. 

Difficulty levels - So anyone can enjoy and finish the game and everyone can set the bar to their preferred challenge.

Password system - Bringing back the almost forgotten yet thrilling experience of getting a pen and a piece of paper and writing down a code in order to be able to continue the game where you left off.  

An amazing cover art - made by Yayo our concept artist.
    Of course there is! We worked really hard to be able to show you at least a small piece of our game. You can download it by clicking the image below. It can be played in any SEGA Mega Drive / Genesis emulator or consoles using Flashcarts. Just click on the image below.Please have in mind that this demo is intended to give you an idea of what to expect of the final game but it does not represent the full experience since there are still missing features and lots of tweaking and fixing to do. It hasn't been extensively tested on all platforms so there might be some bugs... We can guarantee that they won't be there when we launch the final version.You can even play the demo on a Sega Nomad! Thanks to our friend Kent Campbell for this photo. It looks amazing.   
We love making and playing retro video games, it is an important part of our lives.
We love the Sega Mega Drive / Genesis, it is a great console with resources and limitations that will allow us to do exactly the game we want to do.
We have the knowledge and most of the resources needed to carry out the development (and with what we still lack you can help us ;P).
We find it much more attractive than developing a game to launch only on Steam or only on modern platforms. Definitely this development presents a series of challenges that we have been facing with pleasure and so we will continue until we see the finished product.
There is a large number of players and developers who enjoy this kind of videogames on retro consoles just like us, as well as on more current platforms and we want to be part of that great community.
 This might not be the final version, but it will give you a good idea of how the cover looks.   With hard work, effort and lots of passion.  It’s a long process and we need to be very careful in each step of the road. We have invested a lot of time into crafting the story and characters. Several hours have been spent sketching the characters and stages that will be featured on the game.The game’s development is being made with free and open source software and tools.The engine is being programmed mostly in Basic with some Assembler 68000 routines and later compiled in SecondBASIC (by Second Dimension).We also use custom software developed in PC and Amiga for managing graphics, stages, color palettes and much more.The pixel art graphics are carefully handcrafted from scratch or using hand drawn concept art as reference and always having in mind the console’s restrictions of tiles and sprites sizes, and color palettes and numbers.  Here are some game over sketches and the final pixel art that you can see in the game. The music is made in Deflemask Tracker and read by the console using the VGM2 driver.Sound effects are created both using DAW or generated by code.  Every new version of the game is properly tested not only in emulators but also in a variety of original and compatible hardware using custom cartridges and Everdrives.We have managed to gather many of the most commonly used Mega Drive and Genesis consoles (1,2, and 3) from different territories, and some of the most popular clones out there.  These will be used to test the different versions of the game through the whole development process  to ensure that it works and plays well regardless of the hardware. story:
The Game

In Artificer's Forge you play as a Mage who crafts and sells magical goods, by filling in personal requests or making wondrous items that absolutely must be bought! Item crafting comes in a form of puzzle solving and time management. So, if the idea of solving puzzles, being efficient, and coming up with your own recipes sounds fun to you, this is certainly your game.

You start off as a low level mage, making menial items for the common folk in the forms of work fulfillment quests to get your start. As you progress you'll be able to craft more interesting and higher quality goods that make it even more tempting to purchase outside of your work orders. Quests will help you progress in the game, but making rare and unique items is where you'll get your highest returns either in terms of currency or unique items you cannot obtain otherwise.

To be more specific about item creation itself, it is a mix of both management of your space and putting together the right regents. It starts by setting each machine to a number of items it will accept once the number of items have been placed in the machine, it will make  the item that corresponds with the provided materials. Items are not place in your inventory immediately and must be removed from conveyor belts in a timely manner to avoid overflowing piles of goods. The main puzzle is making production stays at a consistent, manageable pace while making effective use of storage. You need enough inventory to keep up with demand, but not so much you're overwhelmed.

To aid you in your craft, you may summon minions to do your bidding for you, gathering goods based on what they are and what you fuel them with. Using your golems will be a separate game from your usual crafting, and they're your primary means of gathering materials. As of this time the extent of golem combat has not been completely determined but it will either be passive or something more akin to a mini game.

Machines are also crafted to speed up your work and make greater quality goods, but will require management and balancing. Trading for required regents or possibly even tools or machines will be an important factor to progress in your game. Both your Golems and Machines will need to be upgraded in order to keep up with your growing business, so you'll need to make sure you have enough materials for both upgrades as well as production.

The Game is made in unity3D. It will be from the 2D perspective and made with the sprites above, as well as sprites of machines. The items being processed will float along magic chutes going from machine to machine and being processed.

The Team

Mythwing Interactive is a small team with a goal of creating fun, interactive fantasy games with it's first title being Artificer's Forge. This entire first project so far has been completely funded out of pocket but current circumstances has made it difficult to keep the project on track, so we seek your assistance in getting our first game rolling!

Now let us tell you about our team!

Lead Programmer: Jonathan Wheelock 
Experience: 10+ years in c# and application programming

Programmer: Eric Warsop
Experience: 10+ years in c#

Programmer: Charlie Kellner
 Experience:

Lucasfilm Games: Rescue on Fractalus, Koronis Rift, The Eidolon, Labyrinth, Habitat

Epyx: California Games 2, Electrocop, Rampage, Gauntlet 2

Digital Pictures: Sewer Shark

Mammoth Micro Productions: The Pagemaster Storygame, Izzy's Olympic Adventure

Wizards of the Coast: Magic the Gathering Online 3.0, D&D Insider

Nintendo Software Technology: Nintendo Web Framework

Lead Artist: Ashley McGivern

 

Our Goals & Wishes

The game is currently scheduled to be in a playable beta state in about 6 months and released on Steam Early Access at that time. What this campaign would help us with, is getting the game completed much sooner as well as help our team focus on the game. And by much sooner, we mean as soon as 2 months if we reach our goal! 

To get an idea of where we are at now, we have our design outline, detailing the basic mechanics and layout. We are still determining the nature of content as we build our testing prototype. Our GDD is thus partially finished, and we’re still testing out the basic mechanics. We have a very sparse overworld map and tower inside, as well as the classes for resources and resource generation.

Since we believe it's important to have an enjoyable game first, core mechanics such as the crafting engine will be what we focus on first. The UI is also of utmost importance as we wish for the player to know exactly what they're looking at and what to do. Next will be game elements to add more complications such as random caravan events and even possibly rival competition. Lastly, with time and funding, we can add flare to the game such as customization for your Avatar, the tower itself and other elements.

Funding Choices & Rewards

The funding for this project is set to Flexible, meaning we will keep all donations. Regardless if we meet our goal or not, the game will be completed, it's not a project that will disappear.

As for what you get for supporting us, for small amount backers, the only thing we can offer is our thanks. Those that back a certain amount will be provided a key to Steam Early Access as soon as it gets approved.

How Else To Help

Tell your friends about our Project! Every little bit helps!

If you'd like to follow along behind this project, please follow us on our Blog and Twitter!

The funding for this project is set to Flexible, meaning we will keep all donations. Regardless if we meet our goal or not, the game will be completed, it's not a project that will disappear.
As for what you get for supporting us, for small amount backers, the only thing we can offer is our thanks. Those that back a certain amount will be provided a key to Steam Early Access as soon as it gets approved.

How Else To Help
Tell your friends about our Project! Every little bit helps!
If you'd like to follow along behind this project, please follow us on our Blog and Twitter!

story:
Drone Wars inspiration came from a video in which drones tied up with fireworks were used for air battle. This is awesome! I want to do it，too! But we were not satistied with tinding up fireworks with the drones – it is easy to crash and tedious. So, I had to find a safer and fun way. After a period of researching, planning and testing, Drone Wars was finally born.

Drone Wars is an AR drone air battle game. It has PVE mode and online PVP mode. As you can see in the trailer, the real-time flight data is called to directly simulate game contents, enemy planes, cannons and interface on returned vedio.

The controlling method is through drone remote control. The targets are locked automatically first, then the cannons and missiles are launched automatically. Of course, you can switch to manual launch mode.

Apart from the things mentioned above, it also features:

●Cannons

Currently, 6 kinds of cannon are available with different "Damage", "Range", "Rounds", "Reload Time" and "Weight".

Take a look at how your drone looks like with the cannons↓

It's pertty cool I think.

●Missiles(AAM)

Currently,  8 kinds of missile are available with different "Damage", "Tracking", "Speed", "Range", "Lock", "Lock Time", "Reload Time" and "Weight".

 

●Assist

It Includes 3 types of radars and decoy flares.

 

●Carrying load

Your drone is designed with carrying load capacity. Every weapon comes with a different weight hence choose them depending on your specific situations.

 

●Coins

At the beginning of each game, 1000 coins are available for you to buy initial weapons in the hangar. During the game, you can earn more coins by picking up and shooting down enemy planes. You can buy weapons at check points.

 

Released date: October 2017

We are currently working on PVE mode. PVE mode includes 4 types: "Dogfight"(completed), "Defense", "Assassination" and "General War". Then the project will enter multiplayer online mode development. At the latest, we will start multiplayer online mode beta test in September. The official release will be published by the end of October. At that time, you can fight with players from all around the world.

Note: Can't find your drones here? Don't worry. We are working on it. Maybe the next is yours!

Note: Cannon F cannot be used due to the design problems in DJI PHANTOM series drone.

 

C SERIES

 

F SERIES

 

G SERIES

I & J SERIES

 

YFC Games is an indie game development team - a small team with a big dream. We have been specialized in developing interesting games. Our game development adventure started in 2012. Over past 6 years, we have released 6 games. Nothing can stop us from moving forward, regardless it is success or failure.

Our games:

 

 

We are currently at the multiplayer stage and will perform multiplayer online test soon. We need to invest in more comprehensive laboratory equipment. More importantly, if an experienced player like you can join the early stage testing, we will get better and more precious feedback. Please help us to complete this feat.

If you like this project, please support us and share it with your friends who may be interested. Thanks for your support. If you don’t have a drone right now, no worries and my feeling is that you will own one drone very soon.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/DroneWarsAR/

Web: http://www.yfcgames.com

E-mail：support@yfcgames.com

story:
At Frost Grove Games we are gamers who love games. We also love quality gaming components and accessories. That’s why we have wanted realistic coins for years. So we decided to make some, but we need your help.

We plan on making the three classic gaming levels of coins: Copper, Silver and Gold.

Antiqued Copper

Antiqued Silver

Antiqued Gold

ABOUT DIMENSIONS:

These are not token style coins.  They are larger, thicker and heavier than US Quarters and with far better detail. The current funding goal in this launch requires that all the coins be the same size with our stretch goals, we’re hoping to change this to three different sized coins.  Check back for updates on this as we approach the stretch goal.

Initial Dimensions:

  • 1.00” diameter x .079” thick (US Quarter = .955”  x ..069”)
  • 24.26 mm dia. x 2.00 mm thick (US Quarter = 24.266 mm x 1.75mm) 
  • 6.00 grams (US Quarter = 5.670 grams) 

USES:

Board/ Card games

Here is just a small sample of games that our coins can be used with.  These can be utilized as either as replacement coins or victory tokens.

Role Playing Games:

  • Dungeons and Dragons
  • GURPS
  • World of Darkness: Vampire, the Masquerade. Werewolf the Apocalypse, etc
  • Dark Heresy
  • Rifts: Fantasy
  • Exhalted

Live Action Role Playing Games:

  • World of Darkness
  • Cyberpunk
  • Dungeons and Dragons
  • Lord of the Rings

Other:

  • Society for Creative Anachronism (SCA)
  • Renaissance Faires
  • Poker!

And so much more!

What We Need & What You Get

What we need: $13,500

What the money is used for: Manufacturing of high quality real metal coins. To get our costs down we need to make a lot of coins, but who doesn't want more coins! Shipping and handling, and transaction processing fees.

What happens if we exceed our goal: That will mean needing to produce more coins, more shipping and more swag, nothing is wasted!

How does my pledge work: You pay now, and WHEN, not IF the project funds you will be asked shipping and batch selection information so we can send your set of coins as swiftly as possible. If, by some chance, the project doesn't fund all your pledged money will be refunded - Every penny of it!

What else can I get: SWAG - (SEE BELOW)

How can I, as a backer help make this work: Like us on Facebook, Tell your friends, coworkers, gaming buddies, and even your local gaming store.

 

In case you were wondering what you were going to put all these wonderful coins into here’s your answer.

All coins will come packaged in Velour pouches like the ones shown below, but we both know that’s not good enough for coins of this quality, which is why we will be offering a much better selection of SWAG packaging once we’ve met this goal. First let’s show you the goods, and then I’ll show you a table on how they will be awarded.

 

Images and pouches courtesy of http://www.softpouch.com

 

Pretty good stuff right? Here’s how to get it.

Step 1: Meet Stretch Goal

Step 2: That’s it… once we’ve met our Stretch goal; these will be automatically added to your order based on the chart below:

*NOTE* Shipping costs for Chests outside the US will require extra shipping

Same Coins, but now in three different sizes:

Copper Coin:

Dimensions:

  • .897” diameter x .079” thick (US Nickel = .835” x.077”)
  • 22.8 mm dia. x 2.00 mm thick (US Quarter = 24.266 mm x 1.75mm)
  • 6.00 grams (US Quarter = 5.670 grams)

Silver Coin:

Dimensions:

  • .955” diameter x .079” thick (US Quarter = .955” x.069”)
  • 24.26 mm dia. x 2.00 mm thick (US Quarter = 24.266 mm x 1.75mm)
  • 7 grams (US Quarter = 5.670 grams)

Gold Coin:

Dimensions:

  • 1.00” diameter x .079” thick (US Quarter = .955” x.069”)
  • 25.4 mm dia. x 2.00 mm thick (US Quarter = 24.266 mm x 1.75mm)
  • 7.2 grams (US Quarter = 5.670 grams)

At this level we can either switch to a solid brass coin which will have the same dimensions but feel heavier, or we could produce a Platinum coin (shiny silver). As we approach this goal we will hold a survey to ask you the backers which you’d prefer.

STRETCH GOAL 4: - The Other Choice - $TBD

At this point we can do the other option that wasn’t selected at Stretch Goal 3!

Shipping is indicated in the picture below. I know it’s a whole lot of yellow, but this is what the USPS calls “the rest of everywhere else”.

**WEBSITE UNDER CONSTRUCTION**

Let's see if you are eligible to participate in sweepstake tournaments! 

Eligible United States / Districts / Territories

Alaska - Hawaii - Nebraska - Ohio - Virginia
Arizona Illinois - Nevada - Oregon - West Virginia
California - Iowa - New Hampshire - Pennsylvania - Wisconsin
Colorado - Kansas - New Jersey - Rhode Island - Wyoming
Connecticut - Kentucky - New Mexico - Tennessee
D.C. - Louisiana - New York - Texas
Delaware - Maine - North Carolina - Utah
Florida - Massachusetts - North - Dakota - Vermont

Eligible International Countries

Australia - Canada - France - United Kingdom

Check out a more extensive software video test: 


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iGfQpf8uoh0


FastMoneyPoker.com is an innovative entertainment company started to fill a void in the free play and subscription poker, games and entertainment market. While other companies offer game-play sites, none of them focus on the community and social aspects of such an entertainment site. It is this aspect, along with several cross-promotional opportunities, that will allow FastMoneyPoker.com to become a market leader in a short amount of time. The Company will launch with a unique advantage of having an established customer base already in place, giving it yet another edge in the marketplace. Beginning with a proven and scalable poker platform, the Company will provide legal poker games and tournaments for free and will provide additional benefits to subscribers that pay a monthly fee to win prizes under a sweepstakes model. 

Subscription Poker :

Subscription poker is a proven business model that is legal in the United States. Based upon Sweepstakes law, players are never asked to make a deposit and never make a wager. An alternative means of entry (AMOE) is allowed, such as sending in a postcard to subscribe. This allows prizes to be given away in the many states that allow such sweepstakes. After substantial legal analysis, we will allow subscriptions from 38 states. Residents of all 50 states can play for free. By allowing members to play unlimited games for a base monthly fee, it allows an inexpensive form of entertainment. In the current economy, people have less discretionary income and look for value in their entertainment offerings, which we can provide.


Product:

 The end-user product is very important to any software or website.FastMoneyPoker.com will be branded, and have a unique look and feel, but will function in a similar fashion to other club poker rooms allowing for easy customer usability. We have acquired software that will allow 10,000 (on one server) simultaneous players.  The software is customizable by the user to allow for the best player experience in online club poker today, and the graphics, interface, and ease of use are unlike any competitor in the market. The software has the ability to incorporate all client languages. For example, a member residing in Europe that speaks Chinese can view our entire website in Chinese and download the poker software interface in their native language. This will greatly assist us in marketing globally. In addition, the software is written utilizing current state of the art technology, unlike most software platforms that are five years old or older. FastMoneyPoker.com is a social community site that allows members to:
 • Write Blogs • Post Pictures • Share Videos • Live Chat • Post in Forums • Learn Poker • Rankings and Leader boards • Search for Friends • Post Avatars

Social play: 

*IMPORTANT* 

- Before you look at the pledge rewards and then read this, I want to clear the air. This is the ONLY time you can receive chips for pledging. We will NOT sell play chips to players. This is not where our source of revenue comes from. I personally believe in the social aspect of poker and believe that if you obtain 1 million chips, it's because the player has skill. This is one of the greatest incentives I could think of. I just want to state and make everyone aware that play chips will NOT be available for purchase. Grab them while you can!

Fast Money Poker would like to be home to those who find value in social poker. As we all know, Zynga and many other competitors are FILLED with ADVERTISEMENTS. We plan to have no advertising around our software. We will have partners that will sponsor the sides of the website, but during the game play, the user will have no interruptions. This aspect of removing advertisements will give us an advantage over the bigger name brands. The idea behind our social play is to have a strong virtual economy! We don't like the idea of every player having the oppurtunity to purchase millions of chips. When players are capable of obtaining millions of chips in matter of hours, the entertainment value of those chips can significantly decrease. Our plan of action is to have play chips mean something. Allow the users to compete in SNG games to earn more chips, or enter into 100,000 FMP chip qualifiers. The stack of chips you acquire should match your rank as a poker player. Feel good about the chips you have. You earned them!


RISK:


The only possible chance of set backs, are the funds.

With your help, the $10,000 dollars will go towards the money currently put in, and bring us a fully operational network. Everything has been priced out. Now it's up to you to make it happen.

Here's a list of what goes into the business.

- legal 
- accounting 
- graphic design 
- I.T. development 
- Website Design 
- Logo design 
- Payment processor 
- Hours of testing 
- marketing

Everything has been priced out to match my goal. Help support my dream, and pledge today! Thank you!

story:
About the project

On paper, the very gameplay looks simple:

- several classes of heroes to select

- possibility to buy upgrades

- earning gold through killing enemies

- recruiting allies that will help you (they may die!)

- eliminating Bosses, which is challenging


In practice (there were closed tests on the engine of our game) the feedback we received was positive.

Most players were surprised by the fact that the thing with such simple logic may be such entertainment.


What do we need?


You are probably wondering what we need from you?

We need financial support to create graphical user interface and the very graphics of our project:

- game interface

- heroes

- support units

- enemies

- upgrade icons


On top of our campaign's site we present the process of creating a hero to show you how we are going to develop every graphical piece.


What do we offer in exchange?


We’ll be grateful to you for all your support. On the right, there are specific packages we have prepared for you.

For contributions of $15 and above, we will send you some physical souvenir (with our logo or graphics from game) , a token of gratitude etc., by letter or package (we cover the shipping cost).


Physical shipments will be sent as soon as possible, but you must be patient (we’ll have to pick every order + create graphics to be placed on certain items).


Electronic deliveries will be faster than their physical counterparts – in this case we’ll have to wait just for graphics.


“Adamant*” packets will be sent out on the game’s release day.

* Adamant = premium currency in game.


Banners and acknowledgements will appear on the game’s website also on the release day. Banners will have priority when it comes to displaying – both types of acknowledgements will be placed randomly.

We reserve the right to decline to fill out and display a banner/acknowledgement if their content is socially unacceptable.


About us


We are the LudosProject team - enthusiasts who have decided to fulfill their dreams and start making browser games.


The most important thing to us is contact with you – we want to be your entertainment providers and we want to listen to your opinions and, if possible, introduce changes that will make our products even more user-friendly.


We believe that this is very important so don’t hesitate and write to us if you have any questions, and we’ll do our best to answer them.

story:
About

"Fairyland" is a side-scrolling game about a little girl Zoey who got stuck in a terrible dream, escape from which is possible only met face to face with all of its fears. 

In fact, Zoe - a girl with cancer. Sleep - a coma, in which she fell. Fighting in a dream symbolizes the struggle in reality - you can never retreat.

During the game girl will be grow up, fears will become more serious. From toys and clowns - to natural disasters, wars and death.

You can switch between Zoey and her dog to perform certain tasks


As far as passing you will have to solve logic puzzles, enter the battles with various monsters, demonstrate dexterity and ingenuity.

In this game you will be available more than 20 locations, which contains the new fears and trials. 

In the trailer you can see the actual gameplay.


About me

Hi! My name is Andrew and i'm an independent developer. From the morning till night I work at main job, and at night I develop games. What i want? I want to leave my job and fully delve into games development. 

The Funding will goes to rent an office and hiring a programmer and artist to help me.

I have planned to make a game within 4 months, and a month after the end of the campaign, every backer can get a demo.


Thank you!
story_txt:
About "Fairyland" is a side-scrolling game about a little girl Zoey who got stuck in a terrible dream, escape from which is possible only met face to face with all of its fears. 
In fact, Zoe - a girl with cancer. Sleep - a coma, in which she fell. Fighting in a dream symbolizes the struggle in reality - you can never retreat.

During the game girl will be grow up, fears will become more serious. From toys and clowns - to natural disasters, wars and death.




You can switch between Zoey and her dog to perform certain tasks


As far as passing you will have to solve logic puzzles, enter the battles with various monsters, demonstrate dexterity and ingenuity.

story:
The Project :

Due to the usage of Mario Kart models, the mod might be subject to a cease and desist order by Nintendo. This is why I want to create a brand new Rocket League account (and so Steam aswell) to publish the Rocket Kart mod to make sure my main account doesn't get banned.

This Indiegogo will help me purchase a new copy of Rocket League to publish the mod to the workshop. (Current price of Rocket League is $20, this is the amount I need)

DISCLAIMER : I only need 20€, not 500€ as it states.

About me :

I worked on Rocket League modding since its beginning back in June 2016. My most known map is Aerial Training and it as featured in one of the community spotlights on the Rocket League website. For a few months, I've been working on the Rocket Kart project. It has consisted of ripping models from the original games, adjusting them in Blender, and creating the entire map with collisions and lighting in UDK.

The risks :

I know this is a risky project because of copyrighting (especially concerning Nintendo). This is why I created this Indiegogo project not to get my main account banned if the project must go down.
