Two New Playable Races: Fight for the Horde as the blood elves, seeking a new source of arcane power or join the Alliance as the draenei, exiles from Outland in search of a new home.
Arenas: Assemble allies and prove your PvP prowess in 2v2, 3v3, or 5v5 combat in Arenas such as the Ring of Trials and the Circle of Blood.
Flying Mounts: Take flight in the chaotic skies of Netherstorm and soar over fel-touched Shadowmoon Valley with the introduction of flying mounts in Outland.
Master Challenging Raids and Dungeons: Conquer 5-player dungeons and Heroic dungeons set in the crystalline fortress of Tempest Keep, or raid the haunted halls of 10-player Karazhan as you gear up over time for a climactic confrontation against Kil’jaeden in 25-player Sunwell Plateau.
Jewelcrafting: Carve gems of power to socket into players’ gear with the Jewelcrafting profession.
Aldor and Scryer Factions: Choose between the Aldor or Scryer factions in Shattrath and earn their unique rewards
 Create a paladin on the Horde or a shaman on the Alliance.
Level to 70 and gain new class abilities and more.

story:
October Night Games is a digital tabletop game  about witches, vampires, dark magic, unspeakable cults, dogs and cats. The game has a procedurally generated narrative and vintage hand-tinted silent movie aesthetics.

Two groups of cultists confront each other: the Changers are summoning the Outer Gods, while the Keepers are trying to stop them. All cultists meet in a small town and prepare for the Final Ritual that takes place on Halloween’s full moon. Each cultist has an animal familiar, and their combinations may differ from game to game, creating unpredictable alliances.

We already have raised some funds during a successful Kickstarter and would like to continue here, on InDemand, to achieve more stretch goals.

You can read our old Kickstarter updates to learn our crowdfunding story.

 

When the full moon falls on Halloween, the boundaries between the worlds become thinner. During this night, the Outer Gods can enter our realm. But they need some help from the inside. A dangerous and challenging magic ritual called the Great Game can decide whether the Gates will open wide, allowing the Outer Gods to walk the Earth again, or stay sealed until the next special full moon. The strongest occultists, witches, magicians, mediums, and even mythical creatures (such as vampires and werewolves) flock to the place of the ritual to play their part in it. The ritual requires coordinated participation of two warring parties/Players who usually have different motivations to choose a side. Finding out who is on which team is an essential part of the game.

The overall setting of the game is mostly Lovecraftian, but playable characters come from many other authors, such as Abraham Merritt, Gustav Meyrink, and Bram Stoker. The rules and the plot were largely inspired by Roger Zelazny’s book A Night in the Lonesome October. Not only literary but also movie references are vital for our setting, we try to recreate the atmosphere of old-school vintage horror movies. 

 

You have thirty nights to prepare for the Final Ritual. Every day you can visit one of the three locations: the city, the cemetery, and the hollow. There you will look for ingredients, which, upon returning home, you can use for Lesser Rituals. In each location, there is a chance to meet an enemy, and such a meeting will end in battle. You will be able to collect the remaining ingredients undisturbed if you kill the enemy, but if you break their will, they will become your minion (and a possible sacrifice material).

Throughout the game, you will perform Lesser Rituals by combining various ingredients on the board. A successful ritual summons one of the Great Old Ones or Outer Gods, who will give you some knowledge, a valuable artefact, or a Dice of Fate, which you will use during the Final Ritual on Halloween.

October Night Games will be playable in Single- and Multiplayer mode. Both modes are going to feel very similar. AI-controlled players will be clever enough to act like real humans, they will be able to bluff, inflict vengeance and express gratitude.

Online with friends, with strangers, or alone with bots, you will get a remarkable experience, worth multiple replays.

Social Deduction

Is that true that the Outer Gods are so evil, cruel, and inhuman, or is it a lie by those who overthrew them and expelled them from our world? The Changers are ready to take risks and appeal to the Outer Gods for the sake of knowledge and freedom, even if there is a danger of plunging the whole world into bloody madness. For some of them, though, hecatombs, mass slaughter, blood, death, and the collapse of humanity are the real goals. On the other side, there are the Keepers, ready to sacrifice everything to preserve this world as it is and to prevent it from slipping into the abyss of chaos and cruelty. Some, however, believe that the world is already mired in wickedness and sins, and they find it to their benefit and pleasure. Both supporters and opponents of changes can be cruel and noble, vile and selfless.

The teams will not reveal themselves until Halloween. So, you have to find out who is your friend and who is your enemy by yourself. Players don’t give themselves out during simple dialogues, so you have to observe their actions during common events, which will occur every few days and may shift the balance in favour of one of the teams.

There are three Roles in each team: the Wand Holder, the Book Master, and the Lamp Bearer. There is an old rule: if three Players meet together to make a decision, each role should be present. It means that two players with the same role will never meet during such an event. By paying attention to who appears in shared events with you, you get a chance to identify the roles of other players and, consequently, their teams.

Rituals

October Night Games is about magic. The setting is based on magic, and we wanted to make it the basis of the gameplay as well. Regardless of how different the characters may be (witches, vampires, monks, crazy scholars, or adepts of unnamed cults), what different abilities they have, what different paths they choose and why, all of them have to prepare and perform a magical ritual. Therefore, inventing a magic system was an important task.

The first idea was to borrow rituals from different variations of the Necronomicon. Many authors tried to recreate this forbidden book: such works as Al Azif and The Simon Necronomicon are especially worth mentioning. Another influential manuscript containing Lovecraftian rituals was De Vermis Mysteriis, published by Robert Bloch. It revealed the terrible secrets of the Ancients from centuries before the Necronomicon was written.

Since we wanted to add more depth to the magic system of “fictional” occult schools, we moved on to the “real” ones, from The Metaphysics of Lovecraft by Anton Sandor LaVey to Aleister Crowley, who popularized the legacy of many medieval hermeticists. Ultimately, everything was brought together via Chaos Magic, special thanks to Peter Carroll and his Liber Null. Chaos Magic is a modern syncretic occult school that allows the mage to choose their symbolic language, invent new rituals and spells, or give different meanings to existing ones. That’s exactly what we needed to do.

The core of our magic and combat system is a Hexagram. There are planet symbols around it, and each symbol is related to a certain magical, or, if you like, psychological phenomenon. Each ingredient that can be found in the game contains two primary elements. By placing an ingredient in a corresponding slot, we draw a line connecting these elements on the Hexagram.

Each Lesser Ritual of the game invokes one of the Lovecraftian gods. The relationship with these entities is what makes the Changers different from the Keepers. The former want to let the Great Old Ones into our world, the latter want to keep them in the outer dimensions, but both teams draw their strength from them.

At the moment, there are six playable characters with unique motivation and abilities, and we hope to increase their number with your support. Each character has their own story to tell, often more than just one story. There are supernatural creatures along with humans that deny their humanity. Some of them rely on their intelligence and knowledge; some of them act intuitively; some of them embraced their madness. They may worship the Elder Ones or just try to use ancient powers for their advantage.

Each participant of the Great Game has an animal familiar. Some of them indeed are animals possessing the power of speech, while some are demons in the guise of an animal. Usually, familiars do not participate in battles, but they give valuable advice to their masters. Some can help find ingredients needed for a ritual, some are knowledgeable in alchemy, some are insightful psychologists able to help with intrigues and social deduction. Like some players, some familiars have been living for centuries, and some of them are old acquaintances, who used to participate in previous Games. Depending on the character of your choice, the abilities and skills of your familiar may open up in new and unexpected ways.

Our composer, Oskar, aspired to create something that would sound like a combination of old horror movie soundtracks and music from old computer games (from the 8 and 16-bit era). Danny Elfman’s scores for some of Tim Burton’s movies were among his inspirations as well. To achieve this sound, Oskar layered sampled and synthetic instruments with his recordings of real Celesta and Dulcitone, two rare instruments with an eerie sound. Both are played like a piano, but when the keys are struck, the hammers hit metal plates instead of strings, producing a bell-like sound more similar to a glockenspiel or vibraphone.

October Night Games began as a tabletop prototype. At first our artist Angie drew illustrations for the physical card game. Later they were adapted for the video game while preserving the initial art style. Angie took her inspiration from various forms of art, including cinema, music, and fine arts. Her drawings were influenced, among others, by Shaun Tan, Maurits Escher, Chris Van Allsburg, and Edward Gorey. An even bigger inspiration she got from old English book illustrations and engravings from the 18th and 19th centuries. Films by Tim Burton, Jean Cocteau, and retro horror movies, as well as music by Nick Cave, Einstürzende Neubauten, and Amiina (EP Fantômas) also made an influence. Sometimes she found inspiration even in her dreams at night.

When Angie started to work on the game, she drew some illustrations with pencils and charcoal, but later she switched to an iPad, keeping the same style. Now even the author herself finds it hard to tell what was drawn on paper and what was digital from the beginning.

The development of the game started in the summer of 2018 as a collaboration between developer Alexandr Wolodarskij and artist Angie Siveria, Berlin residents who used to experiment at game jams a couple of times before that. October Night Games is their first large project. In the autumn of 2018, a game designer from Dnipro Sasha Protasenya joined them as a mentor. At this point, our project became international.

At the very beginning, we were going to develop a tabletop game, and then a video game. But in the spring of 2019, we decided to omit a couple of steps and release the video game first. Since summer 2019, Alexandr has been working at the game full time (pretty much overtime). The next six months were spent developing the prototype and looking for funding. That summer, the project was joined by composer Oskar Schuster who agreed to write the soundtrack for it.

Unlike many indie developers, we could not afford to put the project on the back burner and get so-called “normal” jobs. The date of October 2020 is crucial for us – full moons rarely happen on Halloween, so releasing the game several months later would be a conceptual fiasco. There was no middle ground for us: either victory or failure. Eventually, when our savings were running low already, we got the funding: Medienboard Berlin-Brandenburg, an organization that supports innovative media projects, supported us financially.

In the spring of 2020, we finally received the funds, so our work picked up speed. Sasha Protasenya, who has already been giving invaluable guidance to the project as a mentor, joined it as managing designer. He helped engage new people: with his support, we were accompanied by narrative designer Daria Izvekova, UI/UX designer Michael Gribkov, and project manager Tanya Kucherenko, who organizes the workflow in our expanded team.

We managed to find a dynamic balance between a horizontal organizational structure and productivity. The decisions are taken consensually, and discussions produce brilliant new ideas and game mechanics. At the same time, we successfully avoid sinking in debates and discussions; we keep our work quick and effective.

The amazing trailer for our Kickstarter was made by Vanessa Williams (the other Vanessa Williams).

October Night Games would not have been possible without the support of many people: the ones who suggested ideas tested the game at different stages, proofread our texts, believed in us when the project existed only as a vaguely outlined concept. We cannot list all of them within a text for Kickstarter but definitely will mention them in the game credits. This applies to our future backers, whose active participation in the project is more than welcome, too.

Why Crowdfunding?

We have minimally sufficient funds needed to finish the development and release. Thanks to the support of the foundation Medienboard Berlin-Brandenburg, our current budget is enough to implement the planned minimum.

But we want to do so much more. New characters and game mechanics, new game locations, porting the game to other platforms, dynamic soundtrack responsive to the gamer’s actions – to implement all of this, we need more resources, which means more money. We already have received some incredible support on Kickstarter, but we would like to achieve more and to reach more stretch goals!

However, crowdfunding campaigns are not limited to financial support; this is a great marketing opportunity as well. crowdfunding is an excellent way to make a game recognizable and draw the attention of media and streamers. And, most significantly, crowdfunding helps to form in advance a community of committed gamers, really interested in the project. The earlier we get to know and understand our target audience, the better the game will be.

story:
SO, WHAT'S THE DEAL?

This Card Game are unique and will never be reprinted! Only crowd-funded supporters will have access to this Game.
People who pledge money for this game will have access to a lot of bonus content and savings, so don't pass up on this wonderful opportunity.

In the supporter levels you will see references to expansions and exclusives. There is a description of each of those items so that you can make the appropriate choice.  

ABOUT THE GAME

Lands Unknown is a creative, strategic card game that blends friendly competition with a good laugh!  It is intended for 2 to 5 players, ages 10+.
The game is comprised of 80 playing cards and 35 tokens.


WHY Lands Unknown IS AWESOME-

Lands Unknown is refreshingly new and creative game.  It is a harmonious blend of the simplicity of traditional card games with the strategy and creativity of more complex card games such as Magic: the Gathering.The game is Fun! And easy to learn!

Each land has thematic abilities in this fast playing game:

  • The sea and ships draw new cards, change hands etc.
  • The plains discard cards, uses discard pile etc.
  • The mountains destroy cards, destroy game tokens etc.
  • The hills allows playing more and more cards etc.
  • The sand flips cards, allows playing more game tokens etc.
  • The wood moves around cards and game tokens etc.

"RULES": By clicking on this Link, you can preview the very basic rules.

In Lands Unknown of bold adventurers that embark on a journey into unexplored continent. They will have to plan their advance carefully and use the terrain to their advantage if they are to best rivaling groups for the control of the continent.

This game is about building the continent map and striving to control the largest part of it. When used wisely, card abilities allow you to mess with opponents’ plans, expand your territory at great speed and so on. The game is easy to learn but hard to master.

WHERE DOES YOUR MONEY GO

The pledges YOU make will cover the costs associated with designing and printing the first edition card decks professionally, including boxes, shrink wrap, cards etc. This is where your money goes! 

We need your support that Lands Unknown could reach players and of course your home!! :)


Crowd funded special rewards

This exclusive 6 cards pack contains cards designed specifically to celebrate the success of our crowd funded project (and offered to our supporters of all levels) and can be used in any Lands Unknown game.

This Card Game is unique and will never be reprinted or in stores! Only crowd-funded supporters will have access to this exclusive Card Game of Lands Unknown.

17€ Lands Unknown: THE Card GAME

Lands Unknown is a creative, strategic card game that blends friendly competition with a good laugh!  It is intended for 2 to 5 players, ages 10+.
The game is comprised of 80 playing cards and 35 tokens.

20€ Atlantis

  This expansion puts a new spin on the game: it lets each player start with predetermined cards. The Atlantis cards can be added to any existing game. The Atlantis cards are played like all the other this game cards. This way player can choose different strategies for a game start, like expansion, destruction, obstruction, card advantage and other tactics.

22€ Operation of Neptune

 Want something more? Here are  new “volcano” cards with some exciting rules affecting whole game to add a new level of challenge. You will also receive a new set of road-starting cards that will affect every card on that road, so every time you start a game with a different set of road cards, it will be a different experience.

27€ Four Edges of the Map

 This expansion can make the game cooperative, also allowing more players to participate – anything up to 5 players or even a single player version. You will get a completely new 60 cards deck which will play for itself, and will be able to handle all of the players at once! Will you be able to beat the GAME with all the joined forces of your friends?!? Try and you will experience the fun of cooperative play and yet undiscovered emotions.

2€ Cards Holder/Case/Box

Card Holder (color: clear):
Overall box width: 100mm, height: 50mm, depth: 30mm.

Deep smaller Card boxes:
Overall box width: 100mm, height: 70mm, depth: 65mm.
Playing Card boxes (color: clear):
Overall box width: 95mm, height: 16mm, depth: 70mm.



BLACK/PINK deep smaller Card boxes (color: black/pink):
Overall box width: 100mm, height: 38mm, depth: 65mm.


3€ 3D printed Dice

  Coming SOON!!!

20€ printed Map

Size 36"x36 (for The Star Wars X-Wing Game or any other other Game )
More details coming soon!

As you can see, we have a lot to offer. More than a game, Lands Unknown is like a family of games. It has already been enjoyed by many players and playtested intensively over the last years. And with the various expansions it offers, you can tailor it to your individual needs.

Retailer Support Levels

These support levels provide resellers like retailers a fantastic deal.  You will get immediate shipping along with the other crowd-funded copies along with the fantastic discount. 150€level

FAQ

How much extra for International Shipping?

The shipping cost is not included in pledges. PLEASE,  add shipping cost to your pledge now.
*GAME World-wide shipping: 6€, but if You need registries shipping, play additional 2€.

*3D printed Dice:  alone shipping cost 6€, but with Lands Unknown Game we combine shipping  and you pay only for Lands Unknown Game shipping!

*Cards Holder/Case/Box:  alone shipping cost 6€ for up to 10pieces. Also with Lands Unknown Game we combine shipping (for one holder/case/box) and you pay only for Lands Unknown Game shipping!

*Map: Coming soon!

strategy and creativity of more complex card games such as Magic: the
Gathering.The game is Fun! And easy to learn! 
Each land has thematic abilities in this fast playing game:

The sea and ships draw
     new cards, change hands etc.
The plains discard
     cards, uses discard pile etc.
The mountains
     destroy cards, destroy game tokens etc.
The hills
     allows playing more and more cards etc.
The sand
     flips cards, allows playing more game tokens etc.
The wood moves
     around cards and game tokens etc.

"RULES":
By clicking on this Link,
you can preview the very basic rules.

In Lands Unknown of bold adventurers that
embark on a journey into unexplored continent. They will have to plan their
advance carefully and use the terrain to their advantage if they are to best
rivaling groups for the control of the continent. 
This game is about building the continent map and striving to control the
largest part of it. When used wisely, card abilities allow you to mess with
opponents’ plans, expand your territory at great speed and so on. The game is
easy to learn but hard to master.
WHERE DOES YOUR MONEY GO
The pledges YOU make will cover the costs associated with
designing and printing the first edition card decks professionally, including
boxes, shrink wrap, cards etc. This is where your money goes! 
We need your support that Lands Unknown could
reach players and of course your home!! :)Crowd funded special rewards
This exclusive 6 cards pack contains cards designed specifically to
celebrate the success of our crowd funded project (and offered to our
supporters of all levels) and can be used in any Lands
Unknown game.
This Card Game is unique and will never be reprinted or in stores! Only
crowd-funded supporters will have access to this exclusive Card Game of Lands Unknown.17€ Lands Unknown: THE Card GAME
Lands Unknown is a creative, strategic card game that
blends friendly competition with a good laugh!  It is intended for 2 to 5
players, ages 10+.
The game is comprised of 80 playing cards and 35 tokens.
20€ Atlantis
  This expansion puts a new spin on the game: it lets each player start
with predetermined cards. The Atlantis cards can be added to any existing game.
The Atlantis cards are played like all the other this game cards. This way player can
choose different strategies for a game start, like expansion, destruction,
obstruction, card advantage and other tactics.

22€ Operation of Neptune
 Want something more? Here are  new “volcano” cards with some
exciting rules affecting whole game to add a new level of challenge. You will
also receive a new set of road-starting cards that will affect every card on
that road, so every time you start a game with a different set of road cards,
it will be a different experience.

27€ Four Edges of the Map
 This expansion can make the game cooperative, also allowing more players
to participate – anything up to 5 players or even a single player version. You
will get a completely new 60 cards deck which will play for itself, and will be
able to handle all of the players at once! Will you be able to beat the GAME with all the joined forces of your friends?!? Try and you will experience the
fun of cooperative play and yet undiscovered emotions.2€ Cards Holder/Case/Box
Card Holder (color: clear):
Overall box width: 100mm, height: 50mm, depth: 30mm.Deep smaller Card boxes:Overall box width: 100mm, height: 70mm, depth: 65mm.Playing Card boxes (color: clear):Overall box width: 95mm, height: 16mm, depth: 70mm.BLACK/PINK deep smaller Card boxes  (color: black/pink):Overall box width: 100mm, height: 38mm, depth: 65mm.3€ 3D printed Dice   Coming SOON!!!20€ printed MapSize 36"x36 (for The Star Wars X-Wing Game or any other other Game )More details coming soon!

Unknown is like a family of games. It has already been enjoyed
by many players and playtested intensively over the last years. And with the
various expansions it offers, you can tailor it to your individual needs.

along with the fantastic discount. 150€levelFAQ

story:
You've got your PS3, you've got your 3D game. Now what?

You are a hard core gamer. You've got your PS3, you've got your game with a 3D sticker on it, now what? You may have one of those sleek flat screen TVs you bought a few years ago when being flat was THE thing. But now it's just that - flat, and that's boring. You know there is a better way. You've seen 3D movies, you may have played 3D games in store demos and you know how cool it is. It's no longer about watching it, it's about experiencing  it, it's about being there - in the game, it's about seeing the distance, moving through space, feeling the enemy hiding behind that wall with your skin. 

We are gamers like you, we want to experience the games we play to the fullest, like millions of others gamers. And like most of you we are stuck with that good old flat TV in our living room that we weren't thinking of upgrading any time soon. But we have been working on something, a cool little gadget, that will unleash the awesomeness of 3D games for you.

Don't try that at home

When you stick your 3D game into your PS3, then go to the game settings and tell it to switch to 3D, your PS3 will start sending the so called stereoscopic Frame-Packed 3D signal through its HDMI output. If you have your regular TV connected to your PS3 it will most likely just go blank because it can't handle that signal. And you might get really hosed at that point because you won't even be able to switch the game back to 2D (your TV is blank, right?). Turning the PS3 off and on and/or re-ejecting the CD won't help because that thing is smart to remember its settings. That happened to me once and I had to delete all game data form my PS3 to be able to play the game again.

Not ready to upgrade to a 3D TV yet? Don't - there is a better way.

Most of our professional career Jack and I have been involved with cutting edge video technologies, and we know who is who in that industry. One day our paths crossed with the company Movidius. They know everything about 3D and they developed an amazing technology that adds another dimension to everything flat and makes things jump out at you. 

Among many things their technology can enable there is one thing that we'll love as gamers: it makes your 3D game play in full 3D on your regular TV. Yes, seriously. We want to build a gadget with that technology inside and we know how to do it.

What exactly does it do?

3D Game Converter - the gadget we are going to build with your help - goes in between your PS3 and your regular TV. In other words one HDMI cable connects the output of your PS3 to the input of the gadget. Another HDMI cable connects the output of the gadget to your TV. When connected that way 3D Game Converter does two things:

  • it makes sure your TV never goes blank (it will never send a signal that your TV can't handle)
  • whenever the PS3 outputs stereoscopic Frame Packed 3D signal, the 3D game Converter converts it to so called Anaglyph 3D signal. For your TV it doesn't look any different from a regular 2D signal (that's why it won't go blank), but for you it will provide the full 3D experience if you look at your TV screen through the special glasses 3D Game Converter will come with.
         The Gadget - front view         
                     
The Gadget - connectors on the back
 
 
Comes with glasses
 

That's it. You connect it once and then make sure you wear glasses when you play the game (now you can and should switch it to 3D mode), and your teammates and enemies will burst with envy unless they join you as backers and get their own 3D Game Converter once we've built it.

 
Setup
 

Important: for better experience close the curtains and turn your lights down. That's what they do in movie theaters  - turn the lights off before the movie starts because they want you to get the best viewing experience.

Where will your money go?

Movidius developed the technology and we built the prototype. There is still some work to be done to turn it into a robust and polished product that works 100% of the time. That involves some development and a lot of testing (Daniel and Alex will be helping here big time).  Then we need to build it which means we need to buy the parts and pay the manufacturer. And these guys don't build just one unit at a time - they need some reasonable quantity. That's why we are asking for $180,000 which will cover the remaining development and all the costs to build first 3000 units. If you pledge enough you'll be the lucky one to get one of those units in your hands!

Why we think we can do it?

Before 3ality Jack and I have built and shipped (in millions) all kinds of video gadgets (you may even have some of them at home if you ever wanted to do anything with video). So we know very well how that cool stuff is getting made. Here are some of the gadgets we built:

Built by Vadim and Shipped by Jack while at Dazzle Multimedia
 
 
USB Tuner built by Vadim for Pinnacle Systems while at Emuzed, Inc.
HAVA video streaming device, built by Vadim while at Monsoon Multimedia
Camera Mate Video Editor and Publisher, and PCMCIA card reader produced and shipped by Jack while at Zio Corp.

Jack also was an initial founder for Convert23, an early leader in 2D to 3D video conversion. The Convert23 team was involved in the initial patents for 2D to 3D conversion more that 15 years ago. Convert23 software and leading hardware designers developed many of the initial video 2D to 3D video conversion algorithms, powerful chips for video processing, and anaglyph 3D glasses development.

How soon you'll get your 3D Game Converter?

We need 60 days to complete the development and build 3000 units. So you'll be getting your 3D Game Conveter in February 2013 (given of course that this projects reaches its funding goal).

Rewards

If you are one of the 10 first ones to pledge $49 you'll get the real thing - the fully functional 3D Game Converter with glasses and HDMI cable. If you come in a bit later (but not too much later - you've got until the 3rd week of December) you will need to pledge $59 to get the same. But even at $59 it's a very sweet deal considering that when we start selling this product in retail (and this is our plan) the price is going to be somewhere around $129.  

And another reference point for you: how much do you pay for a new game? With sales tax and everything it's over $60, right? So would you rather buy one more game or spend that money (or even less) on something that will change your gaming experience forever?

If you don't want the real thing and just want to help us out, we still got something for you as a token of our gratitude for your kindly contribution. For $15 or more you get one of these really cool T-shirts. Just let us know what color you would like: black or white.

FAQ

Q. What are the technical specs?

(Somewhat) technical specs. 

  • Converts PS3 3D content to Anaglyph-3D format for viewing on 2D TV
  • Automatically recognizes PS3 3D movie or game content
  • Passes through all other PS3 content
  • 1 HDMI 1.4a compatible output port to TV
  • 1 HDMI 1.4a compatible input port

Q. What's included in the package? 

The basic package contains one 3D Game Converter unit with power supply, one pair of glasses and one HDMI cable.

Q. What wil the 3D Game Converter retail for? 

When we start mass producing the 3D Game Converter it will be sold online at $100. So you are getting a very nice discount by backing the project.

Q. Will we ship internationally? 

Of course we will...gamers are everywhere. Shipping costs outside the US are  listed for each of the rewards.

Q. Can I order multiple units? 

Yes, you can. There are 5 pack and 8 pack rewards. If you want to buy just a couple multiply the single unit pledge amount by the number of units and enter it as your pledge. Feel free to contact us to make sure we got you down for that number of units.

Q. Is it easy to set up? 

Yes, all you have to do is connect two HDMI cables: one from PS3 to the 3D Game Converter and another from the 3D Game Converter to your TV. You should already have one cable (that's how your PS3 is currently connected to your TV) and we will send you another one. Oh yeah, and don't forget to connect the power supply to the wall outlet and plug the other end into the unit.

One more thing - for best viewing experience try to create a "movie theater" environment by closing the curtains and dimming the lights.

Q. Do I need to control 3D Game Converter?  

Nope, 3D Game Converter is smart enough to detect when your PS3 is sending 3D signal and will switch to Anaglyph 3D automatically (and back to 2D when you exit the game).

Q. Are there any buttons or remote control? 

No, nothing to control, everything is automatic.

Q. What is Anaglyph 3D? 

From wikipedia:  Anaglyph 3D is the name given to the stereoscopic 3D effect achieved by means of encoding each eye's image using filters of different (usually chromatically opposite) colors, typically red and cyan. Anaglyph 3D images contain two differently filtered colored images, one for each eye. When viewed through the "color coded" "anaglyph glasses", each of the two images reaches one eye, revealing an integrated stereoscopic image. The visual cortex of the brain fuses this into perception of a three dimensional scene or composition. IMPORTANT: 3ality uses more sophisticated "Tea-Blue" implementation of Anaglyph 3D that produces much better color reproduction and overall image quality than traditional "Red-Cyan" implementation.

story:
"Life was never simple on the Great Plains of the wind-ravaged steps of the Druud. Great storms would ravage the upland Oglodi in harsh seasons, yet in times of calm and peace the weather would still fuel the land so continuously that the grasslands would grow to tremendous heights without herds of gazing beats to quell them. One of the side effects of Oglodi tribesmen's civilization was the domestication of said beasts, and so the responsibility fell on the lowly apprentice stormcrafters to sow the land. In times of great stress, Disruptor returns to his childhood duties to uncloud his mind."

Sir Sadim has taken over Betway Midas Mode 2, and with it the Dota 2 map. For the penniless peasants that cannot afford a hero for themselves, the gracious Sir Sadim has found it in his heart to offer a platform in which the community can share in the funding process. This will only be available for a short amount of time. If it is funded, this hero will be created and another one will take his place. If it is not funded, then everyone will be refunded and the process starts again.

we introduce to you the Distractor.

If the project is not funded, no one will be charged.

The person that donates the highest amount for the project will be asked if any modifications or special changes if funded. Changes to sound or effects will not be accepted as we hope to maintain competitive viability of the game mode.

story:
A Jumpers Tale is a 2D RPG Procedural Platform Jumper for IOS and Android! It includes the addictive game play of games such as doodle jump combined with RPG Elements.

Tilt and Tap to Survive!

Tilt your device to jump from platform to platform to reach great heights whilst tapping the screen to attack ferocious monsters for precious coins and loot. Make sure not to fall and definitely watch out for traps and obstacles (they hurt!)

Directional Shooting!

Directional shooting is yet to be implemented into the game. It will work by tapping the screen in the direction you want your attack to go. Swords can unleash walls of fire! Bows can fire multiple arrows at once! Staves can summon bolts of lightning!

Multiple Environments With Unique Monsters!

There will be multiple environments including, Forests, Deserts, Volcanoes, Oceans, The Arctic and The UNDERWORLD! All will have unique monsters and epic bosses to defeat.

Character Evolvement & Customisation
Help level up your hero by acquiring experience points from defeating foes. Levelling up will grant you permission to enter different environments. Levelling up will also unlock new weapons and armours in the store for your hero to purchase and equip!

Weapons & Armours

Choose between multiple weapons such as Bows, Staves and Swords! Each will have their own unique abilities. Equip your hero with awesome armours to toughen up and taunt your foes!

High Scores

A Jumpers Tale will include a number of high scores to add a competitive aspect to the game as well. These high scores will include height reached, coins earned and monsters killed using Game Center to display them.

My name is Callum Singh (Game Designer of A Jumpers Tale and owner of Flat Fox Games) and I have called for the help of Landslide Studios to help me produce A Jumpers Tale. I'm a huge fan of RPGs and I've been playing them since I was about 10. I love the addictive game play of games like Doodle Jump and Temple Run, so I thought why not combine the two together and create a game that I and others would love. 

I only have limited knowledge when it comes to developing video games so this is why I've gotten the guys at Landslide Studios to help me out. So far they have helped me create a prototype meaning I am able to show you what the game will be like and I must say they’re amazing developers and artists and have really helped to start to create the game I've always wanted.

I will also be asking the AWESOME and very talented Luke Thomas to compose the soundtrack for the game. You can view his website here.

Inspirations

As I said previously I am a huge fan of RPGs/MMORPGs and have been playing them for over 7 years. Games that I think have definitely inspired the art are games such as Ragnorak and Maplestory online. These are games I used to love to play when I was younger and I have always loved the pixel style artwork. I love the fantasy worlds that are created with RPGs, the weird and wonderful monsters, the awesome armours and weapons and the scenic landscapes you are able to wander. I've always wanted to be able to create my own fantasy world and A Jumpers Tale is definitely a way to do so.

In the past couple of years since I have owned a smart phone I have loved playing games such as Doodle Jump and Temple Run. These games have had me hooked for hours trying to compete with friends to gain new High scores  I also love the fact that you can pick up and play these games at any point – on the bus or train or even when you just have a few minutes spare.

I think all my inspiration has definitely come from my experience with RPGs throughout my life and the recent love for endless runners and platform jumpers as well the idea of pick up and play casual gaming.

 

 

 

Below I have listed the different reward packages and what you get for each pledge amount. There are currently no finalized designs for posters, notebooks, buttons etc, but I will keep you updated on this. (Ignore the pound signs on the reward banners and pretend they're dollar signs!)

 

The game has been developed as far as my wallet has let me. I have put every penny of mine into A Jumpers Tale and this is why now, I need your help. Hopefully you love the idea of the game as much as I do and really want it to be completed. The $7,500/£5,000 I am asking for will help pay for costs such as:

• Additional development
• Additional artwork
• Advertising costs
• Licenses
• Some reward costs 
 
You have no idea how much this would mean to me, however much you pledge. I will be extremely grateful and I promise to forge ahead to make this game as great as possible. 
 

Feedback is welcomed as I know you lot out there have extremely creative minds so your feedback and suggestions would definitely help the game. 

 

If we are able to get past our $7,500/£5,000 goal then I have a number of stretch goals that I’d like to add to the game.

 

 Platforms

I do have the option to have a PC version of A Jumpers Tale but the game is more suited to be used on devices which have a tilt function. If there is demand for a PC version then I will definitely make a PC version happen.

Who is working on the game?
I had the idea of A Jumpers Tale in my head for quite a while and as I had some money sitting around I thought why not try to create it. I presented the idea to Landslide Studios and they said with the money I had they could produce a prototype to show off. Together we have been working on the game for about a month now and have finally produced the prototype. If successfully funded then myself and the guys at Landslide Studios will continue to finish the game. Luke Thomas will be composing the whole soundtrack of the game as I feel his style is very suited for A Jumpers Tale.

Landslide studios have been a massive help and I would've never been able to do all of this by myself. You can find their website here!

Also a shout out to the amazing Benn Briggs who let me use his music for the video! You can find his website here!

When will the game be released?
I haven’t planned an exact date yet but hopefully the game will be released in the second half of 2013.
story_txt:
A Jumpers Tale is a 2D RPG Procedural Platform Jumper for IOS and Android! It includes the addictive game play of games such as doodle jump combined with RPG Elements.

Tilt and Tap to Survive!
Tilt your device to jump from platform to platform to reach great heights whilst tapping the screen to attack ferocious monsters for precious coins and loot. Make sure not to fall and definitely watch out for traps and obstacles (they hurt!)
Directional Shooting!
Directional shooting is yet to be implemented into the game. It will work by tapping the screen in the direction you want your attack to go. Swords can unleash walls of fire! Bows can fire multiple arrows at once! Staves can summon bolts of lightning!
Multiple Environments With Unique Monsters!
There will be multiple environments including, Forests, Deserts, Volcanoes, Oceans, The Arctic and The UNDERWORLD! All will have unique monsters and epic bosses to defeat.
Character Evolvement & CustomisationHelp level up your hero by acquiring experience points from defeating foes. Levelling up will grant you permission to enter different environments. Levelling up will also unlock new weapons and armours in the store for your hero to purchase and equip!
Weapons & Armours
Choose between multiple weapons such as Bows, Staves and Swords! Each will have their own unique abilities. Equip your hero with awesome armours to toughen up and taunt your foes!
High Scores
A Jumpers Tale will include a number of high scores to add a competitive aspect to the game as well. These high scores will include height reached, coins earned and monsters killed using Game Center to display them.
My name is Callum Singh (Game Designer of A Jumpers Tale and owner of Flat Fox Games) and I have called for the help of Landslide Studios to help me produce A Jumpers Tale. I'm a huge fan of RPGs and I've been playing them since I was about 10. I love the addictive game play of games like Doodle Jump and Temple Run, so I thought why not combine the two together and create a game that I and others would love. 
I only have limited knowledge when it comes to developing video games so this is why I've gotten the guys at Landslide Studios to help me out. So far they have helped me create a prototype meaning I am able to show you what the game will be like and I must say they’re amazing developers and artists and have really helped to start to create the game I've always wanted.
I will also be asking the AWESOME and very talented Luke Thomas to compose the soundtrack for the game. You can view his website here.
Inspirations
As I said previously I am a huge fan of RPGs/MMORPGs and have been playing them for over 7 years. Games that I think have definitely inspired the art are games such as Ragnorak and Maplestory online. These are games I used to love to play when I was younger and I have always loved the pixel style artwork. I love the fantasy worlds that are created with RPGs, the weird and wonderful monsters, the awesome armours and weapons and the scenic landscapes you are able to wander. I've always wanted to be able to create my own fantasy world and A Jumpers Tale is definitely a way to do so.
In the past couple of years since I have owned a smart phone I have loved playing games such as Doodle Jump and Temple Run. These games have had me hooked for hours trying to compete with friends to gain new High scores  I also love the fact that you can pick up and play these games at any point – on the bus or train or even when you just have a few minutes spare.
I think all my inspiration has definitely come from my experience with RPGs throughout my life and the recent love for endless runners and platform jumpers as well the idea of pick up and play casual gaming.
 




 
 
Below I have listed the different reward packages and what you get for each pledge amount. There are currently no finalized designs for posters, notebooks, buttons etc, but I will keep you updated on this. (Ignore the pound signs on the reward banners and pretend they're dollar signs!)










 
The game has been developed as far as my wallet has let me. I have put every penny of mine into A Jumpers Tale and this is why now, I need your help. Hopefully you love the idea of the game as much as I do and really want it to be completed. The $7,500/£5,000 I am asking for will help pay for costs such as:
• Additional development
• Additional artwork
• Advertising costs
• Licenses
• Some reward costs 
 
You have no idea how much this would mean to me, however much you pledge. I will be extremely grateful and I promise to forge ahead to make this game as great as possible. 
 
Feedback is welcomed as I know you lot out there have extremely creative minds so your feedback and suggestions would definitely help the game. 
 
If we are able to get past our $7,500/£5,000 goal then I have a number of stretch goals that I’d like to add to the game.

 
 Platforms
I do have the option to have a PC version of A Jumpers Tale but the game is more suited to be used on devices which have a tilt function. If there is demand for a PC version then I will definitely make a PC version happen.

story:
Yes, this is 100% real.

The cards are real, and they're spectacular.

How does it Work?

It's very simple. Your card is delivered to you in a "Safe mode". Here you can start and stop the song as much as you want. After you sign the card with a lovely message, pull the activation tab inside the card which will activate the card. Then slide it into an envelope and deliver! 

You want Proof?

Some people may doubt our card can go as long as 3 hours, here's a vid using an early prototype where it goes for nearly 5 hours. Please watch all 5 hours of it! It's highly entertaining.

Is it a Well Made product?

 Travis put it to the test and dunked it a few times in a bucket of water. Did it survive? Watch and find out.

Does it survive the mailman? 

We always recommend sending in boxes! Protect the card and mail men and women won't. However we did test them many other ways. 

We tested this a few time already but we finally recorded the experience. Travis sent Nick 10 envelopes in the mail from Irvine to Los Angeles and we even waited an extra week to open them. Watch video to see how it ends. 

The idea is simple and fun.

We like to mess with our friends. This is an inexpensive and effective way to drive someone crazy: a card that won't shut up unless it's physically destroyed. Who wouldn't want that? "Some people just want to watch the world burn" says Alfred. We just want to laugh at our friends. 

Field Testing.

We've been doing some real-world testing.Travis gave a card to a friend to give to another friend for her birthday. This video was texted a few hours later. Hahaha!





Who Else Loves The Joker Birthday Card?

BUZZFEED: http://www.buzzfeed.com/mallorymcinnis/the-birthday-song-that-never-ends#.kbOgOnlep

GIZMODO http://gizmodo.com/a-musical-prank-card-that-drives-someone-mad-is-the-per-1695922258

CNET.com http://www.cnet.com/news/this-super-obnoxious-birthday-card-will-drive-you-totally-crazy/

Flipboard: https://flipboard.com/topic/prank

Geekdad.com: http://geekdad.com/2015/04/gadget-kickstarters-to-watch/

Dude!! I Want That: http://www.dudeiwantthat.com/gear/novelty/the-best-prank-birthday-card-ever.asp

Geekologie: http://geekologie.com/2015/04/prank-birthday-card-doesnt-stop-playing.php

Distractify : http://distractify.com/dennis-diclaudio/when-youre-mean-enough-to-send-the-very-worst/

ThisIsSoEpic - https://www.thisissoepic.com/most-annoying-birthday-card-ever/


We also have a Joker Christmas Card! A bad version of Jingle Bells.


Get that shopping done early and order yours today!

Pro Tips!

• When you send your card, write something really special in it. The nicer the message the harder it will be for them to tear it up.

• When you give your card at the party, be the first one. This way the card will not only drive your friend crazy as they open other presents, everyone else at the party who's in on the joke can enjoy it too!

• Give the card to a friend staying at a hotel, preferably after dinner. This way when they open it they'll have no escape when it's still singing at 1am in the morning.


More Features? Yes. 

If your friend tries to stop the card once it starts it will just get a little bit louder. There are four levels increasing volume. Here, watch the video. 

Field Research

Here is an actual text chain from a real victim. The card was given to them at 9:30 pm at a hotel.


Risks and challenges

We take pride in offering the finest quality cards we can get from China. Our overhead is small and our crew is motley. We'll run a small, tight operation with big dreams.

Really the only risk is for you and missing out. And possibly starting a war.

story:
: What's the idea!?

: A social advent calendar app!

: What's an advent calendar!?
: Where we come from (Austria), it is customs to buy (or build) special calendars for the last 24 days before Christmas Eve, which vary in shapes and sizes. Each day is represented by a window in which a surprise is hidden. Once it is that day, you open it up and find something in it!

: Sounds awesome! And what does it mean, "you want to make it social"!?
: Usually, you buy a calendar with pre-filled windows, or parents build one for their children and stuff some unhealthy sweets in each day. So it's kind of a one-to-one fun.
We are building an app which does the same trick, only healthier and everyone can fill each others calendars!

: Why are we shouting!?
: I don't know!! It's supposed to look exciting I guess!
You can put one message in each window of a friend, but lots of friends can do that for you. So on each day you can have several surprises from different people!

You can only open a window once it's that day in December!
It's all about Anticipation!
 

: Who are you?
: We're three guys from Austria, studying IT stuff at university and want to try our own things.

: What do you need us for? (The is you btw)
: Help! We don't have any funds besides our unmeasurably worthy time, which sadly doesn't pay for infrastructure.

: Is your english really that bad (see video)?
: I hope not, but sometimes stereotypes are funny.


: What will you use our money for?

: See this incredibly accurate pie chart...

Hope, that breaks it down clearly enough (haha pun!). The more money we get, the better quality we can deliver! And each donation will already reward you with perks in the app!

We want the app to be free, but to make money with it to donate to charities and fund future developments, there'll be in-app purchases and we plan on putting one or two ads in it. Once you made a small in-app purchase (OR picked one of the perks here), the ads will be deactivated for you. If you wish you can turn them back on. Some people like it.

You will use cookies as virtual currency to fill each others windows. You'll have plenty of them and when you need more they'll be easy to get.

The problem is, that we estimated server costs and cannot make everything infinitely free. The more users, the more costs. And we don't know yet if the ad-revenue can counter that.

If the funding here is super successful, we will consider kicking the cookies out' the window and make everything free.

Yes, if we do not accomplish our funding goal, we will still give our best to release the app and probably even give the perks to those of you who contributed even after you got your money back. Seems like the nice thing to do!


: What will we get in return?

: If you have suggestions, or wish for a certain perk, don't hesitate to comment!
Other than that, check the perks! Here's what the badges will probably look like, WHICH ONLY YOU ON INDIEGOGO CAN GET IF YOU HELP US :
 

S.I.P

 

M.I.P

 

V.I.P

 

WWYDT

 

fancy

 

The "Grinsch"

might look like this if you were interface guy:

: Why all of this?

: Simply put: We woke up one morning, simultaneously calling each other
(Now imagine three voices overlapping each other):

"Woah! I just had the coolest idea!".. "Me too!".."Ok, what's yours!?".."No you go first!".."No you!" - And then it happened.
We all had totally different useless ideas.
But some time later this idea was born and we liked it. So we worked on it. And we think you'll like it.



    : What are the risks?

    : Not many. It'll be fun! Well, we could catch a major cold and can't work for weeks. That would put a dent in our plan, but with enough funds we'd hire someone to replace the missing work force i guess. But we drink green smoothies and work out ..sometimes.
    And absolute worst case scenario - release next year. But that's not gonna happen. We already put too much sweat into this. We started working on it more than two years ago but had to postpone it. Now's the time.


      : I like you and your idea but I can't give you money. What do?

      : Well, we like you too, Q, and what you can do is:
      • Please share this campaign with your friends, your crush, your co-workers, your class-mates. Even if you funded us!
        Without your friends - who's going to fill your calendar!?
      • You can use the tools of indiegogo to do that. As far as I know, that helps us in ranking on the site!
      • Tell your friends! And when the campaign is over - download the app!

      And last but certainly not least: Don't hesitate to ask us anything!

story:
PROJECT CANCELLED !!

PLEASE DON'T PLEDGE.
WE WILL BE SOON ON KICKSTARTER.
SORRY FOR THE INCONVENIENCES and THANKS!

Soccer City is a football turn-based board game that reproduces every possible action in a real football match.


The game is played in turns by running events, represented in different cards that are played during the game. Dribbling, fouls, shots on goal, tactics...Soccer City is a complete football simulator inspired in the early twentieth century, with a retro look and a stunning design by illustrator Jorge Consuegra. 


The goal of this IndieGoGo campaign is to raise funds to produce the English version and involve backers in releasing the game in some more countries.  

Gameplay Features

* For 2 - 4 players.
* 45 - 90 minutes time play.
* Ages 12 and up.

The full game comes with: 

* The Board, 40 width x 68 length. 
* The Tokens, (2 teams, 9 players each, in two different colours) (18 Standing man tokens). 
* The Referee Dice (1) 
* The Tactical Pads (2)
* The Score   
* 6 Card Decks, Total 168 cards: 
 - Offensive Action Cards (27) 
 - Defensive Action cards (27) 
 - Shot-on-Goal cards (28) 
 - Goalkeeper Save cards (26) 
 - Ball playing cards (48) 
 - External Factors (12)

The game is played in turns, in which attacker plays first and then turn shifts to defender. Each player has a set of cards consisting in Ball cards, Offensive cards and Defensive cards and Shot on goal cards.

Attacking turn consists of 4 sequential phases, and players may decide whether to play them or pass to the next:

 1 – Ball Passing / Player advancing 
 2 - Offensive Action (Dribble or Tactical Move) 
 3 - Shot on goal 
 4 - Team repositioning

Once Attacking turn is over, Defensive turn begins, which in 2 phases: 
 1 - Defensive Action (Tackle or Tactical Move) 
 2 - Team repositioning  

The Pitch, represented by a lattice of 21 x 15 hexagons. 

 

18 Standing man tokens, numbered in both sides.

The Ball playing Cards represent just that, balls. These cards are used to move the ball down the field, either as a Pass, or as a Player Advance.

The Balls can be played in the first phase of Attacking turn: Ball Passing / Player advancing phase.

The Balls can be played in the first phase of Attacking turn: Ball Passing / Player advancing phase.  

Offensive Action Cards: Dribblings and Tricks to overcome an opponent. A Lean dribble, a Sombrero dribble, etc. each one with an assigned value that will compete against a defensive action.

Defensive action Cards: Tackles, Shoulder Charges and other attempts to steal the ball. 

Both offensive and defensive action cards also have the possibility to work as Tactical Actions. These are showed in the same card and allow offensive or defensive tactical moves. 

These Actions are played in the second phase, once the payer has decided whether to pass the ball or advance..

Shot-on-goal Cards are used to create a goal chance. Every Shot on goal has its main value and a bonus. You can get that bonus by fulfilling the conditions the card shows,upgrading the shot to a special shot like a Missile, a Superclass shot, etc...

 Shot on goal can be executed following the Action phase from the permitted area drawn on the board only.

Goalkeeper save Cards are used randomly by the defender when the attacker decides to shoot on goal. Value shown on Goalkeeper save cards must be equal or above Shot-on-goal card played to save the ball.

External factors are outside issues that may affect tthe macth progress such as "Coach anger" that strengthens your team or "Goalkeeper´s bad day", that weakens your goalie for the coming turns.They happen at random when playing an Action containing the External Factor (EF) mark.

Team Repositioning phase

Once the Attacking / Defending phase is over, both players have the possibility toreposition part of their teams, moving some players around the pitch.

               


Tactics Pads are used to check the influence of tactical actions.

One side shows the offensive tactics that are played in the Action phase.

The other side shows the defensive tactics, played on the Action phase to stop the tactics from your attacking opponent.

The dice works as referee decissions, aimed to solve any controversial situation.

The player that committs a foul has the option to roll the Referee Dice. Not rolling the dice means the Referee whistles the foul.

In case the player decides to roll the dice the Referee will whistle what the Dice shows.

The dice is also numbered from 1 to 6, used to solve the result of a non-controlled ball.

Given the fact that Soccer City was originally created in Spain based on Spanish football terminology, some tricks, move and dribble names may vary from its original in English.  

Since this campaign is meant to both raise funds to release the English version, and increase awareness of its nature we would highly appreciate your suggestions and recommendations regarding the translation. Soccer City, as football itself, is a team work! 

Download the complete Soccer City RULEBOOK (1.0) here.

We are working to correct all errors and translation confusions in the rulebook. Soon we will post the version 2.0.

Soccer City launch fulfils the dream of two friends, now partners, who began this project two years ago in Spain and now, lots of work and efforts invested, intend to widen the idea of an active Football board Game to some other countries. 

In case IndieGoGo campaign turns out successful, first English Edition is planned to be produced in November 2014.

Once minimum target is achieved, production will begin (November 2014, hopefully). 
Production lapse may vary, depending on funds raised, Stretch Goals and number of backers to be rewarded, but estimations are around 1 to 2 months. As soon as first units are produced we will proceed with shipments.


Free Shipment World Wide.

All artwork of the game.  The basic set of 36 illustrations in digital format, in a notebook format Din-A4 ready to print (210 x 297 milimeters). 

Illustrations of "Stretch goals" are included if they are unlocked.

12 new cards to add to the base game. 4 different cards.

Limited edition for INDIEGOGO.

Limited edition for INDIEGOGO.

12 new cards to add to the base game. 4 different cards. 
Limited edition for INDIEGOGO.


Some two years ago two close friends, football, board game lovers began creating a rough, hand-made edition of what would later be Soccer City, filling the gap this kind of games had on the board game range.

Their experience in the board game field was limited and the idea of seeing this project in the market was not on their views. But their passion for football and the increasing interest from others towards the project pushed forward the release in Spain by mid-2013.

The active turn-based game, the wide range of tactics, moves and possible actions make Soccer City the attractive football game where nearly real football thrill can be experienced.

The idea of illustrating Soccer City with classic football scenes and fashions was unquestionable from the very beginning, referring the game to football origins and thus honouring the sport that made us living such great moments.

We got best professionals and collaborators helping Soccer City to be what is now, without whom we could hardly succeed. We would like to thank them all, particularly Jorge Consuegra, Cartoonist and illustrator.

We also want to thank all our families, friends, relatives and game testers who contributed so much to the project initial success with their encouragement and unconditional support. 

We want to thank Carlos Rodrigo, the English translator. 

And last but not least thanks to INDIEGOGO for giving us the opportunity to develop this campaign.

And, of course, thanks to Football.

story_txt:
PROJECT CANCELLED !!PLEASE DON'T PLEDGE.WE WILL BE SOON ON KICKSTARTER.
SORRY FOR THE INCONVENIENCES and THANKS!

Soccer City is a football turn-based board game that reproduces every possible action in a real football match.The game is played in turns by running events, represented in different cards that are played during the game. Dribbling, fouls, shots on goal, tactics...Soccer City is a complete football simulator inspired in the early twentieth century, with a retro look and a stunning design by illustrator Jorge Consuegra.  The goal of this IndieGoGo campaign is to raise funds to produce the English version and involve backers in releasing the game in some more countries.  Gameplay Features* For 2 - 4 players.* 45 - 90 minutes time play.* Ages 12 and up. The full game comes with: * The Board, 40 width x 68 length. * The Tokens, (2 teams, 9 players each, in two different colours) (18 Standing man tokens). * The Referee Dice (1) * The Tactical Pads (2)* The Score   * 6 Card Decks, Total 168 cards:  - Offensive Action Cards (27)  - Defensive Action cards (27)  - Shot-on-Goal cards (28)  - Goalkeeper Save cards (26)  - Ball playing cards (48)  - External Factors (12)The game is played in turns, in which attacker plays first and then turn shifts to defender. Each player has a set of cards consisting in Ball cards, Offensive cards and Defensive cards and Shot on goal cards.Attacking turn consists of 4 sequential phases, and players may decide whether to play them or pass to the next: 1 – Ball Passing / Player advancing  2 - Offensive Action (Dribble or Tactical Move)  3 - Shot on goal  4 - Team repositioningOnce Attacking turn is over, Defensive turn begins, which in 2 phases:  1 - Defensive Action (Tackle or Tactical Move)  2 - Team repositioning  
 
The Pitch, represented by a lattice of 21 x 15 hexagons. 

 




 
18 Standing man tokens, numbered in both sides.

 

 
The Ball playing Cards represent just that, balls. These cards are used to move the ball down the field, either as a Pass, or as a Player Advance.
The Balls can be played in the first phase of Attacking turn: Ball Passing / Player advancing phase.
The Balls can be played in the first phase of Attacking turn: Ball Passing / Player advancing phase.  

 
Offensive Action Cards: Dribblings and Tricks to overcome an opponent. A Lean dribble, a Sombrero dribble, etc. each one with an assigned value that will compete against a defensive action.

 
Defensive action Cards: Tackles, Shoulder Charges and other attempts to steal the ball. 

 
Both offensive and defensive action cards also have the possibility to work as Tactical Actions. These are showed in the same card and allow offensive or defensive tactical moves. 
These Actions are played in the second phase, once the payer has decided whether to pass the ball or advance..
Shot-on-goal Cards are used to create a goal chance. Every Shot on goal has its main value and a bonus. You can get that bonus by fulfilling the conditions the card shows,upgrading the shot to a special shot like a Missile, a Superclass shot, etc...

 
 Shot on goal can be executed following the Action phase from the permitted area drawn on the board only.
Goalkeeper save Cards are used randomly by the defender when the attacker decides to shoot on goal. Value shown on Goalkeeper save cards must be equal or above Shot-on-goal card played to save the ball.

 
External factors are outside issues that may affect tthe macth progress such as "Coach anger" that strengthens your team or "Goalkeeper´s bad day", that weakens your goalie for the coming turns.They happen at random when playing an Action containing the External Factor (EF) mark.

 
Team Repositioning phase
Once the Attacking / Defending phase is over, both players have the possibility toreposition part of their teams, moving some players around the pitch.

               


 
Tactics Pads are used to check the influence of tactical actions.
One side shows the offensive tactics that are played in the Action phase.
The other side shows the defensive tactics, played on the Action phase to stop the tactics from your attacking opponent.

 

 
The dice works as referee decissions, aimed to solve any controversial situation.
The player that committs a foul has the option to roll the Referee Dice. Not rolling the dice means the Referee whistles the foul.
In case the player decides to roll the dice the Referee will whistle what the Dice shows.
The dice is also numbered from 1 to 6, used to solve the result of a non-controlled ball.

 

 

 

 
Given the fact that Soccer City was originally created in Spain based on Spanish football terminology, some tricks, move and dribble names may vary from its original in English.  
Since this campaign is meant to both raise funds to release the English version, and increase awareness of its nature we would highly appreciate your suggestions and recommendations regarding the translation. Soccer City, as football itself, is a team work! 
Download the complete Soccer City RULEBOOK (1.0) here.
We are working to correct all errors and translation confusions in the rulebook. Soon we will post the version 2.0.


 
Soccer City launch fulfils the dream of two friends, now partners, who began this project two years ago in Spain and now, lots of work and efforts invested, intend to widen the idea of an active Football board Game to some other countries. 
In case IndieGoGo campaign turns out successful, first English Edition is planned to be produced in November 2014.

 
Once minimum target is achieved, production will begin (November 2014, hopefully). Production lapse may vary, depending on funds raised, Stretch Goals and number of backers to be rewarded, but estimations are around 1 to 2 months. As soon as first units are produced we will proceed with shipments.

story:
Be sure to check out the latest updates!

-----------------------------------------------------------------

What the heck is Rock'n Loud?

Rock'n Loud is a tabletop roleplaying game that lets the players create their own musicians (or drummer) and form a band to rock the world. A whole new meaning for rock'n'roll!

Game will be around 70-90 pages long and it takes couple of months to write. The rules will cover all the essentials, ranging from recording a demo and playing live to handling the media and fighting drug addiction.

As the band gets more famous, the venues will get bigger and money starts to flow. Do you have what it takes to become a rockstar?

About Me, Myself and I

My name is Teemu Suontaka and I come from the northern country of Finland.

I'm a huge fan of tabletop RPG's and I'd like to combine that with my other passion, music. My goal is to create a fun and personal game for everyone who has ever dreamed of rock stardom.

Also, I will do my thesis based on the game so this project is vital to me and I'll make sure that the final product is of high quality.

What I Need & What You Get

This project needs YOUR support in order to succeed. So, what can you do?

  1. Fund the project.
  2. Spread the word.

With 2000 EUR, I can dedicate enough of my time to write a high quality product. The project will be cancelled if the funding goal isn't met, so please, show your support!

You can fund the project starting from only 2 EUR. There are some cool limited perks available, check them out.

Perks

Stargazer - 2 EUR
- Download the demo of my own band, Enlightenment Ner Death
- I'll send you an email and thank you for your support
 
The Trooper - 10 EUR
- PDF version of Rock'n Loud
 
Wild Child - 15 EUR
- PDF version of Rock'n Loud
- Your name in the credits of the game
- Beta testing of the game. I'll send you the beta-version when I'm finished writing. You can test the game and send your feedback so I can then add minor tweaks before final release
- Digital download of the new, upcoming demo of my own band, Enlightenment Near Death. You can listen to our old demo here: http://www.endband.fi/#!recordings/c1yi7
 
Iron Man - 25 EUR 
- Printed softcover version of Rock'n Loud. Limited item, includes postage
- You also get all the perks mentioned above!
 
Sultan of Swing - 45 EUR
- Printed hardcover version of Rock'n Loud. Limited item, includes postage
- A dice set needed to play
- All the previous perks are included (excluding the softcover version)
 
Master of Puppets - 100 EUR
- Design a manager for the band. When forming a band, players choose a manager for the band. There are five different managers to choose from and you get to design one of them! I'll send you all the info needed to design your own manager. Only five ones available!
- Everything mentioned above is also included with this perk, with only one printed version of Rock'n Loud (hardcover)
 
Billion Dollar Baby - 200 EUR
- Full-page ad inside the book and I'll mention you as a sponsor of the game in the credits
- Your logo to the back cover

The Impact

There aren't a lot of music themed RPG's out there and I intend to create the best one. Imagine the fun when you're stage-diving or signing your first record deal. And don't forget dating groupies and performing crazy media stunts. It's all about sex, drugs and rock'n loud!

Other Ways You Can Help

I need your help to spread the word around the world. Share this project with your friends and family. It doesn't matter if you're using Facebook, Twitter, IndieGoGo's own sharing tools, MySpace, LinkedIn or some forums.

story:
Like us on Facebook -  https://www.facebook.com/mafiacardgame

Who are we and Why we are in love with Mafia Game

RS is a team of 4 from Penang, Malaysia. We felt that hangouts these days have lack much interaction among people and we want to do something about it! It happened that we all love to play Mafia Game and we thought it's a good game to get people interacting.

Many of us know what MAFIA Card Game is, unfortunately there isn’t much option in the market for this game. Hence, we brainstormed the design, searched through mafia cultures of countries, took size and sensibility into consideration, and came out with these beautifully designed decks which is also packed with personal stories. And now we're  genuinely hoping for your support to make this happens!


In case you do not know what Mafia Card Game is, here's a brief:

Your role in the game is decided by the character you are dealt with in the beginning of the game. Depending on your role, you may have to murder/save/accuse/defend "life" every single turn. The game is a mixture of Strategy, Creativity, a little acting, some teamwork and a whole lot of fun ! You want to be creative in strategies to survive this game. You may have to work together to stay under cover. Sometimes it'd be better to just stay quiet as long as you can in the game BUT dying in the game isn't all that bad, certainly you will find it more fun watching your friends trying to defend themselves or accuse others.




We have created 3 different designs based on the theme of Russia, Japan and Mexico. 

Our goal is to meet basic funding for production of the card game. Also, the fund will help us to develop our next project which is a new design based on a new country by popular demand. 


We all love a good fun game, let’s play it with style!






On the front of each card, you find a story of a real life person which will also be the role of the player. 


Minimal yet Informational

Each country (Russia, Japan & Mexico) has its own unique design. And each character on the card was/is the citizen of that respective country with their own story. Taking inspiration from minimalism, we keep the design minimal and elegant. 


25 cards per deck.



The back of the card is also specially designed based on the theme of the country. 



As much as we are obsessed with the aesthetic, the cards' quality matters to us equally. We choose 310gsm paper with linen finish, UV Coated and Spot Varnish. It wouldn't just pleases the eyes, it's pleasant to be hold on the hand too. 

The card is cut to an optimum size - 2.5" x 3.5" (Height) - so that it's a great size to hold on hand and also easily slides into your pockets to be carried around with you. 

The deck set will come with an Instruction Manual on the Game Rules and also the "power" of each character in the cards.


What's more? With purchase of a complete set, the 3 decks will come in a beautifully designed "Collector's Edition Box", perfect for collection.






- Help us share this campaign to your buddies and don't forget to follow us on Facebook.

 https://www.facebook.com/mafiacardgame



We have already completed the 3 designs which is ready to be sent for production, now we need your support to materialize this game! 



We will be posting more updates and progress here at Indiegogo, stay tuned! 

For more information about bulk purchase or others, kindly email us at: rareshiftstudio@hotmail.com

We will get back to you ASAP
Sincerely by
RS team

story:
Hello! We are small independent game studio from St.Peterburg, Russia. We are only two people team and over the previous year we have developed a cross-platform multiplayer game. The game is almost done and in coming days it will be released for early access. But many things we wanted to implement not yet ready. Without them, the game will not be such as we conceived, so your help is important to us.

 

Slash Arena is massively multiplayer online battle arena with swords and axes. 
Simple arcade action! Dodge the attack and choose a perfect time to strike.
Upgrade your weapon, slash enemies, collect resources and reach the top!

Already implemented Battle Modes:
★ Deathmatch — Player vs All mode for 30 players. Score the highest damage and survive to win.
★ Arena 1vs1 — ranking duel for hardcore players. Your skills mean more than your high-level weapon.

Already implemented Features:
★ Rapid battles. Play 5 minutes or 5 hours. It’s all up to you!
★ Swing your hammer and make 'em fly! Damage is calculated according to physical laws. Timing and distance matter!
★ Two types of attack — enough to make your enemy suffer from a painful combo! Master your skills. 
★ Separate ratings for each Battle Mode. Monitor your progress.
★ Three characters with unique weapons and fighting styles. More characters are coming soon!
★ More than 30 upgrade levels for each character’s weapon and armor. Start with a simple leather jacket and get to the legendary royal armor!
★ Character’s appearance changes each 3 levels. Everyone will see how cool you are!

★ Game already available for beta test  in Steam, Facebook.com, Gameroom, Google Play and AppStore.

 

Now we have a fully-playable Beta version with three characters, two Battle Modes and gaming content for approximately two weeks of active gaming.

Before releasing it to the world, we want to implement the following features:

3 New characters: Redhead Sonja, Necromancer and Knight.
Everyone with its own weapon and armor packs.

Alchemical laboratory.
Where you can craft potions which help you in combat.

Character Skills.
Unique skills for every character which can be used in battle

Clans and cooperative game modes.
Playing with friends is always fun!

2 New game modes: Team fight and the destruction of battles.

 

Now we are working on new characters: Redhead Sonja and Necromancer. Sonia is almost ready:

and Necromancer at concept arts stage.

 

We are only two men team and we cannot afford to invest time into anything that doesn't go into the final game. We want to focus on building  real good and funny game and  your contribution is very important to achieve the goal. 

You can also help us if you  make some noise about our game by using the Indiegogo share tools ;)

 

You can enjoy world wide beta test in Facebook.com: 

From day to day it will be available in Early Access:

You can even see how the game has changed since it passed Steam GreenLight:

The beta test in Google Play and AppStore was completed and the game now available with regional restrictions in Russia. But if you contact us, we will definitely give you access to it!
