Everyone will see how cool you are!★ Game already available for beta test  in Steam, Facebook.com, Gameroom, Google Play and AppStore. Now we have a fully-playable Beta version with three characters, two Battle Modes and gaming content for approximately two weeks of active gaming.Before releasing it to the world, we want to implement the following features:3 New characters: Redhead Sonja, Necromancer and Knight.Everyone with its own weapon and armor packs.Alchemical laboratory.Where you can craft potions which help you in combat.Character Skills.Unique skills for every character which can be used in battleClans and cooperative game modes.Playing with friends is always fun!2 New game modes: Team fight and the destruction of battles. Now we are working on new characters: Redhead Sonja and Necromancer. Sonia is almost ready:and Necromancer at concept arts stage. 
We are only two men team and we cannot afford to invest time into anything that doesn't go into the final game. We want to focus on building  real good and funny game and  your contribution is very important to achieve the goal. 
You can also help us if you  make some noise about our game by using the Indiegogo share tools ;)
 

You can enjoy world wide beta test in Facebook.com: 

From day to day it will be available in Early Access:

You can even see how the game has changed since it passed Steam GreenLight:

The beta test in Google Play and AppStore was completed and the game now available with regional restrictions in Russia. But if you contact us, we will definitely give you access to it!

story:
Happy holidays! (Campaign update 23.12.2015)

This holiday we decided to celebrate and give a gift for everyone who bought Early Bird edition or higher. If the campaign is succesful, every backer will now receive:

A second digital copy of FinnWars!

Give the other game as a gift for someone, or contribute as a team and get a double pack of games with the price of one.

New Alpha gameplay video (Campaign update 15.12.2015)

In this update we show the first alpha gameplay of FinnWars. The game is a simple 6 player deathmatch introducing the basic multiplayer gunplay of the current early game version. In this game we have two guns. The first one is a Suomi submachine gun and the other the Finnish Mosin-Nagant M28-30 bolt action rifle. 

Everything is work in progress and does not represent any kind of final quality, but should give some idea on how the game plays.


Updated gameplay screenshots (Campaign update 10.12.2015)

Here are couple of screenshots we took while playing the prototype game. They do not represent any kind of final quality and for example the UI graphics are completely temporary. The game is going to look awesome! We are also preparing on releasing a multiplayer gameplay video footage from the game in near future.

We also added a Collector's Edition perk including the second copy of the game in a physical package and an exclusive fabric FinnWars banner. Check it out!



FinnWars is a first person multiplayer shooter concentrating on infantry and armoured combat. The game is about asymmetrical warfare between infantry and mechanized armies. What this means is that even though one side has vehicle superiority, the other side has means to fight against the other in balanced gameplay. FinnWars concentrates on the battles fought on the Eastern Front during World War 2. The main focus is in great battles between Finland and Soviet Union that took place in 1939-1944. The game honors all sides of the war and handles this topic in great respect.


We have planned multiple stretch goals after the initial funding is achieved. For example, these would add aircrafts and anti-aircraft guns into the game. All maps are designed in a way that an airfield can be added later into the game and there is enough space for airplanes to maneuver. Battles between Germany and USSR are the biggest fought in military history. Therefore one big stretch goal would be adding Germany as a playable nation.


Main Features:

  • Online multiplayer for at least 64 players

  • Infantry combat and several playable classes

  • Tanks, tanks and more tanks

  • Artillery gameplay

  • Weapons from small calibers to 203 mm heavy howitzers

  • Finland and Soviet Union as playable nations

  • Summer and winter battles

  • Battlefields inspired by real locations

  • Beautiful environments

  • Tactical gameplay


Extra features planned for additional stretch goals:

  • Aircrafts

  • Anti-aircraft guns

  • Germany as playable nation


We are Iceflake Studios, an independent game studio from Tampere, Finland. Currently we have a team of six experienced and talented developers. Iceflake Studios was founded in 2007 by Lasse Liljedahl and Tapani Valkonen, who are the core members of the original FinnWars modification dev team. Lasse was responsible for making most of the graphics. Now he is the CEO of the company, but likes to get his hands dirty with 3D graphics as often as possible. Tapani was, and still is, the master programmer of everything. As the company’s CTO he makes sure that techwise everything is top notch and works like a dream.

Since the early FinnWars days, our studio has developed games for PC, consoles and mobile platforms. In total we have more than ten commercially released game titles and over 20 million players for our games. Before our professional careers we have developed modifications, games and game engines for PC since the 1990’s. FinnWars is developed by the creators of the original modification. It is a long-standing dream to finally recreate it as a standalone game with modern technology.

We use Unreal Engine 4 to develop the game. This is a modern game engine that allows us to concentrate on making the best possible product, without wasting too much resources on developing the technology itself. Making spectacular open natural environments where infantry can fight against vehicles can be easily achieved with this approach. With this technology it's possible even for a small team like us to produce a high quality game.

Before or after the original FinnWars modification there has not been a game that simulates warfare between two very imbalanced armies in a balanced way. This is the specialty in our game, and it was achieved in the original with innovative game design and a strong knowledge of military history. Today with all the experience we have gathered we are even better at making games, so this is going to be just awesome!

FinnWars concentrates on the battles where the other side mainly consists of infantry, while the other side is equipped with heavy artillery and armoured vehicles. This was the case when Finland and Soviet Union clashed together during World War 2. The Red army had superior numbers of infantry, tanks, airplanes and artillery. However, the tactics each side used during the war were very different. More flexible use of Finnish soldiers and centrally coordinated artillery fire in the vast forests and swamplands of Finnish wilderness evened out the odds.


Why do people still play the old game? What makes FinnWars so good? It’s the ingenious game mechanics. The game is designed to direct players towards team play in many ways. For example the most efficient units, like tanks, cannot be operated effectively by only one player. Instead, their effective use requires that there are gunners and a driver inside the tank. Also a balance between different player classes is a crucial part of the gameplay. Not all players have the ability to work as artillery observer or to have more specialized weapons, like for example, a machine gun or a flamethrower. However, each soldier is able to fight against tanks with improvised weaponry like molotov cocktails, panzerfausts or even wooden logs. Medics can give first aid, but they cannot do miracles and cure players back to full health. Pioneers are good at building things and even better at tearing them down. This class is also handy when it comes to defusing mines.

Winter is an essential part of level design and game mechanics. Players can hide mines in snow and spot enemies based on the markings they leave behind. Also ice on lakes and rivers may hold infantry and light vehicles, but crack under the weight of heavy battle tanks.  

Water is also an obstacle during summertime. Bridges in the game play a crucial role in directing movement of heavy units. Bridges can be destroyed and repaired, but crossing the river can also be done by other means. Normal soldiers can swim across rivers, but there are also small boats and amphibious vehicles that can cross the rivers hidden from enemy eyes and strike from behind.

Game modes concentrate players to work towards common goals and do not encourage solo play. Objective, frontline and push modes make the mission clear for each player, but keep the battlefield open for different tactics. Gameplay is all about combined arms working towards a common goal.



Game maps take their inspiration from the real battlefields where the Finnish and Soviet forces fought during World War 2. The Winter War became known to the whole world when great battles were fought in places like Summa, Raate, Kollaa, Taipale and so on. Winter is in a big role in the game, although, winter maps mostly concentrate on the early days of World War 2.


Most of the big battles between Finland and Soviet Union were fought during summer. As a matter of the fact one of the most intense battles in the whole World War 2 was fought in Karelian Isthmus in June 1944. This was after the Red Army launched a massive counter offensive and broke through all of the Finnish defences. After almost a month of fierce fighting the Soviet advance halted in the beginning of July near the village of Ihantala. This is only one example from a countless number of battles fought during that five year period when these two nations were at war.


Each army in the original game had their own selection of firearms used during World War 2.

In FinnWars the use of firearms is made in an authentic manner. Each weapon type has their own special role on a battlefield. In this game, aiming requires discipline and thought, making running and gunning impossible. Accurate shots are only taken through iron sights. Rifle is a standard weapon with high accuracy and a long firing range. Automatic weapons, on the other hand, are rare and their use requires a skillful gameplay.

Weapons against vehicles are the other side of infantry combat and a major game mechanical element in FinnWars. Even one tank can make a difference against infantry and they can’t be destroyed just by throwing grenades at them. However, there are a number of ways that make armoured vehicles vulnerable to infantry. Normal anti-tank guns are rare, but there are more personal weapons to use. AT rifles are a specialty that can be very effective from long range, but makes the user vulnerable to infantry. First of all disabling vehicles is possible - even though it requires heroism - with anti-tank mines or big wooden logs. To finish the job, tanks can be destroyed by molotov cocktails, satchel charges, panzerschrecks or panzerfausts.

Concerning heavy weapons there are artillery and mortar units to provide indirect fire support. Artillery observers can spot targets and players in artillery units can move their fire to those targets. Moreover, players with artillery observer ability can call in heavy artillery strikes to make short, but massive aerial damage upon an enemy team.


Vehicles will concentrate mostly on tanks and other land vehicles. Also small water and amphibious vehicles will be included in the game. If the initial funding is reached, one stretch goal after that is to include also aircrafts into the game. This means fighters, bombers and dive bombers.

Authentic vehicles in the game are a result of careful consideration and each has a special role on the battlefield. Troop transports can move soldiers quickly around battlefields, but also move light artillery and AT guns to new positions. Light armoured cars and tanks are good against infantry and can move rapidly around the map, however, they are also vulnerable to light AT weaponry. The real firepower comes from medium and heavy battle tanks, which are hard to destroy, but also slower to operate. The slow maneuvering also makes them vulnerable to quickly moving infantry or artillery fire. Anti-tank vehicles are a special class that combines the firepower of heavy tanks and mobility of light vehicles. Finally there are some special units, like for example amphibious tanks, which can surprise the enemy and turn the tide of a battle.

One of the unique features is the realistic tank steering unseen in any other game. Both tracks are controlled separately and moving across the battlefield filled with obstacles is an interesting challenge. 


Originally we founded Iceflake Studios to make a standalone sequel to the original FinnWars modification. Therefore, this project has been brewing for almost a decade now. We have gained a lot of experience from developing and publishing games for all possible platforms and gathered an awesome team of talented developers. We know what it takes to make this a dream project of ours to come true.

Fans of the old FinnWars are still playing the old modification to this day and we constantly get asked about when are we going to make a sequel. Players are very fond of how the well the game mechanics are executed and how balanced the gameplay is. We know that there is an audience for this game and we want to finally make it true.



Currently the game is in an early alpha stage. So far we have made some of the graphical assets and programmed the simple gameplay. The basic multiplayer element is already there! Players can run around and shoot each other in the forests, meadows, swamps, alongside rivers and shores of lakes in the wilderness. Simple things like photorealistic natural environment are complex to make. In this game our ambitious goal is to create a lifelike environment and make the battlefields as authentic as possible on that regard as well.
In general our roadmap is the following. First task is to implement infantry combat as a whole. This means all infantry weapons and classes. Also artillery is part of the infantry warfare. Different game modes and vehicles will follow after that. Maps and graphical assets are created during the whole development and they are added as they come along.
Playable Beta is scheduled to December 2016 and the final release in December 2017. We have a clear path what it takes to make this game finished. With your help this schedule is possible and we have the resources to concentrate on making this game. 


Indiegogo is only part of the game's funding. For every euro you put into the project, we will put in another as a company. We know this is a big project to complete and we do not have delusions on how much it will cost to realize this game. Funding through Indiegogo is a crucial part in getting the complete game financed and it will also tell us about the real demand on a game.


There are no words we can say to express the gratitude we owe to every contributer. Without you this game is not possible. 


The special FinnWars T-shirt is available only during this campaign. The design is similar to shown above. The supplier for the T-shirts has not yet been selected. However, please leave a private comment with your size or send your size by email. Normal sizes S-XXL apply. T-shirts are delivered with other physical items soon after the campaign closes (if successful).



High quality FinnWars mousepad is the second physical item included in some of the perks. Also this mousepad with the design shown above is only available during the campaign. The tank shown in these physical items is a legendary Soviet light tank T-26. It was developed in the early 1930’s and over 50 variants were made from flamethrower tanks to radio controlled prototypes.


In all perks starting from the Collector's Edition you will get a physical copy of the game in a DVD box with custom art. This is in addition to the digital copy of the game, so in total there will be two copies of the game.

An exclusive fabric banner that is suitable for hanging it on your wall is included in all of the perks starting from the Collector's Edition. 

The digital artbook featuring the art of FinnWars. From the pages of this book you find concept art, sketches and 3D art showing how the game developed from the early stages to the final product.
Digital download of the FinnWars original soundtrack will include musics from the game.


We will hold a launch party somewhere in Tampere, Finland close to the game’s release. You get to meet the developer team and have a great party with us. One night stay in one of the nice hotels in Tampere near our studio will be covered by us. Travel expenses will not be covered.

Notice!

Finnish law does not allow companies to accept donations without compensation. Therefore we cannot accept contributions without giving something back. If you want to contribute, please select a perk. Thank you!


FinnWars is a game from very special subject. The importance of community while developing a niche game like this is very important. We want to hear everything you have to say about the game and include you to the development process. If you have questions or have some ideas to share send us a message via Facebook, Twitter or Email. We promise to read every comment and respond to as many as possible. All messages come directly to Lasse and Tapani and we are always awake.

story:
Derelicts: The Chronicles of Column 77 

Derelicts is a fantasy armoured warfare sim that's been written specifically for play on community message boards. Participation is open-ended: you can play with as few or as many people as you'd like, and players can jump in or out of the experience as they wish without disrupting the game.

The objective of the game is to hunt down, engage and destroy five titantic automatons within the remains of the city of Krakberg. The central theme of the game is exploration.

The finished product will be a full color, 500 page 8.5 x 11" PDF rulebook (only the person running the game will need the rulebook; players will be able to participate with very minimal rules explanation).

I've chosen to crowd-source this project because of the relatively inexpensive nature of my publishing costs at this point, and because I want to be able to gauge interest & offer discount pre-orders to customers.

 

Explore, Exploit, Exterminate

Derelicts is '3X' turn-based strategy game & sim that relies on 1 person to facilitate the experience, with participation otherwise being open-ended. Each turn, players vote on which actions they would like to take: the vote can either be resolved via simple majority or random balot selection, and this drives the game forward.
 
The actions that players may take come in the form of virtual cards that are drawn at the beginning of each turn:
 
 
The maximum hand size for each tank is determined by the number of crews available to that tank. New cards are discovered by investigating the ruins of abandoned facilities & recycling the wreckage of destroyed enemies.
 
Cards are of two basic varieties: Command Cards and Material Cards.
 
   

Command Cards each have a Condition Term value (which indicates the number of terms that the card will stay in effect for when played) and Material Cards each have a Capacity value (which indicates the number of times the card may be used after it's been played).

Cards are played into a tank commander's Orders Queue, and each commander can have up to 6 Command Cards in their queue.

 Each turn, every Orders Queue will attempt to activate each card assigned to it in sequence (first the card in slot 1, then 2, etc). Material Cards do not activate on their own and are skipped-over; Command Cards check to see if the game's conditions are appropriate for their execution (for example, a Combat Stations card will only activate if there is a hostile vehicle to shoot at) and, if so, will use every appropriate Material Card that is directly above, below or beside it.

Cards cannot be taken out of a queue, so managing your orders efficiently is crucial to success.

 

The rest of the game involves managing your tank's power output, making appropriate cost vs benefits analysis for developing situations, subsystem damage control, crew attrition and making intelligent column formation decisions. 

 

 

Primary Goal

Derelicts: The Chronicles of Column 77 
Derelicts is a fantasy armoured warfare sim that's been written specifically for play on community message boards. Participation is open-ended: you can play with as few or as many people as you'd like, and players can jump in or out of the experience as they wish without disrupting the game.
The objective of the game is to hunt down, engage and destroy five titantic automatons within the remains of the city of Krakberg. The central theme of the game is exploration.
The finished product will be a full color, 500 page 8.5 x 11" PDF rulebook (only the person running the game will need the rulebook; players will be able to participate with very minimal rules explanation).
I've chosen to crowd-source this project because of the relatively inexpensive nature of my publishing costs at this point, and because I want to be able to gauge interest & offer discount pre-orders to customers.
 

Explore, Exploit, Exterminate
Derelicts is '3X' turn-based strategy game & sim that relies on 1 person to facilitate the experience, with participation otherwise being open-ended. Each turn, players vote on which actions they would like to take: the vote can either be resolved via simple majority or random balot selection, and this drives the game forward.
 
The actions that players may take come in the form of virtual cards that are drawn at the beginning of each turn:
 

 
The maximum hand size for each tank is determined by the number of crews available to that tank. New cards are discovered by investigating the ruins of abandoned facilities & recycling the wreckage of destroyed enemies.
 
Cards are of two basic varieties: Command Cards and Material Cards.
 

   


Command Cards each have a Condition Term value (which indicates the number of terms that the card will stay in effect for when played) and Material Cards each have a Capacity value (which indicates the number of times the card may be used after it's been played).
Cards are played into a tank commander's Orders Queue, and each commander can have up to 6 Command Cards in their queue.

 Each turn, every Orders Queue will attempt to activate each card assigned to it in sequence (first the card in slot 1, then 2, etc). Material Cards do not activate on their own and are skipped-over; Command Cards check to see if the game's conditions are appropriate for their execution (for example, a Combat Stations card will only activate if there is a hostile vehicle to shoot at) and, if so, will use every appropriate Material Card that is directly above, below or beside it.
Cards cannot be taken out of a queue, so managing your orders efficiently is crucial to success.
 
The rest of the game involves managing your tank's power output, making appropriate cost vs benefits analysis for developing situations, subsystem damage control, crew attrition and making intelligent column formation decisions.

story:
Black is a challenging yet intuitive linear puzzle game. It integrates a cool original soundtrack and an exciting bonus in the form of a digital album "Black's World", that you get after you pass the entire game. In this game, you will take control of a small robot named "Black". Using only two elements, such as a cube and a ball, you will have to solve numerous puzzles that take place in this surreal environment. A minimalist design allows the player to easily concentrate and just focus on the gameplay. The main character - Black will win your heart with his touching absent-mindedness. Without your help he will not be able to solve various problems that he will encounter along his journey.

    In its initial stage, the game will be released for all the models of iPad and iPhone, and localized in 8 languages: English, German, French, Spanish, Italian, Japanese, Chinese, Russian. Later we plan to release the game for all the other mobile platforms.

Screenshot of the first level of the game "Black".

     The concept of the game "Black" was coined by a 13-year-old boy named Gabriel Genesis (who eventually became a valued member of our team). Gabriel was tired of "blowing things up" and "being shot at". He thought that among all the violent games on the market, it would be a great idea to create a more peaceful kind of game. He decided to bring his vision of a logic-based puzzle game to life in the form of our small friend "Black". Leading him on a journey through multiple levels of varying difficulty, and on an epic quest for self-improvement, putting him through all types of challenges to prove his worth. A lovably smart but absent-minded little robot was about to be born.

    So Gabriel is the inspiration behind the project as well as the creator of the main character - the little robot "Black".

The very first concept art of the game "Black" came from young Gabriel. If we compare the above screenshot of the first level of the game with examples of the concept art, you can see how the design has changed. But for our team, this concept art is highly symbolic, and it also serves as a great introduction to the game.

Our young game-team loved Gabriel's idea... and we decided to bring it to life!

    We spent a lot of time brainstorming before we came to a consensus about the design of the project. We didn’t want the design to look overloaded with graphics and animation, as it moves away from the main idea of the game - solving a puzzle. Also, we didn’t want the game to appear in the vector style with too many sharp colors to irritate the eye or distract a player from the gameplay. As the result of much trial and error, the surreal and minimalist design was born. We are really very proud that our team has managed to create an atmosphere for the game that doesn’t look like another cookie-cutter game, but truly has its own unique character.

A screenshot of one of the game’s levels.

    There are only two elements in the game that our hero uses to pass the levels - a cube and a ball. And a brain, of course.. your brain.. lol.. Our small robot is more of a great tool to be operated by your hands, he's not so much of an Einstein himself.. :))

    There are also some ancillary elements to use, in the form of ropes and different moving platforms, swings and buttons. With the help of these tools our hero can make the platforms and other elements move - back and forward or up and down.

A screenshot of one of the game’s levels.

    The game will initially contain 35 levels of varying difficulty, from simple to complex. Almost all of the challenging levels have a simple solution that will depend on your careful observation.

The screenshot of the menu “LEVELS”.

    The game has a very simple and intuitive operation. It does not require you to memorize any of its functions.

A screenshot from the initial introduction to the game.

    Any and all players around the world who purchase the game and successfully complete all the levels will be presented with the album "Black's World" (digital edition) as a special reward!! Most will agree, this is a cool bonus, since the game will cost just $2.99 at all game stores!!!

    The album "Black's World" was written by distinctive and mysterious musician, hiding under the nickname Basilisk, specifically for this project, and produced by a talented multi-instrumentalist, emerging NY star, singer&songwriter Maria Brodskaya (aMBe). The music presented here creates an atmosphere of the world where the little robot "Black", the hero of our game, lives. The album has nine instrumental tracks, and the ninth track is the soundtrack of the game. The album is presented on iTunes and other popular stores in order to give everyone a chance to listen to a sample of the music tracks, as well as for additional financial aid  for our company. Also, you can listen to some excerpts of the tracks from the album on our official site www.okospace.com.

And now the most important thing for those who are going to support the project!!!

    All the gifts that are offered and available to you here are exclusive and were specially created for the Indiegogo campaign. The only exception is the digital edition of the album "Black's World" and the game itself. The copies of these gifts will not be made available after this Indiegogo campaign is over. So this is your one and only chance to get them - NOW!!!

   We really want the arc of our story - “how this young company began its life” - to remain in your memory and in your hands with some cool and unique rewards!!!

The screenshot of the bonus menu that will open after the game “Black” is completed.

  • All the physical gifts, a digital copy of the game, and gifts related to the release of the game will be delivered in February 2014 or earlier.
  • All digital gifts will be delivered within the next month after a successful campaign on Indiegogo.
  • Delivery of the gifts all around the world is included in the the price of gift.

We will do our best to deliver our gifts to you 

as quickly as possible!!!

We also commit ourselves, as a solidarity, to support other interesting projects on Indiegogo!!!

    The main reason we came to Indiegogo is quite simple: an important member of our team, the lead programmer, got seriously ill, and couldn’t continue to work on the project. We are a close knit team and were hit very hard by this development, but we believe deeply in this game and are not ready to give up.  We realized we need to raise the funds to hire a great programmer to complete the project. Also, now we think about serious extension of the gaming potential of the project, to make it even more enjoyable for you all!

    In order to complete the work on the game we need about 3 - 4 months. During this time, within a defined budget, we plan to release the game for all versions of the iPad and iPhone. And later we will release a major upgrade for the game, which will include:

  • Multiplayer for two players who will be competing in being the fastest and overcoming a self-generating line/track of different obstacles and puzzles needed to be solved.
  • Built-in level editor that will give players the opportunity to try their hand at creating new levels for the game and to earn real money!

>>> All upgrades will be free to play! <<<

THE PROGECT BUDGET - $20 000

(currently made​​: specification, design, logic of the 35 levels, music design, the music album "Black's World")

    If funding of our project will exceed the funds requested, then, depending on the collected amount, we will be able to release the game on other devices such as Android, Mac, PC, and so on.

  • $25,000 - Android (redesign, partial reprogramming)
  • $30,000 - Mac, PC (redesign, partial reprogramming)

    All other remaining funds will be used for the further development and improvement of the project. There is a parallel gaming universe where our main character Black resides when he is not solving logic puzzles, a real world where he lives. And it’s quite another story, which specifically directs the thoughts of our team into the 3D direction!

    If the amount of funds raised will be much greater than the requested budget, then it will let us to begin the development of the 3D game’s version right now, simultaneously with our 2D version!

    The 2D and 3D direction of the game will not be overlapping, since they are two different worlds with different feels and emotions. 2D casual games have their own unique charm that will never lose their relevance.

 All of you who help us on Indiegogo will be kept updated with all of our thoughts and plans about the development of the project "Black".

    Your participation in this project will pave the path to the world of a little robot called "Black". The world that we promise to develop with all our passion! Cause we believe so sincerely and truly that this project deserves to be born into this world and can be both - a big use and fun for anyone.

    This is your chance to bring a new and original project into the world of gaming. The project that we really think and hope conceals a large and diverse future.

Also, thank you for spending your time and strength to read this presentation all the way thru to the end! And for your support with the project "Black"! See you soon!

Risks and challenges

We are a young and small team that is just starting in the gaming/software market. So in order to best minimize financial risks with the launch of a new campaign, we took a number of precautions:

1. The game does not have a supermassive budget, so we are not going to spend a lot of money on an expensive advertising campaign. We are going to use social media platforms - that are very popular, but not that expensive and can garner great results, in addition to “word of mouth”, the benefit of a low sales price, the originality of the project and some cool bonus things. As noted above, not every company, especially a young one can afford to give a great album of music as a special “thank you” for playing the game! But that is exactly what we are taking care about: to give you double the pleasure: the game and the music!

2. The game "Black" is not a copycat of any other game on the market. From the beginning to the end we have being trying to keep it original and unique. So the novelty of the project is an additional factor to attract a critical mass of buzz and fans.

3. The game is designed for a large age range.

4. The game does not espouse violence, but only the good :))

5. The main game’s component is logic, particularly useful for the development of the younger generation.

6. The game is not a one-off project, we have plans to develop it in all sorts of ways, with new stories, new adventures and a lot of cool twists and turns. The idea of the game allows us to move in a few different directions and we are full of creativity and enthusiasm for its development.

7. The game has a chance to become a social phenomenon, as each of the players can potentially participate by creating their own levels for the game. It is interesting, not only in terms of creative enjoyment, but also it's a chance to feel like you are a part of the project. Giving you a chance to realize your own creative ideas! As well as a chance to potentially make some money from your development.

8. Causality and simplicity of operating allows players to operate the game without any special gaming skills. Even if you have never played any games before.

We want to practice a policy of gratitude and always give people something cool in exchange for their support and belief in us and our products.

We sincerely want to create an epic and adventurous game-story with an extended shelf-life. We don't want to just disappear after the first successful experience, which has been the case with many companies.

Black is a challenging yet intuitive linear puzzle game. It integrates a cool original soundtrack and an exciting bonus in the form of a digital album "Black's World", that you get after you pass the entire game. In this game, you will take control of a small robot named "Black". Using only two elements, such as a cube and a ball, you will have to solve numerous puzzles that take place in this surreal environment. A minimalist design allows the player to easily concentrate and just focus on the gameplay. The main character - Black will win your heart with his touching absent-mindedness. Without your help he will not be able to solve various problems that he will encounter along his journey.
    In its initial stage, the game will be released for all the models of iPad and iPhone, and localized in 8 languages: English, German, French, Spanish, Italian, Japanese, Chinese, Russian. Later we plan to release the game for all the other mobile platforms.

Screenshot of the first level of the game "Black".




     The concept of the game "Black" was coined by a 13-year-old boy named Gabriel Genesis (who eventually became a valued member of our team). Gabriel was tired of "blowing things up" and "being shot at". He thought that among all the violent games on the market, it would be a great idea to create a more peaceful kind of game. He decided to bring his vision of a logic-based puzzle game to life in the form of our small friend "Black". Leading him on a journey through multiple levels of varying difficulty, and on an epic quest for self-improvement, putting him through all types of challenges to prove his worth. A lovably smart but absent-minded little robot was about to be born.
    So Gabriel is the inspiration behind the project as well as the creator of the main character - the little robot "Black".
The very first concept art of the game "Black" came from young Gabriel. If we compare the above screenshot of the first level of the game with examples of the concept art, you can see how the design has changed. But for our team, this concept art is highly symbolic, and it also serves as a great introduction to the game.



Our young game-team loved Gabriel's idea... and we decided to bring it to life!


    We spent a lot of time brainstorming before we came to a consensus about the design of the project. We didn’t want the design to look overloaded with graphics and animation, as it moves away from the main idea of the game - solving a puzzle. Also, we didn’t want the game to appear in the vector style with too many sharp colors to irritate the eye or distract a player from the gameplay. As the result of much trial and error, the surreal and minimalist design was born. We are really very proud that our team has managed to create an atmosphere for the game that doesn’t look like another cookie-cutter game, but truly has its own unique character.

A screenshot of one of the game’s levels.





    There are only two elements in the game that our hero uses to pass the levels - a cube and a ball. And a brain, of course.. your brain.. lol.. Our small robot is more of a great tool to be operated by your hands, he's not so much of an Einstein himself.. :))
    There are also some ancillary elements to use, in the form of ropes and different moving platforms, swings and buttons. With the help of these tools our hero can make the platforms and other elements move - back and forward or up and down.
A screenshot of one of the game’s levels.



    The game will initially contain 35 levels of varying difficulty, from simple to complex. Almost all of the challenging levels have a simple solution that will depend on your careful observation.

The screenshot of the menu “LEVELS”.


    The game has a very simple and intuitive operation. It does not require you to memorize any of its functions.
A screenshot from the initial introduction to the game.


    Any and all players around the world who purchase the game and successfully complete all the levels will be presented with the album "Black's World" (digital edition) as a special reward!! Most will agree, this is a cool bonus, since the game will cost just $2.99 at all game stores!!!
    The album "Black's World" was written by distinctive and mysterious musician, hiding under the nickname Basilisk, specifically for this project, and produced by a talented multi-instrumentalist, emerging NY star, singer&songwriter Maria Brodskaya (aMBe). The music presented here creates an atmosphere of the world where the little robot "Black", the hero of our game, lives. The album has nine instrumental tracks, and the ninth track is the soundtrack of the game. The album is presented on iTunes and other popular stores in order to give everyone a chance to listen to a sample of the music tracks, as well as for additional financial aid  for our company. Also, you can listen to some excerpts of the tracks from the album on our official site www.okospace.com.
And now the most important thing for those who are going to support the project!!!
    All the gifts that are offered and available to you here are exclusive and were specially created for the Indiegogo campaign. The only exception is the digital edition of the album "Black's World" and the game itself. The copies of these gifts will not be made available after this Indiegogo campaign is over. So this is your one and only chance to get them - NOW!!!

   We really want the arc of our story - “how this young company began its life” - to remain in your memory and in your hands with some cool and unique rewards!!!
The screenshot of the bonus menu that will open after the game “Black” is completed.

All the physical gifts, a digital copy of the game, and gifts related to the release of the game will be delivered in February 2014 or earlier.
All digital gifts will be delivered within the next month after a successful campaign on Indiegogo.

Delivery of the gifts all around the world is included in the the price of gift.




We will do our best to deliver our gifts to you 
as quickly as possible!!!


We also commit ourselves, as a solidarity, to support other interesting projects on Indiegogo!!!



    The main reason we came to Indiegogo is quite simple: an important member of our team, the lead programmer, got seriously ill, and couldn’t continue to work on the project. We are a close knit team and were hit very hard by this development, but we believe deeply in this game and are not ready to give up.  We realized we need to raise the funds to hire a great programmer to complete the project. Also, now we think about serious extension of the gaming potential of the project, to make it even more enjoyable for you all!
    In order to complete the work on the game we need about 3 - 4 months. During this time, within a defined budget, we plan to release the game for all versions of the iPad and iPhone. And later we will release a major upgrade for the game, which will include:



Multiplayer for two players who will be competing in being the fastest and overcoming a self-generating line/track of different obstacles and puzzles needed to be solved.


Built-in level editor that will give players the opportunity to try their hand at creating new levels for the game and to earn real money!



>>> All upgrades will be free to play! <<<



THE PROGECT BUDGET - $20 000
(currently made​​: specification, design, logic of the 35 levels, music design, the music album "Black's World")




    If funding of our project will exceed the funds requested, then, depending on the collected amount, we will be able to release the game on other devices such as Android, Mac, PC, and so on.



$25,000 - Android (redesign, partial reprogramming)

$30,000 - Mac, PC (redesign, partial reprogramming)


    All other remaining funds will be used for the further development and improvement of the project. There is a parallel gaming universe where our main character Black resides when he is not solving logic puzzles, a real world where he lives. And it’s quite another story, which specifically directs the thoughts of our team into the 3D direction!
    If the amount of funds raised will be much greater than the requested budget, then it will let us to begin the development of the 3D game’s version right now, simultaneously with our 2D version!
    The 2D and 3D direction of the game will not be overlapping, since they are two different worlds with different feels and emotions. 2D casual games have their own unique charm that will never lose their relevance.
 All of you who help us on Indiegogo will be kept updated with all of our thoughts and plans about the development of the project "Black".


    Your participation in this project will pave the path to the world of a little robot called "Black". The world that we promise to develop with all our passion! Cause we believe so sincerely and truly that this project deserves to be born into this world and can be both - a big use and fun for anyone.
    This is your chance to bring a new and original project into the world of gaming. The project that we really think and hope conceals a large and diverse future.
Also, thank you for spending your time and strength to read this presentation all the way thru to the end! And for your support with the project "Black"! See you soon!






Risks and challenges
We are a young and small team that is just starting in the gaming/software market. So in order to best minimize financial risks with the launch of a new campaign, we took a number of precautions:
1. The game does not have a supermassive budget, so we are not going to spend a lot of money on an expensive advertising campaign. We are going to use social media platforms - that are very popular, but not that expensive and can garner great results, in addition to “word of mouth”, the benefit of a low sales price, the originality of the project and some cool bonus things. As noted above, not every company, especially a young one can afford to give a great album of music as a special “thank you” for playing the game! But that is exactly what we are taking care about: to give you double the pleasure: the game and the music!
2. The game "Black" is not a copycat of any other game on the market. From the beginning to the end we have being trying to keep it original and unique. So the novelty of the project is an additional factor to attract a critical mass of buzz and fans.
3. The game is designed for a large age range.
4. The game does not espouse violence, but only the good :))
5. The main game’s component is logic, particularly useful for the development of the younger generation.
6. The game is not a one-off project, we have plans to develop it in all sorts of ways, with new stories, new adventures and a lot of cool twists and turns. The idea of the game allows us to move in a few different directions and we are full of creativity and enthusiasm for its development.
7. The game has a chance to become a social phenomenon, as each of the players can potentially participate by creating their own levels for the game. It is interesting, not only in terms of creative enjoyment, but also it's a chance to feel like you are a part of the project. Giving you a chance to realize your own creative ideas! As well as a chance to potentially make some money from your development.
8. Causality and simplicity of operating allows players to operate the game without any special gaming skills. Even if you have never played any games before.
We want to practice a policy of gratitude and always give people something cool in exchange for their support and belief in us and our products.
We sincerely want to create an epic and adventurous game-story with an extended shelf-life. We don't want to just disappear after the first successful experience, which has been the case with many companies.

story:
WHY WE NEED THIS PRODUCT!

If you have kids you must know all about the water bottle flipping craze and if you're anything like most parents, you're over it!   I wanted to create a game that would stop driving us parents crazy and at the sometime keep the kids happy.  I believe we hit the target(pun intended). Target Flip takes paying bottle flipping to the next level.  We created a target pad and scoring system that you can keep track on the bottle.  Plus when you hit expert level you can play with the highlighter thats included with the game.  The scoring pad is designed to soften the sound so parents won't freak out and the kids can take it to their own room instead of tossing bottles all over the house.  Not only was I tired of finding half empty bottles around the house, I was also tired of all the wasting of water and plastic. This product solves the problem and keeps the kids happy!  Their very own bottle to keep, refill and glows in the dark.

BOOM.. The Target Flip was invented!

The perks raised will go to the final development of the product.  We do have the manufactures lined up and ready to roll!  All that is needed is funds to make this a reality.  Thank you for your time and support to make this craze bearable to all parents! :)

Cheers,

Joe Moxley

story:
Let's build together a new way of connecting while apart.

The world is in a crisis, social distancing isn't a choice, but a duty... how about connecting virtually? How about using new technologies like VR to get closer across the globe, how about playing, you and me, randomly selected, without knowing who each other is but with the certainty of having something in common. It's time for a new kind of connection, a human one.

The conjuncture forces us to be separated, let's use virtual reality to connect

This is Human Connection, the development where joining worlds has never been so much fun!

But if social networks do that job ... you think so, don't you?

Here are some reasons why Human Connection transforms the way we interact and connect with others.

Solve challenges with anyone in the world and that way you know their culture and world in a collaborative game.
 

With virtual reality you achieve a unique experience full of sensory stimuli that connect you with your playmate.
 

Games and remains have been designed to be solved together. Each couple does something and together they overcome the situation.
 

The random factor makes each game different and it is fun not to know the partner that you will play with.
 

4 steps to star the adventure.

1. Take your cell phone

2. Use the cardboards

3. Download our app

4. Put your ability to connect and solve challenges on

Our challenges have been built thinking that you connect with the other person, know their culture and world to generate a bond that reconnects them.

You will face the challenges collaboratively to achieve the most points.

But how?

You will connect with someone so that together they go further and exceed the scores.

 

After game

At the end of the challenge you can send a single message to the other person and decide if you connect, if you both want it, the data will appear to be contacted outside the app (this information has been previously authorized to share your personal data)

The connection will end and you will reconnect with another person.

You will know your ranking and that of other teams, in addition to the person with the most points and connections.

We are a company formed by video game developers, graphic and 3D designers and communicators that have been developing virtual and augmented reality and videogames for companies for 5 year. In this time, we seen the the power of virtual reality to develop people’s competencies, why no test the most important connection and competence… connect with another.

We want to move from serious applications to entertaining games that connect people and show new ways of playing, where the board is the world.

You want to know more?

The objetive of the game it to connect human beings in a way that goes beyond a like or see a photo. It is a connection that seeks to community, understand, achieve a challenge together, have fun.

Through virtual reality we will randomly connect with another person in the world and together we will solve three challenges. This connection will last two days, after that and if you are successful in the challenges you will connect with another person. If both people want it, they can share their data and be friends.

 

Do you like challenges? Do you think you could overcome cultural and language barriers to reach the goal?

Join us¡¡¡¡¡¡ We can create a New Type of Human Connection

story:
We are proud to present "Animal Duel", the board game. After 3 private board games, we created our first public game.

Although we are a Spanish company, the game will be in Spanish/English languages.

We wanted to create a duel game between 2 players, and this is the result. In our humble opinion, these types of games must be tested and retested on and on, in order to reach a balanced and fun game.

And so is how "Animal Duel" born...

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Estamos orgullosos de presentar "Animal Duel", el juego de mesa. Después de 3 juegos de mesa privados, hemos creado nuestro primer juego público.

Aunque somos una compañía española, el juego estará en Español/Inglés.

Queríamos crear un juego de duelos entre 2 jugadores, y este es el resultado. En nuestra humilde opinión, este tipo de juegos debe ser testeado una y otra vez, con el fin de alcanzar un juego equilibrado y divertido.

Y así es como "Animal Duel" nació...

The objective of this game is to destroy the opponent's life by placing cards on the board. A best of three games.

There are two types of cards:

  • The situational cards, which are those that alter the progress of the game.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

El objetivo del juego es destruir la vida del oponentes colocando cartas en el tablero. Al mejor de 3 partidas.

Hay dos tipos de cartas:

  • Las cartas situacionales, son aquellas que alteran el progreso del juego..

  • The animal cards, which are used to damage to the opponent.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  • Las cartas de animales, que son usadas para dañar al oponente.

These animal cards have 4 filled circles on their 4 sides. Each circle is divided into four quarters, which are colored according to the strength of the animal. For example, if you have the right circle with its 4 quarters green coloured, it means that you have 4 points on the right side. And so with their 4 sides. Therefore, the animal's strength is defined by their 4 sides.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Estas cartas de animal tienen 4 círculos rellenos en sus 4 lados. Cada círculo esta dividido en 4 cuartos, que están coloreados según la fuerza del animal. Por ejemplo, si tienes el círculo derecho con sus 4 cuartos coloreados en verde, significa que tienes 4 puntos en el lado derecho. Y así con sus 4 lados. Por lo tanto, la fuerza del animal está definida por sus 4 lados.

On each turn, players play their situational cards and strategically place their animal cards (with the name of the animal facing them) on the 16 quadrants of the board.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

En cada turno, los jugadores juegan sus cartas situacionales y estratégicamente colocan sus cartas de animal (con el nombre del animal mirando hacia ellos) en los 16 cuadrantes del tablero.

At the beginning, players choose side of the board. Now both players roll a 6-sided dice. Whoever wins will be the first player.

The life tokens (they may be coins) are placed on 21 in the life bar zone. If tokens are coins, the winner could win both of them, making the game more interesting.

5 cards are dealt. Players must always have at least 2 animal cards. Otherwise, you must return a situational card to the deck and draw another card, until 2 animal cards are obtained.

Turn Player 1:

  1. If desired, situation cards are used. Apply their effects and discard them in the papyrus zone.
  2. Mandatorily an animal card is played on an unoccupied position of the board.
  3. If that played card has an adjacent enemy card, the highest score on that side will be subtracted to the lowest score and the result will be the damage dealt to the player with the lowest score.
  4. That damage will be subtracted to the life bar of the corresponding player.
  5. The same process will be repeated if there are still sides of the played card in contact with enemy cards on the board.
  6. When all damages have been calculated, the player draws cards from the deck until having 5 cards again (2 of them must always be animal cards).
  7. Pass the turn to player 2, and repeat the process to the end of the game. The game ends when a player reach 0 health points or when board is complete, winning whoever has more health points.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Al comienzo, los jugadores eligen lado del tablero. Ahora ambos jugadores tiran un dado de 6 caras. El que gane será el primer jugador.

Los contadores de vida (pueden ser monedas) son colocados en el 21 en la zona de la barra de vida. Si los contadores son monedas, el ganador podría ganar ambas, haciendo el juego más interesante.

Se reparten 5 cartas. Los jugadores deben tener siempre al menos 2 cartas de animales. En el caso contrario, se deberá devolver una carta situacional al mazo y robar otra carta, así hasta tener 2 cartas de animal.

Turno del Jugador 1:

  1. Si se quiere, se usarán la o las cartas situacionales. Se aplican sus efectos y se descartan en la zona del papiro.
  2. Obligatoriamente se jugará una carta de animal en una posición desocupada del tablero.
  3. Si esa carta jugada tiene una carta enemiga adyacente, la puntuación más alta de ese lado se restará a la menor y el resultado será el daño hecho al jugador con la menor puntuación.
  4. Ese daño será restado a la barra de vida del jugador correspondiente.
  5. Se repetirá el mismo proceso mientras haya lados de la carta jugada en contacto con cartas enemigas sobre el tablero.
  6. Cuándo todos los daños hayan sido calculados, el jugador roba cartas del mazo hasta volver a tener 5 cartas (2 de ellas siempre deben ser cartas de animal).
  7. Pasa el turno al jugador 2, y se repite el proceso completo hasta acabar el juego. El juego acaba cuándo un jugador llega a 0 puntos de vida o cuando se completa el tablero, ganando quién tenga más puntos de vida.

Inside the box you will find:

  • 2 tokens for health bars.
  • A 6-sided dice.
  • A 54 cards deck.
  • A game rulebook (Spanish/English).
  • The game board.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Dentro de la caja tú encontrarás:

  • 2 contadores para las barras de vida.
  • Un dado de 6 caras.
  • Una baraja de 54 cartas.
  • Unas instrucciones del juego (Español/Inglés).
  • El tablero.


Our main goal is to raise 11.000 €. Your contributions will help us bring this game to life. Extra money will be used to add further details and quality to the game:

·  11.000 € = Production of the game.

·  11.500 € = A 72 cards deck (more animals and situations).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Nuestro objetivo principal es llegar a 11.000 €. Vuestras contribuciones nos ayudarán a darle vida a este juego. El dinero extra que se consiga será usado para añadir detalles adicionales y más calidades al juego:

· 11.000 € = Producción del juego.

· 11.500 € = Una baraja de 72 cartas (más cartas de animales y situacionales).


The execution time would be 2-3 months. Production Company is waiting the order to start.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

El tiempo de ejecución sería de entre 2 y 3 meses. La empresa de producción esta esperando la orden para comenzar.

SHIPPING NOT INCLUDED IN "ANIMAL DUEL, THE BOARD GAME", "ANIMAL PACK" AND "ANIMAL STORES" PERKS.

For Spain the game will be delivered through our local distributor with a cost of 9€.

The game will be dispatched from Spain for European delivery with a cost of 19€ and for the rest of the world with a cost of 30€.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

GASTOS DE ENVIO NO INCLUIDOS EN LA RECOMPENSAS "ANIMAL DUEL, THE BOARD GAME", "ANIMAL PACK" Y "ANIMAL STORES".

Para España el juego será entregado a través de nuestro distribuidor local con un coste de 9€.

El juego será enviado desde España para Europa con un coste de 19€ y para el resto del mundo con un coste de 30€.

Payments will be processed through Paypal which ensures the security of your transaction and refund in case our funding goal isn't reached.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Los pagos serán procesados a través de Paypal la cuál te garantiza la seguridad de tu transacción y te devolverá el dinero en el caso de que no se logre el objetivo de la campaña.

If you cannot contribute, there are still 2 ways for helping us:

  • Encourage others to do it.
  • Share our project with others via Facebook/Twitter.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Si no puedes contribuir, todavía hay 2 maneras de ayudarnos:

  • Anima a otros a hacerlo.
  • Comparte nuestro proyecto con otras personas via Facebook/Twitter.

story:
Zombie Raiders, an apocalyptic crafting, exploring and fighting game

Download version 1.0 here!

Deonn Games started in 2010 as a small part-time studio with a passion for developing games. Due to the low budget and primary jobs from the team, we aimed at mobile games, as they can be simple and quick to finish and run Java apps in the case of Android. We now have a few completed and marketed games, including our biggest hit Asteroid Defense, Krafteers and Mac Hunter. The latest release although is what brought us here.

Zombie Raiders was launched for mobile devices as a building and crafting game but can be much more. You can download and play for free our most recent version for PC, join the multiplayer server and build your own anti-zombie shelter. Even in the present state - 2D top-view graphics, limited player customization and world size, it’s great fun and has a great potential to become a full Action RPG system for Desktop computers (PC, Mac and Linux): A completely constructable/destructible online sandbox world simulating a zombie infestation where you can interact with every single element.

Our small team is formed by one coder, one graphic artist and one sound engineer. We ask for the minimum amount to pay the development costs. It should take around 6 months to finish, making it a monthly cost of around U$ 3.500 for the studio to run (including employees, rent, salary) and totaling $ 21.000. We are rounding this up and asking for $20k.

What you get? Besides helping in the creation of a really awesome PC game, depending on your collaboration you can have other advantages: a much cheaper preorder, exclusive character customization options and items, vehicles, and even have your brand or name printed in-game in an element of your choice (monuments, outdoors, buildings).

Excited about this project? Check out more details below:

New Video games with the ambition of putting the player inside a  world simulating a zombie infection where every dead would return to walk and attack the living are appearing every other day since around 2002 and the return of the genre popularized in the 70’s by George Romero’ movies. When we think it’s getting old, like a rotten corpse rising from underground, another wave of movies, series, comics and games featuring the undead will reappear.

That never stopped us from creating this concept. This is a project that has been pursued for some years now, even before zombies were cool. Sad thing with small teams is that it takes a lot of time and attempts to achieve something decent.

What always motivated us was the fact that practically every single one of the millions of zombie themed games were disappointing. It is really easy to disappoint when it comes to zombie games, because they are just stupid ghouls that can’t even shoot a gun. Every aspect of the shoot ‘em zombies were already exploited by at least 3 big budget games. Graphical zombie carnage excellence was achieved by some. Other games had incredible weapon customization for maximum blasting power. But they all lacked something.

Surviving a zombie apocalypse is not just run in a predefined path killing all the zombies you can with giant weapons (although that would be cool). In a more realistic simulation, zombies are mainly obstacles to your already harsh day-to-day survival. When you are lost and hungry, every known person is dead or zombified, you have to find a safe place to settle, gather resources, find companions, build structures, craft utilities, scavenge the perimeter to search for weapons, ammo, food and water.

But how could we create such a complex game with so little resources? After many attempts using different engines and languages, we found a way to do it by splitting the project in phases and modular codes that defines behavior and features of each object in the simulation. With that, it’s easy and quick to add new items, mobs, npcs, or balance existing ones. The crafting menus automatically tells the player what are the necessary crafting items to make it easy to know what can you do in-game. Initially it was programmed to be a simple android-only, 2D, locally hosted multiplayer and distributed freely in Google Play (with interstitial ads). It runs ok on medium-end phones and tabs, and great for high-end devices with bigger screens. A brief period of beta testing for free encouraged us to try running a free online server for the game with a bigger world map and unlimited simultaneous players.

Without any advertisements or promotion except an youtube video and usual Google Play visibility, the mobile version of the game had so far more than 3.000 downloads and lots of encouraging messages, suggestions, tips and gameplay ideas, people playing and helping balance the game, forming groups and gangs, in a way that we think we need to expand it all and bring it to the power of PC.

It is possible to make this game really awesome. Every in-game item can be combined or splitted into parts, with no limits of iterations. It can have awesome 3D graphics with full HD resolution and immersive atmosphere. Buildings that you can actually go inside or build your own. Destructable terrains. Stores aboveground or underground passages. Different camera angles and views. Ragdoll animations for dead zombies. Character editor, customization, armors, a giant diversity of weapons and other items. Clans or gangs registration, so you can compete with other groups of survivors in PvP servers, private in-game stashes and belongings, a true and complete RPG system for battles and in an expansive realistic world full of cities, villages, all simulating an earth with a severe case of zombie pandemia.

Some similar games are coming now, finally, after so many years, from big budget game studios. Will they follow many of their predecessors and also disappoint, delivering low levels of interactions or freedom to take whatever decision you want inside the game? Future will tell. But for the present we have a great playable “prototype” urging to be improved, and with your help we can make them have a run for their money by creating a collaborative, community driven ultimate zombie game.

You can download and play the PC version of Zombie Raiders for free and see what we have already achieved. The whole structure of the game is done and stable, and a graphical upgrade to 3D and addition of more elements is what’s more urgent. But the plans are to go much further. It all depends on how much interest we can attract with our project.

We already have:

  • Lots of items to scavenge and craft
  • Build walls and utilities to fortify your shelter
  • Hire companions, trade, buy and sell items
  • Conquer Outposts through the map
  • Explode bombs, landmines and barrels
  • Play online with your friends using a LAN network Online Multiplayer also available in our server
  • HD Graphics when supported, low graphics mode was implemented to make the game compatible to all the devices.

The In-game story so far: Everything happened a few months after the day of the Incident Z. In the post-apocalyptic world, survival is the largest of the enterprises. In your shelter, supplies were scarce. When you found a helicopter, decided to take off in search of survival and valuable items. But eventually found something more important, BioTech Labs that leaked poisonous gases that are making the dead come back and attack the living. To destroy them you will have to explore and reactivate all the failed Government’s Task-Force Outposts to find the parts and assemble the time-bomb capable of blowing up the buildings and save humanity from the undead extinction.

Download version 1.0 here!

story:
Development version gameplay footage (Feb. 27)

So I asked one of my favorite YouTube Let’s Players (and fellow game developer) JimPlaysGames to help me test the development version of the game. He was kind enough to help me out and also recorded the session. He experienced some weird stutters that I can’t quite explain. Nevertheless, you can watch the entire gaming session (6 players, 45min) here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_2TUioMZfL0.

About me

Hi, my name is Michael Goldener (though I tend to go with the name Fritz) and I like to use computers to create things. One of my longest running projects is a unique free, experimental FPS game called "Revenge Of The Cats: Ethernet" (http://www.desura.com/games/revenge-of-the-cats-ethernet).

I was born in 1985 and despite having acquired a lot of computer-related skills since then, I've never been able to use them to make money*. But who cares? - I do this because it's interesting, fun and inherently rewarding. If I need money, there are always "real" Jobs I can do on the side. At least that's what I used to think. But the last few years have proven that (1) I'm terrible at getting "real" jobs and that (2) working a "real" job leaves me with no energy to work on the things I actually care about.

* One exception: Someone once donated 10$ to ROTC: Ethernet. I used the money to buy Hotline Miami :-)

Crowdfunding: The solution?

Could crowdfunding be a way for me to work on projects I care about while also getting some money to pay the bills?

That's what I'm trying to figure out here. And with this being my first attempt at crowdfunding, I'm starting with an inexpensive and short (but also very intense) project: Creating a small but fun PC game in just two weeks. 

I'll need to raise 700 bucks to cover the cost of the project, which is essentially just my living expenses for the two weeks I'm currently dedicating to nothing else than working on the game.

Why you might help

  • Maybe you want your own, visually unique etherform in the game (see "Unique Etherform" perk).
  • Maybe you think the game will be fun and would like a chance to influence its development (see "Tester" perk).
  • Maybe you'd like to have your name, your website or your company prominently displayed in the main menu (see "Sponsor" perk).
  • Maybe you have a short message that you'd like to see in the game (see "Supporter With A Message" perk).
  • Maybe you want to help me out because you like ROTC: Ethernet.
  • Or maybe you think like me and believe that projects like this somehow deserve support on principle ;-)

How similar is Cat5 to ROTC: Ethernet?

Technically, Cat5 is a fork of ROTC: Ethernet. But the only thing thing the finished version of Cat5 will share with ROTC is code and the basic idea of the "Ethernet" game mode. Cat5's gameplay is very different from ROTC's.

About the game

Cat5 is a multiplayer top-down team-based tactical action game for Windows, Linux and (hopefully) MacOS X. 

Think ROTC: Ethernet meets Frozen Synapse meets Hotline Miami!

The "Ethernet" game type (à la ROTC: Ethernet)

Maps are divided into zones and two teams fight over control of these zones. Players control flying, indestructible "etherforms" that can manifest into physical form within a zone controlled by their team. These physical forms can then capture additional zones by being inside them while no physical enemy  is also present. The zone then turns the team's color. If physical forms of both teams are present, the zone remains white. The game is won if the opposing team has lost all their zones and has no more physical forms on the map that could possibly claim them back. 

Physical forms can voluntarily switch back into etherform at any time. If they are destroyed, their player is simply forced back into etherform.

Tight role-based teamplay (à la Frozen Synapse)


Players will have to work tightly together in order to capture zones. Going in alone will only get you killed.

The following classes are currently planned:

  • Shotgunner: The primary assault class, shotgunners move fast and can destroy physical forms with one hit at close range. Their main weakness is their low rate of fire.
  • Minigunner: Minigunners can provide supressing fire allowing teammates to move to new positions.
  • Specialist: Their bouncing projectiles can be used to attack enemies behind cover.

Unforgiving fast-paced high-precision combat (à la Hotline Miami)


The combination of precise mouse/keyboard controls and the top-down viewpoint allows for intense combat, where the smallest mistake can lead to a quick death. Though saying "death" is misleading, as players can't really die. Destroying a player's physical form only forces him back into etherform, enabling him to manifest somewhere else soon after.

3D demo playback


Players can record demos of their matches. When playing them back, the camera can move around freely.

In-game map editor


Being based on the ROTC: Ethernet engine (which in turn is based on the Torque Game Engine), Cat5 already has a functional in-game map editor.

What happens if funding succeeds?

If funding succeeds, I'll release the game (client & server) as freeware to the public through http://cat5.wasted.ch no later than the first of march 2013.

What happens if funding fails?

If funding fails, I'll still release the game (client & server) as freeware to the public through http://cat5.wasted.ch no later than the first of march 2013. I won't remove custom etherforms from the game once they're in, but if funding fails the released version will naturally not contain any sponsorship credits/messages (see perks).

Feedback needed!

This being my first attempt at a crowdfunding campaign, I could really use some feedback on the campaign itself.

Did you consider backing the project but then decided against it? - Please let me know why.

Do you have suggestions how to improve this page? - Please tell me.

Is something unclear? - Don't be afraid to ask questions.

How to get in touch with me?

You can contact me via e-mail at mg@wasted.ch or find me in the #cat5 channel on the FreeNode IRC network under the username "fr1tz".

Or if you're into that kind of thing, you can also find me on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/m.goldener.

Features (Guaranteed)

If funding succeeds, this is a list of features the release on the first of march is guaranteed to contain.

Additional features will be added during the course of this campaign. Once a feature appears on this list, I guarantee it won't be removed again.

  • Client & Server for MS Windows and Linux
  • Online & LAN play
  • Playable forms with original visuals and sound effects:
    • Etherform
    • Shotgunner
    • Minigunner
    • Specialist
  • Maps
    • Simple fairly linear map
  • Functional graphical user interface
  • Working in-game map editor
  • 3D demo playback

Features (Optional)

I have lots of ideas for the game, but because the idea of the project is to create a complete game completely by myself in an insanely short amount of time, I can't guarantee that they will all be realized.

Features on this list might be moved to the guaranteed features list above during the course of this campaign.

  • Client & Server for Mac OS X (I can't guarantee a Mac OS X version because I have to borrow a Mac from somewhere every time I want to build the Mac OS X version.)
  • Playable forms with original visuals and sound effects:
    • Grenadier
  • Maps
    • A map with an interesting zone layout  
  • Stylish graphical user interface with original visuals and sound effects

Information for supporters

This section is only relevant for people who have claimed one of the following perks:

  • Tester
  • Unique Etherform (includes "Tester")
  • Supporter With A Message (includes "Tester")

Tester

Contact me and tell me your desired player name + password.

Unique Etherform

For now I only need a 64x64 pixel avatar icon. PNG format would be best. You can send me a link to the picture or send it as an e-mail attachment.

Supporter With A Message

Let me know if you've decided on a message or want to change your current one. For now I'm going with a maximum message length of 140 characters, though that might increase once I get to work on the GUI.

story:
(Click here for video)


(Click here to download)


About the project:

Solius: The Magic Castle is a side-scrolling video game.  In the game you play as a knight inside a magic castle filled with monsters and demons. Inside the castle there are magic doors that take you to all sorts of different places and environments. As the player you must venture through the castle to defeat all the evil forces that have taken residence there.  Along the way you will collect powerful items that will aid you in this endeavor, and gradually release the magic power needed to open up new parts of the castle to explore.
The game is patterned after classics from the Super Nintendo era, when games opened up to larger expansive projects with unique and rich areas, but while the gameplay was still simple and fun.  We believe that a game doesn't need to rely on gimmicks and nostalgia to stand out from the crowd; a game that is fun to play will be fun to play, and the most important thing is to keep a game fun to play.
