Inside the castle there are magic doors that take you to all sorts of different places and environments. As the player you must venture through the castle to defeat all the evil forces that have taken residence there.  Along the way you will collect powerful items that will aid you in this endeavor, and gradually release the magic power needed to open up new parts of the castle to explore.The game is patterned after classics from the Super Nintendo era, when games opened up to larger expansive projects with unique and rich areas, but while the gameplay was still simple and fun.  We believe that a game doesn't need to rely on gimmicks and nostalgia to stand out from the crowd; a game that is fun to play will be fun to play, and the most important thing is to keep a game fun to play.

How the funds will be used:100% funding will cover the necessities of a simple and fun game.  But to get the most out of it, any additional funding will be used to both polish and expand the game into a truly legendary experience.






When will the game be finished?The outline we have set for the project puts another 18 months of development on this game, aiming for a release early in 2016.  This is the development cycle we have budgeted for.  But all projects run into something unexpected, so the official timetable is 18-24 months, giving a little breathing room for delays.

story:
Why you have to play with cubes when there is a world of virus waiting for you.

Here in Customeeple.com we want to offer you this methacrilate virus meeples  to fullfill your pandemics needs.

These Methacrilate Virus Game tokens will not be for sale online or at various stores unless we make our goal on IndieGOGO. If we reach our goal, all who backed this project will be the first to own these special tokens.

We are Customeeple a new European-based company engaged in the manufacture of extras to embellish your boardgames. With a team of people with years of experience in graphic design and even more years of experience in the field of games this time we want to bring you this virus meeples to embellish all your Virus infection games.

We play a lot a very well known game about a pandemic in the world, we love it, but we decided that it can has some love so we designed this set of virus to play in virus boardgames.

The problem is that the production cost make difficult to us to raise all the funds, Notice that there are a lot colours and a lot of meeples, so we need 1200€ to buy all the color methacrilate panels to make the first print of this custom virus set,  afterwards they will be available on our shop Customeeple.com, but only if we reach the initial amount to make this initial launch.

As we are a little company we need all the suport we can get to publish this new product. 

We do not have images of the final products, but we have some test models in transparent methacrilatethat we made to check the designs, we could not made the test models in the real colors as we have to buy a complete panel of each color and thats why we need this kickstarter :D

 

The virus cube with a hole meeple has a failure, and do not cut fine the centre but this will not happen on the final ones. (thats why we take this tests :D) 

The 8mm blue cube is only show on scale purpose. Note that the Pandemic* boardgame use 10mm cubes check our video in witch we use 10mm cubes to get a better idea

 

The meeples we design has a size betwen 15mm and 21mm, and 3mm of size, so they can be stack to play with, they will be made in methacrilate of diferent colors.

 

We will make every single virus in the set diferent in our first streck goal. obviusly they will be diferenciate species, but all of themwill be in diferent poses, as moving viruses.

We will unveil this secret strech goal as soon as we reach our fund raise espectation.

The Virus meeples are made by us Customeeple.com, and we are based on Spain, so we are offering FREE shipping to all EUROPE.

If you are from outside europe please add 10€ to your contribution, and we will be happy to send you the meeples.

As we Are a small company we appreciate all your support, and really thank you for all the distribution you could make for this campaign in your local boardgame forums and all the websites

Really thanks in advance :D

Also Thank you very much for visiting our project, we take your support very seriously and take this campaing as a compromise to all our backers to give the best product posible.

And if you hace any sugestions please write us to hello@customeeple.com, contact us on twitter@customeeple or find us on facebook facebook.com/customeeple

Thank you very much for helping us launch this dream.

Sincerely

Jose Veiga-Cabalier

Designer, Founder and Player.

 

Designs are original art by Customeeple and are in the pre-production stage, they are subject to change per manufacturer's requirements.

 

*Pandemic is a game published by Z-Man Games

Customeeple is not affiliated with Z-Man Games and this product is not endorsed by them.

story:
Roll-A-Bong is a board game dedicated to the community of Marijuana smokers, who enjoy smoking while playing board games.  All players are encouraged to contribute weed to the “Community Dish” at the start of the game.  Other recommended supplies include drinks, snacks, and a variety of smoking devices, and most importantly a bong!

How to play.  Roll-A-Bong is a track board game where players roll dice to move.  Two six sided dice are needed to play.  Players roll both dice to determine order of play, the highest going first!  A single die is rolled to move an individual’s token down the track.  Each square has directions to be followed by the player.  If the player is unable to complete the task or does not want the result (example “Take a Bong”) the player may give away the prize to any other player or spectator. 

Most importantly, no one wins, and there is no need to finish any game.  It is designed for smoking fun and should be used by choice.  In this bold new future we are all brothers and sisters in this legalization of our favorite hobby!

Types of Squares and explanation of directions

Roll-A-Bong –When a player lands on this square they immediately roll 2 dice. 

# rolled

Result

2

Move back one square

3-4

Give a Bong

5-9

Take a Bong

10-11

Take a Bong/Give a Bong

12

Double Bong Hit!

Roll Again- As stated, roll again.

Pack-A-Bong- Community service!

Instant Improvisation- Do a stupid human trick, an impersonation of a famous person, or tell a joke.

Worm Hole- Player rerolls die to see if they jump to next or move back to the last worm Hole.  1-3 back, 4-6 forward.  If there is no back or forward Worm Hole, the turn is forfeited. 

Mr. Narc- You lose your next bong, sorry (Things are changing!)

Corner Deli- Have a snack!

No Papers! - Immediately roll two dice, you need doubles to leave! (And move that number!)

Smoke a Bowl- Stop, pack one, and smoke and enjoy as a group.

Dry Spell- While players are on these squares, they cannot drink anything!

Change Tunes- The Music selection playing should be changed.  If no music is playing you’re crazy, put some on!

Make a Toast- All players and spectators toast and drink together.

Air Guitar- Start playing air guitar like your favorite Rock-n-roller.  If you can’t think of anything at least do “Smoke on the Water.”

Take a “Groupie” like a Selfie but with the whole group- Take a group shot for the “Roll-A-Bong” Wall of Legalization!

Gunga Dinn- Get all participants a drink.

Community Dish- Add to Community Dish.

Energy Shot-After all that smoking, an Energy shot could help.  Take what’s available or have a “5 Hour Energy.”  Coffee, Strong tea, even soda with its dreaded high fructose corn syrup will work.

Roll a Joint- This is the final square, and if there is anything left in the community dish, all there should share in smoking this joint dedicated to peace and friendship.

The Game board is the same size as an open Double Album (The same type of album used for cleaning pot in the old days!) and folds in half for easy storage.  The background of the board is space themed with pictures of cool space objects and psychedelic gas cloud formations. The squares make a winding track, similar to the type used in “Chutes and Ladders.”  Many squares are repeated, like “Roll-A-Bong” and some only occur once like “Roll a Joint.”

Players have a choice of the Token they use for playing pieces, but additional tokens are available for purchase.  The game comes with 2 six sided dice, a game board and simple instructions.

Start playing air guitar like your favorite Rock-n-roller.  If you can’t think of anything at least do
“Smoke on the Water.”
Take a “Groupie”
like a Selfie but with the whole group- Take a group shot for the “Roll-A-Bong”
Wall of Legalization!
Gunga Dinn-
Get all participants a drink.
Community Dish-
Add to Community Dish.
Energy Shot-After
all that smoking, an Energy shot could help. 
Take what’s available or have a “5 Hour Energy.”  Coffee, Strong tea, even soda with its
dreaded high fructose corn syrup will work.
Roll a Joint-
This is the final square, and if there is anything left in the community dish,
all there should share in smoking this joint dedicated to peace and friendship.
The Game board is the same size as an open Double Album
(The same type of album used for cleaning pot in the old days!) and folds in
half for easy storage.  The background of
the board is space themed with pictures of cool space objects and psychedelic
gas cloud formations. The squares make a winding track, similar to the type
used in “Chutes and Ladders.”  Many
squares are repeated, like “Roll-A-Bong” and some only occur once like “Roll a
Joint.”
Players have a choice of the Token they use for playing
pieces, but additional tokens are available for purchase.  The game comes with 2 six sided dice, a game
board and simple instructions.

story:
Demo

Here's a webplayer demo: WEBPLAYER DEMO
Keep in mind that the game is meant for standalone, and not for a browser. Some settings may not work correctly and overall the performance and gameplay won't be as good. 
I recommend you do the tutorial first.

The Game

Laevis is a first person game where, for the majority of the time, movement is controlled by swinging. You are able to control yourself on air by pulling towards or pushing yourself away from the contact point on an object, and through general use of physics.

At its current stage, there are 3 skills, 2 power ups and a propelling boost that you can use both in singleplayer and multiplayer.

Multiplayer is fully functional with the ability to chat, create private or public rooms, view and join rooms in 4 different locations as shown (EU, US, Asia, Japan).

There is currently only one game mode, where teams (and teamless) fight for capture and control of objectives.

The player models, for the moment, are mask-shaped beings.

In the future, if funded, I would like to create more maps, game modes, skills and power ups, as per feedback.

The Development

I apologize for the video quality, I understand it's pretty bad in this day and age. All of the recording was done by myself, and unfortunately I only own an old laptop that can't run and record concurrently at a good quality, which also hasn't helped development.

The funding would be mostly to support the game development (and myself), pay for the necessary licenses, and upgrade the multiplayer servers capacity on release.

    Risks & Challenges

    I don't have a specific deadline to meet but everything seen here was done in about a month or so, on and off. If funded, I will continue to develop the game with feedback from those interested.

    FAQ

    • What platforms will Laevis be on?
    Laevis will be available on PC, Mac and Linux if the primary funding goal of €2500 is met.
    • Will I get the game when it's released?
    If you have pledged €5 or more, you will receive all future betas AND the full version of the game on Steam. Betas will hopefully be available on Steam's Early Access once and if Laevis is greenlit.
    • Where can I track progress?

    - Patchnotes: pastebin.com/kanTRVrA

    - Twitter: twitter.com/phdo_

    - Email: mail.phdo@gmail.com

story:
Bukkake! takes a classic fetish and turns it into a fun card game that mixes strategy and luck.  It's weird, addictive, and makes for a very interesting game night.

Is This An Adult Game?

Sort of.  While the theme of the game is clearly sexual, that's about as far as we take it.  None of the cards are pornographic—all imagery is euphemistic.  For example, the genital named "the spicy pepper" is just an image of a chili pepper.  The only exception is the vagina card, which depicts an anatomy textbook-style vagina.  It's not pornographic.  We felt society is underinformed about female anatomy and wanted to educate in a weird way.

We didn't want to make an erotic or pornographic game, but rather an unusual one that's a lot of fun and inspires some strange yet hilarious party conversations.  That said, this game definitely contains adult themes.  Think of it more as an adult game like Cards Against Humanity is an adult game.  It's not really appropriate for kids, but it's by no means intended to arouse anyone.

Gameplay


How to Play Bukkake!
Bukkake's gameplay is pretty straightforward.  Every player picks a genital card at random to begin the game. Each card has three values: RANK, which determines who goes in the circle first, STROKES, which determines how many strokes you need to ejaculate and PRODUCTION, which determines how much cum you produce with each ejaculation. The remaining cards are stroke and bonus cards. Six cards from the deck are dealt to each player, and the rest form the ‘draw’ pile. 

The player with the lowest rank starts in the middle of the circle, and everyone tries to cum on them to get them out of the game. A player is ‘out’ as soon as they acquire fifteen pieces of cum. The player inside the circle is also trying to cum on someone outside the circle, in order to get out of the middle and put an end to the milky shower.

Every player must always have six cards in their hand. On their turn, a player must play one stroke card and, if they choose, one bonus card. In order to cum, they must reach the ‘strokes’ number on their genital. As they can only play one card per turn, they may require multiple turns to reach the exact number. Alternatively, they can play a higher stroke card and ‘overstimulate’. This means that they have made their genital prohibitively sensitive and must skip a turn after they cum. At the end of their turn, they draw from the pile in order to restore their hand to six cards.

Once the player in the center has managed to ‘cum’ out, someone else must take their place in the middle. This is the player with the lowest rank less the number of cum chips they’ve acquired. For example, Thor’s Hammer has a rank of 10.  If Thor had collected nine pieces of cum, however, his or her rank would be reduced to a measly 1. Some cards have a rank of * [star] which means they are protected and can never start in the center. However, once they have been cum upon, their total is 0 less the amount of cum chips, which means they can easily end up in the middle. Note: any player departing the circle post-orgasm cannot immediately return, even if they have the lowest rank.

When only two players remain, a jerk-off commences. To win, they must achieve the perfect orgasm: they cannot overstimulate. Any bonus cards, such as the ‘instant orgasm’, can be used, and the first player to ejaculate wins the game.

How Bonus Cards Work

Instant Orgasm Cards are played in place of a Stroke Card and allow any player to cum immediately.

Condom Cards can be placed on any player to stop their next orgasm. They must then ejaculate in order to remove it, and can overstroke in order to achieve this goal without losing a turn.

Buddy Stroke Cards allow any player to jerk off any other player.  For example, if you want to induce orgasm from another player’s genital, you can play the Buddy Stroke Card along with a regular stroke card of the necessary value.  This move allows you to use another’s genitals that can produce more cum than yours, helping you expedite the bukkake process.  If you overstroke your buddy, they will still become overstimulated and lose a turn.  Use this move strategically.

Butt Plug Cards can be played in conjunction with Stroke Cards or Instant Orgasm Cards to produce twice the volume of cum a player’s genital would normally produce.

Towel Cards allow any player to wipe off all their cum and start anew.  If they are in the center of the circle, however, they must still ejaculate in order to leave.

Note: A a gameplay video will be added to this section later on in the campaign so you can see it all in action.

What's in the Box

The official Bukkake! card game comes with 108 playing cards.  There are 90 stroke cards, 10 bonus cards, and 8 genital cards.  All are printed in full color on playing card stock.

The game also includes 35 cum chips, which are white plastic circles in the regular game but backers who contribute $75 or more and choose an applicable reward will get a deluxe set of printed cardboard chips.  These will feature a more, let's say, orgasmic design and denote values on each one to allow for cleaner gameplay.

Here are the genitals you'll find in the game:

  • Little Micro: The little micropenis that could.  It can come every turn, and can't end up in the middle of the circle by default.  It's small, but it packs a punch.
  • Miss Puss: Your (better than) average vagina.  It can't become overstimulated because it's tougher than a penis.  It takes a reasonable amount of effort to make it come, and it can't end up in the middle of the circle by default.
  • Spicy Pepper: Not the biggest penis you'll encounter, but capable nevertheless.
  • No. 2 Pencil: Often the first in the circle, but it produces a fair amount of cum with very little effort.
  • Chode: Short but thick.  Most people ignore the Chode because it seems mostly harmless, but its average stats make it easy enough to get off and remarkably useful when combined with the right bonuses.
  • Frankfurter: Your standard bigger-than-average penis.  
  • Beer Can: The beer can requires the most work of any of the genitals, but it yields a powerful ejaculation.
  • Thor's Hammer: The biggest penis of them all.  It takes a lot of work to get it off, but it can nearly knock a player out of the game if it does.

Note: Backers who receive a printable PDF will only be able to print the 108 cards.  Cum chips will have to be acquired separately.

What's in the Expansion Pack

We couldn't fit everything we wanted into the standard game so we made an expansion pack that includes an additional 52 cards.  There are 40 standard stroke cards, 6 new genital cards with exciting new gameplay options, and 6 new bonus cards to shake things up a bit.

Genitals you'll find in the expansion pack:

  • Cucumber: It requires very little stimulation to achieve a fairly large orgasm, but has the lowest rank of the game and may spend much of it in the center of the circle.
  • Speed Stroker: The speed stroker never takes long to get off and produces a reasonable amount of cum with each ejaculation.  Additionally, every time another play rubs one out it comes a little, too.
  • The Yardstick: A penis so long it takes more than just one turn to come.
  • Mum's Glovebox: An elegant vagina that takes a little more work to get off but ejaculates more than your standard variety.  It, of course, has the same protections and abilities as all vagina cards: it can't be placed in the middle by default and it cannot become overstimulated.
  • Double Dick: Two dicks are better than one!  Both have the same rank and production value, but can ejaculate with a different number of strokes.
  • Intersex: Why settle for male or female anatomy when you can have both?  The intersex card gives you the power of a standard penis and vagina.  You can choose which one you want to use with each turn.

Bonus cards you'll find in the expansion pack:

  • Voyeur: Become a voyeur and skip a turn.  Not only does this allow you to avoid playing a stroke card and draw a new one, but you also get to watch from the corner where nobody can come on you for an entire round.
  • Premature Ejaculation: Come with just half the strokes your genital requires!
  • Bukkake: This card causes every player in the outside circle to produce one unit of cum.  For example, if there are eight players in the game, seven units would be produced as the person in the center produces nothing but receives the bounty from the group.

About the Creators

We're Adam Dachis and Erica Elson, roommates and writing partners.  We enjoy game nights but exhausted our favorites and wanted something new.  As a result, Bukkake! was born.

While this is our first card game, we've made a lot of other things.  Most recently, we finished writing a book called the Awkward Human Survival Guide that'll be released in April.  We're also working on a movie.  I (Adam) am a writer for Lifehacker, which has absolutely nothing to do with this game but has required me to know a thing or two about crowd funded campaigns.

story:
This is a story of how are the laws of physics broken

Don't have an Oculus Rift? Don't worry, this game works on regular screen as well!

Enter a world where the reality itself is deteriorating. A mysterious infection is spreading through the Solar System, breaking down the laws of physics and taking away the consistency of world around them.

Humanity has abandoned Earth and built HeLiOs, an enormous station submerged under the surface of the Sun. A temporary refuge where they urgently try to find the secrets behind the reality splinters. You must make sense of the volatile world you have been thrown in, as things can change by simply looking away, and survive long enough to unveil its mystery and save humanity.

SightLine is a sci-fi story driven, environmental action puzzle game, based on our award winning prototype from the 2013 Indiecade VR Jam. With unique core gameplay mechanics designed to craft a surreal and unique experience, Sightline will be far from reality you are familiar with.

How do you play?

SightLine is a game you play by looking. The moment an object leaves your line of sight it can change into something else. The whole scene around you can completely transform by simply turning around. To survive in such world, you need to be looking at the right place in the right time or averting your eyes when the situation calls for it.

You will be able to utilize a variety of tools to help you cope with this world, from simple things such as a flashlight, hand mirror or binoculars, to more complex items such as 3D holographic cameras or light spectrum filters. No moment in SightLine will be the same, and you'll have to constantly figure out what's going on.

What’s the storyline?

While the narration of surreal segments is poetic and philosophical, the storyline unveiling aboard the HeLiOs is rooted in solid reality and proper reasoning. A striking contrast between fuzzy poetry and hard sci-fi, yet more connected than you might think.

The volatile nature of the world of SightLine allows for unique style of storytelling, covering broad spectre of topics, themes and environments, throwing you into deadly situations only to make them vanish like there was never even a sign of threat.

SightLine strives to keep you guessing what’s going on right until the end, not knowing what’s real. Is there some reality behind the dream-like worlds? Are there just illusions on the star station? Support the game and you will know!

How it started?

SightLine started as a prototype developed for a 3 week VR jam held by Oculus Rift and IndieCade by Tomáš Mariančík - a hobbyist developer - with the help of Ondřej Pultar and Julian Ceipek, who provided music and narration respectively.

Thanks to the very positive feedback from the Oculus & IndieCade judges, but also other developers and players, SightLine is now on a track to become a fully fledged game. By supporting the development you not only help us bring a polished unique experience to you, but also turning passionate hobby into a full time work.

Download and play the prototype yourself!

The prototype is freely available, both in VR and on the computer screen, so you can try the game concept for yourself! Give it a try!

Download SightLine Playground (NEW!)

SightLine Playground is a new mini-demo created to test the new framework upon which is the full game going to be built and also serves as demonstration of the basic principles of the game.

Download for: Windows | Mac | Linux

What’s planned for the full version?

The prototype tests only the basic concept on a few ideas and scenes. We plan to vastly expand the game mechanics and storyline, so there's a lot you can look forward to:

  • Full Sci-Fi Story: Onboard the star station HeLiOs, the mystery behind the seemingly nonsensical behavior of the world and broken laws of physics will be revealed and explained in a rational way with many references to real science.
  • New Expanded Game Mechanics: We're building many more puzzles around the concept of lacking object permanence and plan to utilize specific angles of your gaze as well.
  • New Tool System: To get through SightLine and its environments, you will have to use a variety of tools (hand mirrors, flashlights, even a simple cardboard box to hide things in!) to progress.
  • Better Visuals: The graphics in the prototype were patched quickly from combination of self-made models and free assets. Thanks to your funding we can bring aboard skilled graphic designers to give SightLine its own unique visuals to please your eyes.
  • High Quality Audio: The prototype suffers from lower quality audio due to time restrictions of the VR jam. With the funding voice actors will be paid and higher quality audio equipment used. The full version will also continue to feature interactive music that changes as you play through the game to give you the feel of whole orchestra following your actions!
  • Action Scenes: SightLine won't feature only bizarre puzzles. You'll have to defend yourself and neutralize variety of enemies. By using similarly bizarre methods of course :)

Supported platforms

The full version of the game will support at least following platforms out of the box:

Windows, Mac OS X and Linux (x86/64)

Support for other platforms might be added as well thanks to multi-platform magic of the Unity, however cannot be guaranteed at this point.

Supported devices

SightLine is developed primarily as a VR experience, but it will be playable on on regular screen as well (with certain head controls "emulated" through keyboard and mouse). Using Oculus Rift however is recommended for maximum immersion, but if you don't have one, you can still play the game as you would any other.

Following devices will be supported out of the box, more can be added later:

  • Oculus Rift
  • Virtuix Omni: alternative for movement
  • CastAR with VR clip-on: alternative to Oculus
  • Regular computer screen: Head-tracking controls emulated with keyboard/mouse/game-pad

What are others saying?

SightLine received quite positive feedback from the players and won 3rd place in the open call category of the VR jam held by Oculus and IndieCade. Here are some things people said:

Oculus & IndieCade VR Jam

SightLine is a 3rd place winner in the three week VR jam held by Oculus and IndieCade! Here's what the judges had to say

Sight Line was a contender due to the interesting way gaze direction is used as a game-play mechanic. Beyond just changing the world depending on where you look for dramatic effect, the game actually uses player gaze as a game-play element to solve puzzles and interact with the world. Coupled with an interesting metaphysical theme, Sight Line stood out amongst other VR Jam entries.

IGN

In an IGN article by Craig Pearson, SightLine was named as one of 10 games, that will make you want an Oculus Rift - a big honor to the game. Here's an excerpt of what he had to say:

Sight Line realises unreality in the best possible way, keeping track of your gaze and allowing things to happen just out of sight, creating a world that can change in the blink of an eye or the turning of your head.

Players, Reviewers & Community

SightLine was also positively received by other players and reviewers. Here are just some of the things they had to say:

VR Brotherhood: SightLine on the Oculus Rift! A Quantum Experience

Wow, that was absolutely amazing. Those experiences right there is what virtual reality is all about. Um... I'm lost for words. That was... *gestures mind-blowing*
Okay, so this is the kind of experience I want to have on the Oculus Rift. This is the kind of experience that's not possible without this type of technology. You know, as much as it's fun to get shit scared of you at a horror game, you know, I don't feel like I'm really gaining anything from that kind of experience.

AlongCameJosh: Oculus Rift - SightLine MINDFREAK GAME + FACECAM

That was pretty cool. That game was really creative and interesting. Oh man, it just so beats a horror game.
It's like a dream almost. It's like a bad dream, but also good dream. In the way that those spikes were going to get me and it's like look down and look up and it changed into a fan and I look down and the floor was fine. It's just so cool! They need to do more stuff like this, it's so cool and innovative.

emart: Mind Blown in SIGHTLINE on the Oculus Rift: Full Playthrough

That was awesome. Way cooler than I expected it to be. I remember seeing trailers for it and I was like... eh looks alright. Yeah, way cool, if you have a Rift and you haven't played this game yet, I'd recommend it. I'm sure a lot of you already played it, but it's about time I already did, because that was cool. I kinda already said it, it's trippy, it's awesome. Thumbs up for me, I think it's great.

What are the funds needed for?

Developing a polished game requires a lot of passion and time. And while we have more than enough of the first, the second is much more scarce resource. By pledging you enable us to work on title full time and set the ball rolling on the development of SightLine.

  • Graphic Artists
  • Voice Actors
  • Licensing costs for other assets and tools used to build the game
  • Living costs
  • Fulfilling the perks

Main Goal

However our plan is to get the development rolling and aquire more funds along the way, to bring you even better and more richer experience, by building a fanbase for this game. We're people who work on this out of passion, which is why we need your help.

Stretch Goals

Want to read blogs, tweets of the people living there? Or maybe read a reviews of products that won't be on the market at least for hundred years!

Pledge

Financial support will help us significantly to get the project going and find more talented people to help us build a high quality experience. And you of course get digital download of the game! If you can spare a little bit more money, you can pick a higher pledge and get a special reward in addition to the game itself. Check out the rewards on the right!





Note: The T-Shirt designs are preliminary. If there's enough pledges for shirts you'll be able to select from multiple designs!

If you're feeling especially generous, you can even appear in the game itself in some way as a reward! We offer small and large in game appearances. Small appearance can be anything, like a personal object, picture, sound or some model you made that will be placed as a decoration either somewhere on the star station HeLiOs or within the volatile dream-like segments. It can be also reference to a project of your own!

The large appearance gets you more vivid presence: for example as voiced NPC on the Sun station HeLiOs, interactive display or even a whole room or astand: Have your own shop, news stand, "street" art performance or become crazy prophet on board of the HeLiOs!

Your options aren't restricted to the examples provided, but in case you consider this pledge, we recommend asking first to make sure it'll be accepted or if any modifications will be done.

To ensure high quality of the end product, alpha and beta testers are needed to catch all the pesky bugs and also provide feedback on playability, difficulty of challenges and places where players might get stuck. You'll also be able to make videos of the progress of all the new stuff before everyone else and generate some buzz!

If you want to help us out, grab the alpha access perk to get access to frequent development builds (any higher perk also grants you alpha access). And there's something in it for you as well: Your name will be in the credits of the game as a thanks for your exceptional support!

Of course if you don’t like spoilers and prefer to play the whole game in one go you should probably wait for the full version.

The more people know about the game and campaign the better, so share with everyone you know and even with people you don’t know! story_txt:
This is a story of how are the laws of physics broken

Don't have an Oculus Rift? Don't worry, this game works on regular screen as well!

Enter a world where the reality itself is deteriorating. A mysterious infection is spreading through the Solar System, breaking down the laws of physics and taking away the consistency of world around them.
Humanity has abandoned Earth and built HeLiOs, an enormous station submerged under the surface of the Sun. A temporary refuge where they urgently try to find the secrets behind the reality splinters. You must make sense of the volatile world you have been thrown in, as things can change by simply looking away, and survive long enough to unveil its mystery and save humanity.
SightLine is a sci-fi story driven, environmental action puzzle game, based on our award winning prototype from the 2013 Indiecade VR Jam. With unique core gameplay mechanics designed to craft a surreal and unique experience, Sightline will be far from reality you are familiar with.
How do you play?
SightLine is a game you play by looking. The moment an object leaves your line of sight it can change into something else. The whole scene around you can completely transform by simply turning around. To survive in such world, you need to be looking at the right place in the right time or averting your eyes when the situation calls for it.
You will be able to utilize a variety of tools to help you cope with this world, from simple things such as a flashlight, hand mirror or binoculars, to more complex items such as 3D holographic cameras or light spectrum filters. No moment in SightLine will be the same, and you'll have to constantly figure out what's going on.
What’s the storyline?
While the narration of surreal segments is poetic and philosophical, the storyline unveiling aboard the HeLiOs is rooted in solid reality and proper reasoning. A striking contrast between fuzzy poetry and hard sci-fi, yet more connected than you might think.
The volatile nature of the world of SightLine allows for unique style of storytelling, covering broad spectre of topics, themes and environments, throwing you into deadly situations only to make them vanish like there was never even a sign of threat. 
SightLine strives to keep you guessing what’s going on right until the end, not knowing what’s real. Is there some reality behind the dream-like worlds? Are there just illusions on the star station? Support the game and you will know! 
How it started?
SightLine started as a prototype developed for a 3 week VR jam held by Oculus Rift and IndieCade by Tomáš Mariančík - a hobbyist developer - with the help of Ondřej Pultar and Julian Ceipek, who provided music and narration respectively.

Thanks to the very positive feedback from the Oculus & IndieCade judges, but also other developers and players, SightLine is now on a track to become a fully fledged game. By supporting the development you not only help us bring a polished unique experience to you, but also turning passionate hobby into a full time work.
Download and play the prototype yourself!
The prototype is freely available, both in VR and on the computer screen, so you can try the game concept for yourself! Give it a try!


Download SightLine Playground (NEW!)

SightLine Playground is a new mini-demo created to test the new framework upon which is the full game going to be built and also serves as demonstration of the basic principles of the game.

Download for: 
Windows |
Mac |
Linux

What’s planned for the full version?
The prototype tests only the basic concept on a few ideas and scenes. We plan to vastly expand the game mechanics and storyline, so there's a lot you can look forward to:


Full Sci-Fi Story: Onboard the star station HeLiOs, the mystery behind the seemingly nonsensical behavior of the world and broken laws of physics will be revealed and explained in a rational way with many references to real science.

New Expanded Game Mechanics: We're building many more puzzles around the concept of lacking object permanence and plan to utilize specific angles of your gaze as well.

New Tool System: To get through SightLine and its environments, you will have to use a variety of tools (hand mirrors, flashlights, even a simple cardboard box to hide things in!) to progress.

Better Visuals: The graphics in the prototype were patched quickly from combination of self-made models and free assets. Thanks to your funding we can bring aboard skilled graphic designers to give SightLine its own unique visuals to please your eyes.

High Quality Audio: The prototype suffers from lower quality audio due to time restrictions of the VR jam. With the funding voice actors will be paid and higher quality audio equipment used. The full version will also continue to feature interactive music that changes as you play through the game to give you the feel of whole orchestra following your actions!

Action Scenes: SightLine won't feature only bizarre puzzles. You'll have to defend yourself and neutralize variety of enemies. By using similarly bizarre methods of course :)
Supported platforms
The full version of the game will support at least following platforms out of the box:

Windows, Mac OS X and Linux (x86/64)

Support for other platforms might be added as well thanks to multi-platform magic of the Unity, however cannot be guaranteed at this point.
Supported devices
SightLine is developed primarily as a VR experience, but it will be playable on on regular screen as well (with certain head controls "emulated" through keyboard and mouse). Using Oculus Rift however is recommended for maximum immersion, but if you don't have one, you can still play the game as you would any other.



Following devices will be supported out of the box, more can be added later:

Oculus Rift

Virtuix Omni: alternative for movement

CastAR with VR clip-on: alternative to Oculus

Regular computer screen: Head-tracking controls emulated with keyboard/mouse/game-pad
What are others saying?
SightLine received quite positive feedback from the players and won 3rd place in the open call category of the VR jam held by Oculus and IndieCade. Here are some things people said:

Oculus & IndieCade VR Jam
SightLine is a 3rd place winner in the three week VR jam held by Oculus and IndieCade! Here's what the judges had to say
Sight Line was a contender due to the interesting way gaze direction is used as a game-play mechanic. Beyond just changing the world depending on where you look for dramatic effect, the game actually uses player gaze as a game-play element to solve puzzles and interact with the world. Coupled with an interesting metaphysical theme, Sight Line stood out amongst other VR Jam entries.
IGN
In an IGN article by Craig Pearson, SightLine was named as one of 10 games, that will make you want an Oculus Rift - a big honor to the game. Here's an excerpt of what he had to say:
Sight Line realises unreality in the best possible way, keeping track of your gaze and allowing things to happen just out of sight, creating a world that can change in the blink of an eye or the turning of your head.
Players, Reviewers & Community
SightLine was also positively received by other players and reviewers. Here are just some of the things they had to say:
VR Brotherhood: SightLine on the Oculus Rift! A Quantum Experience
Wow, that was absolutely amazing. Those experiences right there is what virtual reality is all about. Um... I'm lost for words. That was... *gestures mind-blowing*
Okay, so this is the kind of experience I want to have on the Oculus Rift. This is the kind of experience that's not possible without this type of technology. You know, as much as it's fun to get shit scared of you at a horror game, you know, I don't feel like I'm really gaining anything from that kind of experience.

AlongCameJosh: Oculus Rift - SightLine MINDFREAK GAME + FACECAM
That was pretty cool. That game was really creative and interesting. Oh man, it just so beats a horror game.
It's like a dream almost. It's like a bad dream, but also good dream. In the way that those spikes were going to get me and it's like look down and look up and it changed into a fan and I look down and the floor was fine. It's just so cool! They need to do more stuff like this, it's so cool and innovative.

emart: Mind Blown in SIGHTLINE on the Oculus Rift: Full Playthrough
That was awesome. Way cooler than I expected it to be. I remember seeing trailers for it and I was like... eh looks alright. Yeah, way cool, if you have a Rift and you haven't played this game yet, I'd recommend it. I'm sure a lot of you already played it, but it's about time I already did, because that was cool. I kinda already said it, it's trippy, it's awesome. Thumbs up for me, I think it's great.

What are the funds needed for?
Developing a polished game requires a lot of passion and time. And while we have more than enough of the first, the second is much more scarce resource. By pledging you enable us to work on title full time and set the ball rolling on the development of SightLine.

Graphic Artists
Voice Actors
Licensing costs for other assets and tools used to build the game
Living costs

story:
What do I need the money for?

I am raising money for a new PC. Financial stability in my family doesn't exist anymore and my work depends on me having access to a personal computer. I am a web developer, I earn money by creating websites.

Recently my CPU started to behave in an odd way. It's almost non-functional at this point. I have to disable one of its cores to make it even run. Considering that my system is about eight years old I believe that these are the signs of a slow death of this computer system. I have to work with half of the speed I am able to work at, thus earning half the money.

I am in an extremely disadvantageous financial situation.

My sister is disabled and at the same time she is forced to work part-time to be able to pay for her rent. My brother has debt that he is paying back abroad and my mom is slowly becoming too old to work.

At this point it's impossible for me to buy a new PC, and that is the only way I am able to earn money here (I need a high salary to keep my family going).

The harsh fact behind all of this is - as soon as I get out of this financial deadlock I will be able to earn enough money to sustain everybody in my family. It will solve almost all of our problems and I will be able to take care of my disabled sister till the end of her days. One PC is standing between me and this possibility.

You might ask - why is this campaign about helping a GAME developer?

This is because I am also a talented programmer. I used to create small games for children that couldn't afford any. I am working with children very often, I love seeing them smile. This is one of the ways I am able to make a lot of them happy, a way for me to give something out to this world.


I tried to keep the goal reasonable.


I don't want an all-powerful PC. I want one that will be capable of fast-paced work and a medium CPU demand from all the software required to create games.

I just can't go any longer with my current computer system. This is a very hard choice for me, I never wanted to ask for money but now it seems I do not have a choice.

story:
Overview

In Legendary battlegrounds you take the role of a hero summoned by the king to defeat the mysterious evil that terrorises the kingdom.

Unique Characters

There are 3 races, each with 10 characters to choose from.

  • Humans
  • Creatures
  • Wild Beasts 

Each character has its own animations and 5 unique skills. 

Depending on a character's role, they can wear either Light or Heavy armour.

The highest level a character can reach is 50.

Every time a character levels up, you gain a skill point which you can spend on the skill tree to become stronger. Once you reach the maximum level, you can either work on getting the strongest equipment or unlock new characters.

World

The game will feature a large instance based world where players can freely join or leave rooms as they wish, even during battles. 


Over 80 maps and 8 special dungeon maps.

Fight over 100 different enemies and fearsome bosses.


Gear

Each character can wield one of the 7 different weapon types.

Gather rare items from the enemies you defeat and make the best gear with the advanced enchanting system!

While all weapons affect a character's visual look, armours don't. However, there are special costumes that do change a character's appearance.

Combat

Legendary Battlegrounds has fast paced turn based combat. Fight alone or cooperate with up to 3 other players and show your teamwork skills. Make your team the best by choosing the right character combinations to defeat various bosses.
In combat, you can perform actions only when it's your turn. During your turn, you can choose to:

1) Use an ordinary attack
2) Perform a strong attack
3) Use a skill, which requires energy
4) Use consumable items
5) Use the retreat function if you think that you're about to lose. (But be careful, the retreat only has a 50% chance of succeeding).

After defeating a group of enemies, you will run further and fight the next group. 
At the end of the instance, a boss may await you.

But remember that each character has its own strengths and weaknesses.

Support characters should stay back, while tank characters should be in front.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Budget Breakdown

Risks & Challenges

Building a large and fun turn based MMORPG is a challenge for a small team. For this reason we are using Unity, which gives us more freedom and flexibility.

_____________________________________________________________________________

FAQ

*Is this game free to play?

Yes.

*How big is your team?

We are four people: a designer, an artist and two programmers.

*Where will I be able to play this game?

Legendary Battlegrounds will playable on browsers and mobile phones.

*When will the game be released?

The beta in spring 2015, and the official release in fall 2015.

*Will there be PvP?

Yes, players will be able to fight against each other.

story:
Who We Are

We are Pig Dog Games, a small indie startup comprised of 5 core members with 12+ years of combined development experience. We've shipped multiple titles for studios like Sony Online, Namco, Electronic Arts, and Rocketeer Games. Our focus is making AAA titles for PC, MAC and console.  We've worked for some of the biggest studios and have now decided to plant our own flag and build a small indie studio for our third person shooter project "The Misfits".

We've been working on this game for two years, remotely, after work hours, with zero budget and a tremendous amount of coffee. We'd love to start our own studio one day and quit our day jobs to work full-time on The Misfits.

The Misfits Game

 

We have eight themed arenas planned for Steam release. Each uniquely themed location contains elevated sections, streamlined multiple paths and secondary routes to promote game play experience. Our goal is to have no wasted game play space. Arenas include the following:

  • Palawan (Island)
  • Dragons Back (Desert)
  • City Station (Light Rail City Themed)
  • Plaza Station (Outdoor Mall)
  • The Bog (Swamp)
  • Lucky Dice (Casino)
  • BT Construction Site (Construction)
  • ​TBD

 

 

  • Contract Killers 2 Team TDM: Eliminate players for cash to gain bonuses. The higher you streak, the bigger the bounty is on your head.
  • Contract Wars 4 Team TDM: Eliminate players for cash to gain bonuses. The higher you streak, the bigger the bounty is on your head.
  • Head Hunter 2 Team VIP: Eliminate VIP's and players to increase your team's total cash score.
  • Head Hunters 4 Team VIP: Eliminate VIP's and players to increase your team's total cash score.
  • Blood Bank: The object of this game mode is to kill enemies, pick up their cash and return the cash to one of the timed banks when they become available. The team with the most cash banked wins the match.
  • Cash Grab: Grab randomly spawned cash bags and dropped cash from enemy kills and return it to your bank. The team with the most cash wins.
  • King Of The Bill: Accumulate as much cash as you can at key objectives and deposit your cash at timed banks when they become available.

 

 

  • Assault
  • SMG
  • Shotgun 
  • Mini-Gun
  • Sniper
  • Pistol
  • Grenade Launcher
  • Grenade
  • Proximity Mines
  • Tesla Cannon
  • Health Pickup
  • Ammo Pickup
  • ​Mystery Boxes
     

 

We have three player classes in this game. Light, Medium and Heavy to allow for multiple playing styles and tactial advantages for team play.

  • Light: Extremely agile, equipped with a double barrel shotgun with weak health percentage.
  • Medium: Balanced quick, equipped with an SMG and very formidable.
  • Heavy: Slower, equipped with an LMG and has a higher health percentage.




  • Day/Night Cycle
  • Destructibles
  • Jump
  • Slide
  • Sprint
  • Crouch
  • Lean
  • ​Quick Climb

Funding is really the key to these stretch goals. If we are able to secure additional funding beyond our funding goal, we will be able to hire on key staff for additional programming, concept art, and audio design.

  • AI / Bots Programming
  • Animation/FX Creation
  • Character/Level Audio Integration
  • UI/UX Integration
  • Additional Gamemodes (including survival mode)
  • Additional Environments
  • Boosts: Armor, Jump boots, Speed, Gadgets, etc...
  • Localization for various countries (Japan, Germany, Brazil, Mexico etc...)
  • Syndicate Integration (Clan integration)
  • Meta Game Faction Integration
  • ​Console Release (Xbox One, PS4, Facebook Gameroom)

 

Game Play Trailer

story_txt:
Who We Are
We are Pig Dog Games, a small indie startup comprised of 5 core members with 12+ years of combined development experience. We've shipped multiple titles for studios like Sony Online, Namco, Electronic Arts, and Rocketeer Games. Our focus is making AAA titles for PC, MAC and console.  We've worked for some of the biggest studios and have now decided to plant our own flag and build a small indie studio for our third person shooter project "The Misfits".
We've been working on this game for two years, remotely, after work hours, with zero budget and a tremendous amount of coffee. We'd love to start our own studio one day and quit our day jobs to work full-time on The Misfits.
The Misfits Game
 

We have eight themed arenas planned for Steam release. Each uniquely themed location contains elevated sections, streamlined multiple paths and secondary routes to promote game play experience. Our goal is to have no wasted game play space. Arenas include the following:

Palawan (Island)
Dragons Back (Desert)
City Station (Light Rail City Themed)
Plaza Station (Outdoor Mall)
The Bog (Swamp)
Lucky Dice (Casino)
BT Construction Site (Construction)
​TBD



 
 



Contract Killers 2 Team TDM: Eliminate players for cash to gain bonuses. The higher you streak, the bigger the bounty is on your head.

Contract Wars 4 Team TDM: Eliminate players for cash to gain bonuses. The higher you streak, the bigger the bounty is on your head.

Head Hunter 2 Team VIP: Eliminate VIP's and players to increase your team's total cash score.

Head Hunters 4 Team VIP: Eliminate VIP's and players to increase your team's total cash score.

Blood Bank: The object of this game mode is to kill enemies, pick up their cash and return the cash to one of the timed banks when they become available. The team with the most cash banked wins the match.

Cash Grab: Grab randomly spawned cash bags and dropped cash from enemy kills and return it to your bank. The team with the most cash wins.

King Of The Bill: Accumulate as much cash as you can at key objectives and deposit your cash at timed banks when they become available.

Mini-Gun

Grenade

​Mystery Boxes 


 

We have three player classes in this game. Light, Medium and Heavy to allow for multiple playing styles and tactial advantages for team play.


Light: Extremely agile, equipped with a double barrel shotgun with weak health percentage.

Medium: Balanced quick, equipped with an SMG and very formidable.

Heavy: Slower, equipped with an LMG and has a higher health percentage.

story:
Why are you involved with games? What are the specific features that make you love or hate a game?

What emotional bonds did you establish with games? What life lessons would you leave for others?


We asked these questions to developers, journalists, academics, critics and really anyone involved with games and game culture. Then we gathered the answers in a zine: the Glitch Gazette!


“Surely there is some reason you are going through all the the trouble of trying to design great games” - Jesse Schell, The Art of Game Design


Glitch Gazette will be available for Windows/Mac/Linux as a part zine / part exploration non-game, It will be a reflexive read illustrated by GIFs with atmospheric soundtrack. And to those who prefer a physical medium, the Glitch Gazette will be a printed book too, only with a different visual from the app.

The objective here is to gather material from 90 different people, from all around the world. We already have the answers from:

  • Adam “ATOMIC” Saltsman (Canabalt, Flixel, Finji)
  • “Rezoner” Przemyslaw Sikorski (QbQbQB, Jameson the Pilot, Hotline Trail)
  • Sophie Houlden (There Shall Be Lancing, Swift*Switch, Linear RPG)
  • Joel Couture (Indie Game Mag)
  • Martin Jonasson (rymdkapsel, MRS. DAD vs. KÖRV, tektonik)
  • Danilo Dias (Oniken, Odallus)
  • Glauber Kotaki (Rogue Legacy, Chasm, Duelyst)
  • Amora Bettany (Towerfall, Out There Somewhere, Deep Dungeons of Doom)
  • Roger Tavares (professor and academic researcher in culture and video games)
  • Jay Santos (Field Engineer at Unity Technologies)
+30 others


  • 80 answers to the questions: “Why do you make (or are involved with) games?” and “Your personal advice for future generations”. They go all the way from profound and personal to absurd and surreal.
  • 34 essays about emotional and professional bonds between the authors and a game picked up by them. Drama! Childhood! Joy and Pain!
  • Lounge Glitch soundtrack composed by William Poletto
  • Cool illustrations/GIFs by Camila Torrano, José Osmar (and some by me too, but that’s not important) and other guest artists!

Jill Valentine, by Camila Torrano

Chrono Trigger, by José Osmar
  • HTML5 app that runs on almost every device. Read it online via web or offline via app! Windows/Mac/Linux/iOS/Android
  • A ton of secrets. Click everything!
  • A 100-page book
  • Bilingual! The app will feature Brazillian Portuguese and English languages! (The book will be only br in English, because of space issues)

Download the public demo and try it out here!
http://loudnoises.itch.io/glitch-gazette

Digital zine app! In HTML5, Windows, Linux and Mac.

Digital PDF eBook and a 100 page printed book!

More to come...

I am Andre Asai, aka The Boy with the Controller Tattoo, a game developer and new media artist from São Paulo, Brazil, and according to Glauber Kotaki, I'm also a GAME CULTURE PURSUER! I am part of Loud Noises, a gang of gamedevs and also the guy who created the art and game jam event SPjam, and other game related events, like SPIN or the Pack of Horrors. My focus is to create a creative game community around my city and to create small but meaningful games. I tend to focus on the cultural (and weird) side of games and digital art.

My works has been recently exhibited and present at venues like FILE (São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro), A Maze. / Berlin (Berlin), Print Screen Festival (Holon) and MIS-SP (São Paulo).

At the moment, this project is being totally developed by me since September 2014. Indiegogo campaign money will basically go to soundtrack composing, illustrations and professional translation. And as a stretch goal, translation to other languages.

Press? Check our presskit here! (EN) (PT-BR)

story:
What?

Puzzlathon is an idea for a free iPhone Puzzle Game that I came up with in Grade 10. 

I was going through my "idea folder" in Grade 11 (the grade I recently completed) and fell upon this one, which I had forgotten. Recognizing the global appreciation of puzzles and the simple fun that the app would provide, I thought it could work, and decided to build on it. Upon searching to see whether anyone had already taken the idea, I discovered the ASCONN (non-profit organization helping people with Autism) holds an annual real-life puzzle marathon. 

I thought immediately that Puzzlathon could be a mobile year-round global mode of this event. It would not only be popular because of the global puzzle intrigue (which I intend to tap into by developing the app. in English, Mandarin, French, Spanish, German, Korean), but also because people love to compete. I recently though-up and designed an online race mode, as well as possible items that can be used against one's opponent to slow them down. 

Puzzlathon will bring attention to 3 causes; ASCONN's, and two others decided by backers. 50% of the app.'s revenue will go to ASCONN, 20% to a cause chosen by one backer, 10% to a cause chosen by another backer, and 20% will be used by me on future projects/updates (of which I have many ideas for). 

How?

  • I'm in the prime of my youth, have the experience, wisdom, time, and burning passion and ambition to see this come to life.
  • I have bilingual friends who will be willing to translate the app. into the various languages.
  • I have consulted 4 renowned developers, and chosen the best one.
  • I'll use posters, my friends/family, and my Youtube channel to promote Puzzlathon.

             The funds raised will strictly be used for Development costs.

             Funds raised above the goal amount will go towards:

  1. Programming the app in Mandarin, Korean, Spanish, French, & German
  2. Making additional and finer features
  3. Optimizing for iPad and other platforms (android, etc.)

 

Why?

  • ASCONN is a fabulous Conneticut-based non-profit organization that helps Autistic people of all ages: http://www.asconn.org/about-us.php
  • The 2 chosen by you backers will also be well-deserving causes, supported socially and financially through Puzzlathon. 
  • It's going to be super fun for people of all cultures, ages and sexes, autistic or non-autistic. There is a global appreciation of puzzles, and friendly competition. 
  • I want to create awesomeness (and by collaborating with you all, it makes it even more so).  

 

You

         Back :)

I understand some of you can’t, but you can still help out:

Spread the word by using Your Voice, FACEBOOK, Twitter, & the indiegogo share tools

Click the blue LIKE button on this campaign page; I could get on the indiegogo's homepage if there's enough buzz!

story:
8 Bit Annual 2018

8 Bit Annual celebrates the latest game releases in an eye-dazzling 250+ page, full colour annual. Available in PDF, softback and a special edition hardback.

Hundreds of reviews or recent 8-bit games as well as previews of upcoming games. We also talk to the teams behind those games, the programmers as well as the graphics and sound artists.

Created by George Bachaelor and John Kavanagh along with reviews and other retro articles from people active in the 8-bit community. 

What computers and consoles are covered?

The majority of reviews will be for the Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64, MSX and ZX Spectrum. We will be reviewing software for other 8-bit platforms as well, including consoles such as the Sega Master System and Nintendo Entertainment System.

What will you get?  

You will get a full colour, 200+ page annual either in digital format or as a printed publication in softback or even a special hardback edition. Those who support the print editions will get their name in print as a contributor. 

Supports of the swag pledge will receive extra such as game posters, bookmarks and so much more. 

Those will also be tiers for people to inert retro related adverts in the annual.

What will be covered?

Reviews of the latest games for supported 8-bit computers and consoles.

Interviews with many programmers, graphics and audio artists.

We look back to the games of 1985 and forward to upcoming games of 2018 and beyond.

Plus hardware and other gaming articles.

Check out some of the stunning screenshots below.

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to Anatolia 1300 AD, an expandable card game between Byzantine Empire and Turkmens in the 1300's. It will contain about 75 unique scenario, unit, commander, building, attachment and tactic cards. Typical game takes 45-60 minutes. 

Game

The game is played in familiar PvP (Player versus Player) format. It tries to reconstruct the thematic setting between two factions.  Turkmens are more crowded and highly mobile whereas Byzantians are better equipped and supplemented by mercenaries from various tribes.

Each player selects a new scenario card in each turn and they engage in political and military struggles. Players draw and play cards symbolizing commanders, political characters, military units, attachments, buildings and battle tactics to collect victory points. The game has no dice but employs randomization schemes. Limited book keeping is required thus even younger players can take grasp of the game and play surprisingly well. Your younger rival will enjoy great satisfaction when he deploys a sleeping potion upon your hard fighting hero and leaves him with a snoring sound!. Will you able to turn the tide of history?

Future

In the future, we plan to expand this project to a whole line of game composed of two different variants. First variant will be 1-2 player cooperative game in which players will play different Byzantian houses and cooperate to repel attacks of enemy NPC factions such as Latins, Turkmens and Bulgarians. Second variant will be familiar PvP format but with different timeline such as 1200's to drive off Fourth Crusade or 1450's Final Struggle against Mehmed the Conqueror. But before committing more resources, we need to test the waters whether the game will grab enough attention.  

Funding

We set an initial fixed funding amount of 1500 USD. The first phase PvP game is almost ready in Turkish. Most of the illustrations are completed. Some more play testing and card layout is required.  Translation into English, some localization and editorial services will be needed. Funds will be used to pay standing bills and create an arsenal of ideas and illustrations for project expansion.  Game mechanics will also need vast changes for cooperative game.

Perks

Turkish Law requires lots of bureaucratic work to ship commercial stuff to abroad so I will keep perks in Print and Play form for now. Basically for 10 USD, you will get a license to print 1 copy of the PvP game in English which will be emailed to you in pdf format. You can play as you like it or give it as a gift. Other producer level perks are also available and encouraged. 

Since this is a fixed budget project, funds will return to contributors if we don't reach our funding goal.

Even if you cannot contribute for some reason, please spread the word to maybe interested individuals by sharing the campaign link. If you know someone who can help to publish game in US, please contact.  

Thanks for reading. 

İsmail Etem Tezcan

story:
MGSStudios has been making Mods and games for the last 6 years. it started with Killing floor and running a popular mod server  to creating maps for Killingfloor 2 and winning a place in the Grindhouse competition.

Forward on to Epic games release of Robo Recall we released a Locomotion mod which proved extremely popular, so much so we got a small Epic grant for doing so.

We also created many weapon mods and game modes including the Robo Recall Star Wars mod.

We would also like to stipulate that although yes we do use purchased assets along with custom ones within the game, we always change to our preference and extend upon them, creating a VR game which is so detailed and vast is no easy task and currently we are testing on many different spec machines and can report the FPS is very good.

We have added our highly popular locomotion to this game along with some new features adding lots of options for different comfort levels. Also we have started  adding support for 3DRudder.

 

 PLEASE NOTE : THIS IS A VR ONLY TITLE

Cyber Rebellion is a story/mission based game in which you play the role of Kane, an ex security guard just trying to get by, the city and people pose many dangers from the raiders to the CCPD (Cyber city police dept) danger is around every corner. 

The city is run by an organic AI called ED:09 this AI has control over the whole CCPD and anything linked to the grid, it is due to ED:09 you no longer have a home or a job and you want revenge. The only way you will be able to do this is to join the raiders and work your way up until your in a position to take your shot at ending ED:09 and its reign on the city.

Here are just some of the exciting features of Cyber Rebellion

  • High graphic fidelity whilst proving good performance
  • Many weapons to choose from including standard and futuristic
  • A large environment to explore with lots to see and do
  • Plenty of side missions separate from the main story
  • Realistic gun handling and reloading
  • A fully customisable locomotion system
  • Various enemies and robots to shoot
  • and much more

We are extremely excited about this project, we aim to provide a compelling story that is not completed in just a few hours, also with all the side missions adding to play time.

Zombie COOP mode, What could be more fun? Play in various locations against waves of zombies with a friend! (to follow after release.)

We have worked tirelessly on performance, we did not want to sacrifice graphics for performance and have found many ways to keep the game performing well whilst looking great.

We plan to release a dedicated Quest 2 version after the main release as this requires changes due to the Quest 2 hardware capabilities but we will once again aim to have a great looking game and will not provide a rushed release just to get it out there.

Please check our FAQ for a lot more details

 

We will use any funding to support this game, We will be looking to hire, voice actors, AI developers (Although AI is Working to a basic extent) and music composers.

We want this to be the most satisfying Cyber style story VR game to date and believe this is achievable with your help.

Although this game is very far along we believe gaining this funding can make this game something special.

Of course this is not for everyone and not everyone can pledge but you can help us another way, if you like the concept and look of what we are doing help spread the word! 

In addition we will provide a FREE Oculus Quest key for any tier that features a copy of the game, this is ONLY pending acceptance by Oculus and also will come at a slightly later date.(No confirmed date at present)

If we hit the following funding we will implement the following

£10,000 - A Zombie COOP Mode

£11,000 - A Complete custom soundtrack with download links

£20,000 - A complete new city to explore (doubling gameplay)

We want to bring a full Cyberpunk environment to VR, with lots of action and ambience of a cyber city.

We are confident we can fulfil everything we have promised and more. the game currently is playable and even it its current state provides the "wow" factor.

We are not looking to provide a "tech" demo this will be a full game with many hours of gameplay and with a high replay ability value due to the different factions included.

Also to be added at a near future date is a multiplayer Zombie mode, in the city and other areas.

We hope you can see the potential like we can and help us bring this game to market, we currently work on this game constantly and will continue to do so. This is our passion and hopefully will become yours too.

Screenshots and Video are of work in production with many features not shown, money, guns may have been added for display purposes but will be in the final game but may have to be earned or upgraded too.

There is an early stage video available here  : https://youtu.be/JCkeb6tFNXM

The only way you will be able to do this is to join the raiders and work your way up until your in a position to take your shot at ending ED:09 and its reign on the city.Here are just some of the exciting features of Cyber Rebellion
High graphic fidelity whilst proving good performance
Many weapons to choose from including standard and futuristic
A large environment to explore with lots to see and do
Plenty of side missions separate from the main story
Realistic gun handling and reloading
A fully customisable locomotion system
Various enemies and robots to shoot
and much more
We are extremely excited about this project, we aim to provide a compelling story that is not completed in just a few hours, also with all the side missions adding to play time.Zombie COOP mode, What could be more fun? Play in various locations against waves of zombies with a friend! (to follow after release.)We have worked tirelessly on performance, we did not want to sacrifice graphics for performance and have found many ways to keep the game performing well whilst looking great.We plan to release a dedicated Quest 2 version after the main release as this requires changes due to the Quest 2 hardware capabilities but we will once again aim to have a great looking game and will not provide a rushed release just to get it out there.Please check our FAQ for a lot more details We will use any funding to support this game, We will be looking to hire, voice actors, AI developers (Although AI is Working to a basic extent) and music composers.We want this to be the most satisfying Cyber style story VR game to date and believe this is achievable with your help.Although this game is very far along we believe gaining this funding can make this game something special.Of course this is not for everyone and not everyone can pledge but you can help us another way, if you like the concept and look of what we are doing help spread the word! In addition we will provide a FREE Oculus Quest key for any tier that features a copy of the game, this is ONLY pending acceptance by Oculus and also will come at a slightly later date.(No confirmed date at present)If we hit the following funding we will implement the following£10,000 - A Zombie COOP Mode£11,000 - A Complete custom soundtrack with download links£20,000 - A complete new city to explore (doubling gameplay)We want to bring a full Cyberpunk environment to VR, with lots of action and ambience of a cyber city.We are confident we can fulfil everything we have promised and more. the game currently is playable and even it its current state provides the "wow" factor.We are not looking to provide a "tech" demo this will be a full game with many hours of gameplay and with a high replay ability value due to the different factions included.Also to be added at a near future date is a multiplayer Zombie mode, in the city and other areas.We hope you can see the potential like we can and help us bring this game to market, we currently work on this game constantly and will continue to do so. This is our passion and hopefully will become yours too.Screenshots and Video are of work in production with many features not shown, money, guns may have been added for display purposes but will be in the final game but may have to be earned or upgraded too.There is an early stage video available here  : https://youtu.be/JCkeb6tFNXM

Bref résumé

Les contributeurs financent des idées qui leur plaisent et des personnes en qui ils ont confiance. Voici quelques pistes à suivre dans cette section :

  • Présentez-vous et parlez de votre parcours.
  • Décrivez brièvement votre projet et pourquoi il est important à vos yeux.
  • Expliquez l'importance du projet auquel les contributeurs vont participer.

N'oubliez pas, restez concis mais original. Demandez-vous : si quelqu'un s'arrêtait de lire à cet endroit, serait-il prêt à faire une contribution ?

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Fournissez plus de détails aux gens :

  • Expliquez le montant du financement dont vous avez besoin et à quoi il va servir. Soyez clair et précis : les contributeurs ont besoin de vous faire confiance pour vous aider.
  • Parlez de vos contreparties uniques. Suscitez l'intérêt de vos visiteurs !
  • Décrivez où les fonds iront si vous n'atteignez pas complètement votre objectif.

L'impact

N'hésitez pas à expliquer votre projet plus en détail et indiquez aux visiteurs en quoi leur contribution fera la différence :

  • Expliquez pourquoi votre projet est précieux pour le contributeur et pour le monde.
  • Mettez en avant vos expériences réussies sur des projets tels que celui-ci (si vous en avez).
  • Rendez votre projet concret aux yeux des visiteurs et suscitez la confiance.

Risques et défis

Les gens apprécieront la transparence de vos propos. Soyez ouvert et démarquez-vous en exposant les risques et les obstacles auxquels vous allez peut-être faire face pour atteindre votre objectif.

  • Expliquez pourquoi vous pensez être en mesure de relever ces défis.
  • Décrivez comment vous comptez résoudre ces éventuels problèmes.

D'autres façons d'aider

Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas aider :

  • Demandez aux gens de passer le mot et de faire de la publicité autour de votre projet.
  • Rappelez-leur d'utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

Et le tour est joué.

story:
Big Picture – Over-Arching Worldwide Strategy – To build a prepaid debit card platform for the Western Hemisphere under the common brand name of “Ultima Money Card” – American Capital Partners will be the only prepaid card issuer with a footprint in all of the Americas to basic banking services to the hundreds of millions of people who are unbanked/undeserved:

 

In the U.S. to cover North America, with a less expensive and more comprehensive prepaid card product than Green Got or NetSpend that offers money transfer at 50% savings to Western Union or MoneyGram to serve primarily the 40 million people in the U.S. who have Latin/Hispanic origins and the 75 million unbanked people – with a better, cheaper card platform for money transfers and to make purchases with MasterCard Debit Card – good at 20 million merchants worldwide and on the web. The Ultima Money Card can be loaded at many of the 2.3 million STAR locations, at MasterCard Repower merchants – 125,000 and in the future in the “cloud” with check images from smart phones.

 

In the U.S., the prepaid market is $140 billion in loads and the money transfer market is $40 million sent to LAC annually; and

 

In Panama to cover Latin America and the Caribbean – “LAC”, initially purchase a micro bank in Panama to issue payroll/prepaid debit cards, make collateralized “micro” loans and take deposits for the hundreds of millions of people across LAC who are unbanked. In LAC, upwards of 80%-90% of the general population do not have access to basic banking services, loans or card products, with little or no competition.

 

Worldwide there are over 20 million merchants that accept MasterCard Cards and there are over $250 billion in money transfers.

 

In short, we will provide the “little guys” a more level financial playing field with low-cost alternatives to big banks with high fees and in most cases do NOT serve hard-working, low-income consumers in the U.S. and across LAC.

 

Risk:

 

The primary risk to the business’ success is the continuing need for capital to grow and expand across the Americas. Three millions is the funds required to start operation, with existing commitments from private equity firms to purchase capital stock when the company is in operations – 4-6 months.   

 

All the product features are available from existing commercial processors, networks and service platforms, including STAR and MasterCard. All of the product services envisioned comply with U.S. regulations and the laws of Panama.
