Recently featured in

Pour les details du produit en français -> www.fieldwiz.com
Für Infos über das Produkt auf Deutsch -> www.fieldwiz.com
Para mais detalhes sobre o produto em português -> www.fieldwiz.com
Para más informaciones sobre el producto en español -> www.fieldwiz.com

FieldWiz is a strategy and physical performance measuring tool for outdoor team sports players. It is a standalone device worn on a player’s back to collect statistics, which are synchronized at the end of the game or practice with any mobile device via Bluetooth. Data represented on the mobile application or the online account includes:

Metrics can then be compared between games, players, positions, etc. and enable you to get the most out of collected data.

Your benefits

  • Stop guessing, compare objective data
  • Set goals and measure progress
  • Adapt your practice sessions to your game behavior
  • Fill the gap between the as-is and the to-be situation of your strategy
  • Bring your game experience to the next level

What's new?

Although like systems are available, they are highly complex - only attainable by the wealthiest teams with dedicated staff to operate them. FieldWiz aims to make quantified self technology affordable with a simple to use, standalone system.

The system is composed of:

  • One device

  • One vest

  • One mobile application (iOS or Android)

  • A docking station in a caring case for the team packages

Created in Switzerland, the product is based on a 10hz GPS technology and an accelerometer. The device measures 65mm x 65mm x 10mm and weighs 45 grams. Data is synchronized via Bluetooth to any mobile device with a receiver. The battery for each system lasts for up to 10 hours.

The docking station delivered with the team package includes a metal case and a central charging system. For devices sold individually, a charging USB cable is included.

PLAY - SYNC - ANALYZE - OPTIMIZE

1. Play

It’s easy. Turn on your FieldWiz by pressing the button. A green LED light shows you that it is on. Insert it into the vest.Get ready. Play. It can be used for a governed game or regular practice.

For teams, each device has a unique number which is then assigned to a player on the mobile application.

2. Sync

At the end of a game or practice session, collected data is synchronized with your mobile device via Bluetooth.

1.  Simply start the application on your mobile device

2.  Make sure the FieldWiz(s) you want to sync are within 5 meters of your mobile device

3.  Follow the steps in your application to set the parameters required in order to select only relevant data

4.  Set additional variables that will help you better optimize your game

5.  Wait until the data is synchronized and ready to analyze

Data is synchronized locally on your mobile device as well as online - making it available in your web account on fieldwiz.com.

If you are a team, you will be able to match the devices with the players on the web account or mobile application.

3. Analyze

Heatmaps of the covered zones for each player, replay of whole games, phases of play, physical statistics including sprints, distance, speed and accelerations. All data is represented in a user-friendly interface on your mobile device. Data is also synchronized on the web and can be accessed at any time from your online account.

4. Optimize

Now, it’s time to get the most of FieldWiz - interpret the results to gain a competitive edge. There are many ways to optimize your game and FieldWiz could be:

An analysis and decision making tool allowing you to gather facts and statistics, and compare players between games and positions over time, etc. and in the end, make the best decision.

A demonstration toolto better communicate your strategy, show game phase, and compare the “as is” situation with the “should be”.

A motivation tool for you and your players. Set measurable goals during practices and games, track progress and encourage healthy competition within the team.

An entertaining tool to extend the game experience: share, analyze, compare, suggest and discuss with your teammates after a match in the stadium or online.

And so much more, it is up to you…



The history

After generations of functional prototypes, we have fully optimized the FieldWiz hardware for reduced size, complexity, and power consumption. Meanwhile, we’ve enhanced our algorithm and basic application through test games with several teams of different levels. We gathered feedback over the last six months from team staff and players, which has resulted in the actionable data – and the best value.


Now: we need your help!

The electronic device and the vest are ready to be produced. The alpha version of the software is developed and has been used to test the current prototypes. To make it a world class multi-platform application (iOS and Android), we need your help! Reaching our goal will allow us to hire the needed development force and give you the best user experience.

The future: it’s only the beginning!

The FieldWiz journey will not end after reaching our goal and delivering the first version. It will be the beginning of a long adventure! We have so many features we want to add to FieldWiz, and we keep on innovating. Some future projects will include:

-  Heart rate monitoring integration

-  Real-time monitoring

-  Google Glass interface

-  New metrics

-  New reports and practice plans

-  New data communication

-  Ball possession integration

-  Number of completed pass

-  New algorithm

-  And many more…

Be ready for some new innovation! Why not stretch the vision?

Should you have any particular wish or a new idea, please let us know: gogo@fieldwiz.com


Contribute to our campaign and get your own FieldWiz

Why 50’000$?

That is the minimum amount we need in order to:

  • Build a world-class and multiplatform mobile application

  • Get the first production batch

  • Finish the docking station development

  • Have a great and convenient packaging

JULIEN MOIX: Midfielder

Even though he has been a defender since he was five years old, Julien plays the role of midfielder on FieldWiz's team, distributing requirements between the field-reality and technique. His IT background is a strong asset for the project.

LIONEL YERSIN: Forward

With his track record as an entrepreneur and electronic wizard, he is the one who takes risks and scores goals for FieldWiz.

MICHAËL DIZERENS: Defender

With his strong financial background and football enthusiasm, Michael will keep FieldWiz safe and healthy. On our team, he is definitively the sweeper.

KEVIN JAQUIER: Rookie

Freshly transferred to the FiedWiz team during the summer “Mercato”, his programming skills will start bringing our mobile application to life.

Can FieldWiz be used in a governed match?

Yes, as this technology is already used by the wealthiest teams when playing in stadiums non-equipped with tracking camera systems. FieldWiz is even smaller than certain GPS devices used by the top 100 teams in Europe.

Can we use FieldWiz under any weather condition?

In Switzerland, we had an awful summer 2014. While this wasn’t great, it was a good way to test FieldWiz in extreme conditions: rainstorms and heat wave. FieldWiz behaved perfectly.

Will wearing FiedWiz bother me while playing?

No, we have tested the vests with more than 100 players. The device stays put and remains unnoticed. We ensure you’ll forget all about it as soon as you start running.

Such systems already exists, why is FieldWiz different?

Existing systems are highly complex with several great features, including heart rate monitoring and real-time tracking. However, it is only meant for the wealthiest teams and requires dedicated staff to operate. FieldWiz aims to make the technology affordable with a simple and standalone system. If you find a product more affordable than FieldWiz, please do let us know.

What is the difference between products like Adidas mi-coach Speed Cell and FieldWiz?

The technologies used are different.
The Speed Cell is a great product, it is based on an accelerometer, which gives information on distance, speed and accelerations. Nevertheless, it does not allow for any movement representation on a field. FieldWiz is based on GPS technology, which enables accurate data as well as more functionalities, including heatmaps and replay functions.

Can we use FieldWiz for any outdoor team sports?

FieldWiz has been primary developed for football (soccer), but can be used for many other outdoor team sports like American football, field hockey, rugby, polo, etc. The main requirements are that the sport is played outside on a delimited field and has a start and finished time. If the featured statistics and functionalities should not be sufficient for your sport, feel free to contact us.

Please let us know if you have any questions, comments or suggestions!

Email Support at gogo@fieldwiz.com

Don't forget to like and follow us for the latest information

Like Us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/fieldwiz

Send us a tweet: @fieldwiz

For inquiries regarding Distribution, Retail, and Partnerships please contact us at: info@fieldwiz.com

.

Thank you so much

story:
Official website: www.ethos.gg

Featured on: The Daily Dot Esports / ProtatoMonster / Gamasutra / GameSkinny / RedMercy

If you wanted to play soccer, you can easily look for a local community league to join, play, have fun, and meet new people.  Right now, that doesn’t readily exist with gaming. And that’s one of the reasons why we created Ethos!

Having participated in a few leagues before, we recognized that every successful league needs 2 things: great teammates and balanced competition.    

We started with the frustrations of the current system: 

  • Difficult or uncooperative teammates
  • Unbalanced competition
  • Grinding out long seasons
  • Repetitive in-game rewards
  • Searching for a supportive and active community

Ethos provides an alternative gaming outlet for the masses that will alleviate many of the frustrations, while complementing our experience playing the games we love. 
 

 


What makes Ethos different?

  • In-depth matchmaking features - include factors like preferred roles, play styles, objectives, and some of our own factors like teammate ratings, reliability ratings and etc. (we can even have local leagues in the future!)
  • Flexibility for competition schedules and structures
  • Scheduled gaming - so you know when and who you are playing
  • Individual profile and badging systems
  • Team profile and badging systems - improving team play and record
  • Rewards for completing leagues
    • Only a few gamers are good enough to play for money AND win on a consistent basis. Our philosophy is play for fun primarily and get something good as an added bonus

How will it work?

  • Everything will exist on your browser, so no additional programs to download!
  • Two types of queue - solo (partial party) or team (full party) - Queues won’t be instantaneous, but you will be notified when leagues are set up
  • Various competitive & fun leagues
    • Premier leagues - for the most competitive teams to play
    • Competitive / For Fun leagues - for those individuals or teams that want to compete with a little more incentive
    • Custom leagues - for those who want the independence to have their own league play without using our matchmaking system
    • Micro leagues - for those individuals and teams that want to try the league features or play in small groups
       

             

 

Which games will it include?

Primarily League of Legends, but we hope to launch with 2-3 other titles (Hearthstone, CS:GO, and/or Overwatch). From there, we want to expand to cover games like  DOTA 2, SMITE, Rocket League, and any of your other favorite games.

Currently, Ethos will be PC based, but we hope to support consoles in the future.

 

Support us, get perks!

Ethos perks are designed to thank our early supporters as we validate the idea and build a core base. If you believe in the project or our ideals (even a little bit), please consider donating $1 to show your support. It would mean the world to us.

 

Why do we need your support?

Honest answer: we need it to validate our assumption that there is a group of gamers wanting MORE from the current gaming experience. We have the team and partners to build Ethos the right way in its entirety; we just need to know that the gaming community wants it. Your funds will go towards the initial platform build-out with as many of the top features you voted on at ethos.gg. Help us prove the need for Ethos by supporting the campaign!

story:
TEEN WITCHES ACADEMY is a Visual Novel Game in which you'll take the role of MC, and ancient wizard, who has been imprisoned and deprived of his powers, after been framed by the World Mage Council...

A mysterious wizard, called Gorath, will give him his freedom back, in exchange for his help for the sabotage of the TEEN WITCHES ACADEMY, a school of magic where mages and witches of the future can study and learn...

MC will accept to sabotage all the student's and academy's activities, and will take the role of the Headmaster of the Academy.

You will have to face daily school issues, pretending to act for the good of the Academy, but in the meanwhile You'll have to find the way to let all the activities fail, and to sabotage students, teachers and other fantasy creatures related to the school.

The game will be a mix of enigmas, quests and plots, and dinamic magical fightings!

 

At the moment the base of the game is ready and we are working hard to improve and to complete hours and hours of playable content.

The complete game will have thousands of images and hundreds of original plots to solve and several achievements to reach.

In addition to MC, the game will have a lot of other Characters, as Students (witches and mages), Teachers, Villains and Mysterious Creatures...

The 4 Houses:

 

Francine, Deidra, Harrietta and Mbanga, four students of The Flying Kraken House

Vladimir, Katerina, Gemma and Corinne, four students of the Ghostly Deer House.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Karissa, Adelaide, Xue and Jade, four students of the Marmoreal Lion House.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Eileen, Larry, Bikilu and Ida, four students of the Scavenger Blood House.

Teachers:

We will unlock female Teachers of the Academy every two days during the campaign progress, please stay tuned to meet them!! 

Our Goals:

During the campaign we will unlock updates and new features related to the project, following this path:

500 € - Campaign Funded!

2000 € - Extended musical track list...

6000 € - Extended NSFW illustrated scenes...

12000 € - Added animated scenes...

35000 € - Voice acting!

Some gameplay samples:

 

Vice-Principal Gwendoline Dove in MC's office...

Turn students against each other...

Oracle uses to entrust valiant missions to students...

Plan your moves from your office...

Fight villains, or upgrade your fighting skills...

Academy will have a lot of characters...

A thrilling moment in the school...

A sabotage in progress...

Katerina is stealing an invisibility potion!!!...

An alchemy lecture in progress...

Please keep in touch with our campaign to give us your precious feedbacks, to find out  new and unlocked features, and expecially to SUPPORT US!!! :)

Thank you so much for your attention,

DRUNK ROBOT!!!

story:
Welcome to the fast-paced future dystopian world of The BitJackers, stars of a randomly-generated twin-stick shooter with infinite longevity and an engaging, intriguing plot full of twists and turns.

Made by a deeply passionate, long-term ‘solo’ game developer, finally collaborating with some fantastically talented people who can, thankfully, make up for my glaring artistic weaknesses.

 

Basic Gameplay

Move around a boxed-in level, known in-game as ‘Sectors’, based on one of 10,000 current possible combinations with an almost infinite number still to come. Collect shiny ‘bits’ and fend off increasingly hostile security protocols, personified as terrifying cyber-monsters, until the exit opens up and paves the way to the next sector.

If it sounds simple, that’s because it is. A gameplay staple probably best-known from the hit arcade game  (and personal childhood favourite) ‘Smash TV’,  given a unique randomly-generated twist and a separate, well-written story mode.

In Arcade mode, sectors and their corresponding difficulty level will gradually increase on to infinity, giving you an endless challenge of reflexes and skill.

In Story mode, you’ll pass through custom-designed sectors, with stylish cutscenes and a wide variety of interesting characters, in engaging situations, lasting for at least four hours of well-paced gameplay.

Then, of course, there’s the ‘bonus stuff’. I love ‘bonus stuff’, so there’ll be a vast array of that to work towards, such as challenge levels, time trials, player skins (one of which, if you’re feeling particularly extravagant, can be modelled on your own image) and other such wonderful optional stuff.

Essentially, The BitJackers will be a fully-featured, polished, old-school arcade game with addictive, fast-paced gameplay that could theoretically last you for the rest of your life.

Sorry, who are you, again?

My name is Zayne ‘Zed’ Black, and I’ve been making games for a long, long time. Sadly, none of them look particularly impressive, but they’ve received numerous compliments from the people who’ve played them, especially for their charm and writing.

Anything you’d like to get off your chest before I carry on reading?

Funnily enough, yes, there is. I just want to say, before you consider any further, that I can give you an absolute guarantee that, if we hit our target, you will receive at least a polished, worthwhile arcade game. I can tell you this because I’ve already finished making it.

Aside from some difficulty balancing, a lot of testing and replacing the ‘borrowed’ placeholder art/music, the Arcade Mode is entirely done. It works, it goes on forever, and it’s taken a lot longer to develop than it should have, because I keep stopping to play it…

Just wanted to get that out of the way. I know how risky some crowdfunding appeals can look. I am, after all, a player of games myself.  

So what do you need money for?

Art and music, mostly. I am terrible at both of those things, with my efforts to date looking like something vomited into a bootleg Windows 95 Paint program. Lovely.

Thankfully, I’ve come across some talented folks within travel distance who can produce astonishing work that’ll make The BitJackers look and sound like the polished, professional title I’ve dreamed and know that it can be.

As the Joker once famously said, “if you’re good at something, never do it for free”. After a long time of trying to collaborate with artists either for free, or for the promise of profit share, I’ve come to realise that good work can only be acquired with a reasonable and fair amount of payment. Hence, this.

In-game artwork is being provided by James Biddulph of Jamo Games, who worked on the recently released Tax Evaders. I think we can all agree, he's got the stuff.

What do I get in return?

Well, an amazing game, made with passion and love, that I’m basing the entirety of my future career, hopes and dreams on. Also some cool stuff. I’ll be hopefully doing some videos and whatnot soon, better detailing the perks available, but you can actually put yourself in the game if you want. I mean, that’s pretty cool, right?

Okay, assuming this thing gets made, which platforms will I be playing it on?

At the moment, the only one I can absolutely guarantee is Windows PC. I’ve been told before that my games run fine on Linux via whatever magical alchemy Linux users have for running Windows games, and I’ll do my very best to try and get it running natively on both Mac and Linux, but I’m not going to make you any promises I might not be able to keep. So, for now, absolutely Windows.

In the future… I’d love to think maybe it might end up on PSN and Vita, maybe even the 3DS and WiiU eShops… But that’s much further down the line than “Let’s actually get the game finished first, shall we?”, so I’m not going to mention that anymore, either.

And, assuming you DO get funded, when is it out?

I’ve never worked with an artist and a musician before, so I don’t know exactly how long it’ll take for them to do the work I want them to do, but I’d like to think that three to six months from the end of the campaign sounds reasonable.

Of course, I’m a very transparent, honest person, so if there ARE any delays to the process, I’ll let you know immediately.

What if I have more questions?

Get in touch! I’m on Twitter, pretty much 24/7. @dedhedzed for that. There’s also my e-mail address (dedhedzed at gmail dot com), if you want a more in-depth chat.

So. Watch the video (please? It took me FOREVER), figure out which perk you want and hopefully help me achieve my dreams.

Thanks,

Zayne

story:
The Game!

PetLand is a multiplayer fighting game that is being created by our studio, Lollipop Games.

We thought so much about what kind of game we wanted to play, and we came with the idea that we want a game with a great multiplayer at first, so a fighting game that you can play with 3 more friends is excellent!

You can connect and play with your friends with your smartphone anywhere you are!

The controls and interface were made for a simple way to play, and you can have a great gameplay with touch controls or physical ones, even with a keyboard you will have a lot of fun!



 

Chars and Levels!

The game has 12 characters and 7 levels now, but more can be added if we reach some goals. Only 5 characters are being shown right now, but we will "unlock" more characters in this image on the next days. (Not all!)

 

Ultimate Moves!

We add the ultimate moves to the game, so when your energy bar is full, you can choose using your character attack or strategy ultimate.

This one is an attack ultimate:

 

Credit's Museum Screen

Why we have to make a credit screen like the others? So, this is our Museum Screen, and everyone that helped us can be there! You can be there too!!! The Credit's Museum Screen is a side scrolling level with our backers pictures, sculptures and names, like a real life museum.

 

A bigger PetLand world!

Not only a multiplayer game, it have a story, and this story will transcend this first PetLand game. We want PetLand to be a trademark, and we will create other kind of games on the PetLand franchise, like PetLand Racing, for example.

 

Goals!

We are using the fixed funding type, so you will be refunded if we don't reach our goal!

20.000 dollars are the minimum that we need to create this game. Reaching our goal will make this game be launched as soon as possible, but if we get more money it will launch faster and we will add some cool stuff to the game:

  • $ 20.000 - goal
  • $ 23.000 - more 4 characters
  • $ 27.000 - more 5 levels
  • $ 33.000 - multiplayer minigames
  • $ 40.000 - alternative final boss + secret character + secret level
  • $ 50.000 - we will make a free video documentary about us making the game and you will know how was our days working to make a great game. We will also put more languages to the game. The production will also be much faster.

 

Platforms!

The game will launch for several platforms, with a focus on the mobile market. PC, Mac, iOS and Android(this include OUYA) are now on this list.

 

Help us!

If you like our project, please help us! We need money, off course... but we need more than that, we want to make you happy playing our game! So, tell your friends about us too, and together we will make great games!!! Give us your opinion too, we will love to talk about!

story:
The Second Choice Hero
*Extra-Credits clip used with permission. Not an endorsement.

Current Update: Check out an interview by Emily Short here on Don't Save the World.

Short Summary

I am Alfe Clemencio of Sakura River Interactive. I work with a team to make games with interactive stories with gameplay. I'm starting this crowd funding project to make a game that will set a new standard in interactive storytelling in video games targeted to average gamer.

Don’t save the World: An RPG is a game where the effect of player’s choices are so strong they can change the genre of story and game. Live a life of adventure (RPG gamplay) or a normal life of running a shop (management-sim). Say "No" to saving the world!

The reason? I'm tired of being dissapointed at the promises of "Interactive Stories" and "Moral Choices" in video games. Usually along the lines of good or evil that doesn't affect gameplay that much.

It has been getting better recently but it's just not enough to give you the experience of TRUE CHOICES. (defined as choosing your own goals)

How can my small team and I do what AAA developers have trouble with? Don't know what to tell you other than we did a small test pilot of it already with around 80% review scores.

This is the 2nd Time We're Giving True Choices

To those that find our claims hard to believe, please be aware that this is the 2nd time we're doing this. We have experience. Take a look at our first game Fading Hearts! We got the reviews to back what we claim to do.

Reviews of our First Game - Fading Hearts

“...pulled twists that challenged my preconceived notions." -RPGFan.com

“...the game takes 'choose your own adventure' to a whole other level. You literally have freedom to do whatever you want.” - Inside Anime Expo

“It has an interesting story to tell, which can be as realistic, convoluted or outlandish as you want it to be.” -technologytell.com

Gameplay

Don’t Save the World has several game genres in one game. Optional turn-based RPG, optional Management-sim, and to glue them together there is the daily life sim. There is also the mystery elements of the story that hide away some of deep secrets of what’s possible in the game.


Optional RPG game elements

The player does have a choice to take the traditional RPG route. The player can go on a quest to cleanse the lands tainted by the dark lord and then eliminate the dark lord. The RPG battle system will focus on stringing a sequence of different actions together. Instead of selecting attack all the time with the occasional heal, now players may attack with one weapon and swap to another weapon while the first one cools down. Or the player could spend most of their turn with stacking damage boosting actions to deal a strong blow. However some enemies are too fast for certain action strings and strong against certain attacks. So one strategy won’t work against all foes.

Of course if fighting battles isn’t your taste...

Optional casual style Management Sim

The Flower Girl

Got too many ultimate weapons with no desire to fight? You can sell them for in-game cash to finance your store! So you can make even more cash! Choose to live a more simple life of running a shop and earning a profit in a management-sim style game.

Collect quality ingredients and make the best kind of gear that is suited to you. Or create items that would fetch a large price. Expand to a nearby kingdom and watch the cash come pouring in.

In this game, hero takes quests from you! That’s right! You can send the hero or other mercenaries on quests for items you simply don’t have to time to retrieve, for the right price of course. If you want you can send the hero on a quest in the most dangerous area for a useless item! You can also send them scout areas for new ingredients or handle a surge in monsters. I’m sure the hero would be more than qualified to do the job.

Daily Life Simulation

Everyday the player chooses what to do to spend their time. So one day the player can choose to go a nearby area to fight monsters and get treasure. The next day the player can choose to create items, sell them on the market, read the news, talk to the locals. The characters that you meet and talk with have their own story that is connected to the fate of the wider world. Or the player can choose to travel to a different town for a change in scenery. 

Moral Choices, Mystery

I bet you’re wondering about the moral choices and mystery mentioned in Don’t Save the World. How will this be different than any other game that promises moral choices? It’s hard to explain without giving you a concrete example.

Near the end of the game gamers might be given the chance to slow down or stop the hero from defeating the dark lord.

I will guarantee that some players trying to be “good” will try to stop or slow down the hero.

In this scenario you are not the hero and won’t be defeating the dark lord. If the dark lord isn’t stopped then all the lands will be flooded with monsters that will bring the cities and towns to ruin. The hero is definitely a good person and is trying to do good.

It’s because moral choices like this that morality meters won’t work for this kind of game. Can you figure out why gamers trying to do good would do something like stop the hero?

Summary

So there you have it. Optional RPG gameplay, optional management-sim, daily-life sim, moral choices and mystery, and most importantly... true choices where you choose your goal.

What We Need & What You Get

So we need around $35 K to make this project happen. This is to pay for the artists, composers, writers, editors and other awesome talent. That would be around $25K (a LOT of Art assets needed for an RPG). About $3.5K~ would be for combined IndieGoGo/PayPal international conversion fees. (Feel free to correct us if there is a mistake somewhere)

The rest of the $35K ($6.5K) would go to business expenses (accountant, lawyer, etc...).

You can get some great perks at each level. At the lower levels you can get a digital copy of the game and one of our previous games. As you go up you can get limited edition signed hard copies.

You can join the "Prophet Hunters" club where you get access to some exclusive content and be the first the developers turn to for feedback.

At the crazy highest levels you can name the legendary weapons and even name and design a character.**

** Certain restrictions apply as this is a highly interactive story enough as is

Creator Interviews

Get to hear a little bit of how our games are made in these interviews.

http://www.torontothumbs.com/2011/10/01/interview-alfe-clemencio/

http://inside.anime-expo.org/games/2011-05/indie-insider-interview-with-sakura-river-interactive-founder-alfe-clemencio/

Help us put True Choices in more Video Games!

By contributing towards this game you help give a strong reason for more video games to have true choices. These games are NOT choose-your-own-adventure books on a computer.

Support us by getting some perks or sharing this on Facebook and/or Twitter.  Help us make this happen! Click the links below!
